Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Families Visiting Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: PtownTMW
Reviews.Content: My partner and I joined my parents in a 2 bedroom room in April 2012. We were in town for a long weekend of visiting theme parks and catching up. The "villa" aka 2-bedroom suite had a full kitchen, living area, and en suite bathrooms in both bedrooms. We were all adults and at a point were we usually stay at higher-end hotels, so I honestly thought that the place was pretty average. Everything was there that was promised, the breakfast room had lots of hot and cold items for everyone, they had a pool, good location for theme parks. The breakfast I think would be especially appealing to families because it's an all you can eat buffet, so picky kids will find something. One down side was that the "business center" was one computer just off the lobby. It was the only place with a printer, but they didn't have the latest version of flash installed, so I couldn't print my boarding passes for my return flight. I was able to use the computer behind the front desk, but still - get a tech guy, you know? All in all, pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for those things in the LBV Area”
Reviews.Author: KnitsbyConnie
Reviews.Content: Got a 2 bedroom suite. Loved it. Everyone has their own TV to chill out with. Location could not be better. A few right turns and we were on I-4. Need to go to Disney world, LegoLand, no problem, I-4 West. Need to get to Seaworld, Premium Outlets Stores or Universal Studios, I-4 east. Shower in the master bedroom could use a little TLC, but essentially everything worked to get clean by.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with minor issues”
Reviews.Author: shisha2011
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in a 2 bedroom suite with my parents and younger brother: Pros: - Huge room for a great price - Breakfast buffet included ( 4 hot items- egg and bacon and sausage with a rotating 4th dish such as hash browns or skillet potatoes, oatmeal, grits, waffles, several bread items including bagels, toast and muffins, cereals, yogurt and granola as well as lots of fruit, OJ, apple juice and coffee) - decent sized pool (3.5 to 5 ft) with a hot tub- lots of towels outside (plenty of chairs outside as well) - fitness room was pretty updated - employees for the most part were very friendly ( one of the concierge ladies was not though) -sells disney tickets as well as offers ideas for local trips -one computer with printer for guests - great flat screen tvs ( 3 in our suite) - great location ( 3 miles from seaworld and down the street from the WDW entrance- loads of shops and restaurants nearby also but they are not walking distance) Cons: -rooms are slightly outdated (old wooden cabinets, tacky kitchen floor, wallpaper falling off in bathroom) -room service was not that great ( sometimes asked them to clean our room again because the first time was done poorly- they agreed however never showed) **note if you leave anything on your bed they will not make it -asked the front desk to fix the leaky pipe in my bathroom and that was never done -very tiny entrance Overall, I would stay here again if coming back to Orlando. The biggest change I'd like to see would be a better quality of housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel for Big Families”
Reviews.Author: pyaselli
Reviews.Content: As all the Marriott Hotels the beds are very comfortable, however the Hotel needs maintenance URGENT The carpets are dirty, the breakfast was terrible, the room was decent

Reviews.Title: “Hope you like the smell of wet dogs”
Reviews.Author: Joseph2762
Reviews.Content: This hotel allows dogs in all rooms. Beware if you are traveling with small children that will be crawling on the floors. Room had a terrible smell all week ruined our trip and enflammed our allergies. Hotel staff offered no resolutions or compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for our Disney visit but minor problems”
Reviews.Author: acwolfe
Reviews.Content: When we checked in for our 2-bedroom suite with a king, 2 queens, and a sofabed, we were informed that they also had 2-bedroom suites with 4 queens and a sofabed (strangely not mentioned on the website). This worked even better for our group of 7. We checked in on a Thursday and found another nice surprise, a Manager's special hospitality evening with free hot dogs, hamburgers, potato chips, salad, and beverages. Then each of our 4 mornings the Inn provided a sumptuous breakfast buffet with an amazing variety. The suite was clean and very comfortable, the A/C worked well and quietly, the wi-fi and TVs were fine in our room, the front desk was very helpful including a wake-up call right on time our last morning, and our grandkids enjoyed the pool.. However, we were disappointed to learn before we came of the limited shuttle service to Disney World, so we felt we needed a rental car for conveniently getting there. We requested no service in our suite for the 4 days and were happy to be left alone. Now for the minor problems which I wouldn't have expected at an expensive Marriott hotel. The clock was missing some numbers. The toilet seat wouldn't stay up when I was urinating without my holding it. The frig was quite noisy. The sheets in the closet were king size for the double-sized sofabed. The kitchen supplies were quite skimpy for 7 people--4 plates, 4mugs, 3 small bowls, 2 glasses, 3 spoons, no serving spoons, no detergent for the sink or dishwasher. One second floor dryer was out of order. The signs outside the 3rd and 4th floor laundries were missing as was the sign explaining the cycle times in the 3rd floor laundry. The middle stairs had no signs marking them on the 2nd-5th floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a few days at Disney”
Reviews.Author: 1957Joan
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The entire staff were friendly and attentive. Breakfast was very good and had a great variety to select from. Although close to Downtown Disney, it was very quiet and calm at this location. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Works for either Business or Leisure”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveller562
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many of the other comprable Marriott properties in the Orlando area, I was quite pleased with this property. Being a Marriott Platinum member, I did score an end-unit on the 5th floor, right next to the stairwell. My king-bed room was the more updated "L-shaped" unit with sitting area, kitchen and sleeping area. My room was also a handicapped room, so I believe it had more space. The room was extremely clean, quiet, and beds were very comfortable. The flat panel TV was quite large, perhaps 46". It swivelled between the sitting area and bed. The bed was extremely comfortable with a nice variety of pillows (of various firmness). The hallway had an odd (but not bad) smell which reminded me of an older hotel. I typically do not use the pool area, however, it was quite a nice size, and well-laid out. There is also a small poolside bar as well. The fitness room had two treadmills, two eliptical machines and one exercise bicycle. All were in working order. While small, the exercise room also had a large variety of free weights and two main televisions. Check-in was fast and efficient. The lobby area is a bit small. There is a separate breakfast area which is closed off from the lobby. I did not try the breakfast nor the manager's happy hour (Tuesday through Thursday from 6:00PM - 7:30PM) I read many reviews about slow wireless internet service, however, I did not experience any slow-internet issues. This could be because the location of my room is fairly close to the lobby. If wireless internet is important to you, you should probably inquire when you check in -- perhaps some of the rooms have a stronger signal than others. The hotel is not within walking distance of any restaurants nor shops, so a car is necessary. For tourists, I would say the location is ideal as it is equal distance between Disney and SeaWorld. For business travellers, it is very close to I-4, Beachline Expressway, and Central Florida Parkway. For me, the important features of quietness, cleanliness and room apperance are the most important. For these reasons, I am rating the property as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit”
Reviews.Author: george b
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before this one. I had no choice in the matter. This Place Is Awesome!!!!!! I came here on business and my length of stay was 10 Days. 10 Wonderful days!!!! The management deserves credit for making my stay at this hotel the best in my history of staying in hotels. I am so glad i did not bring my 5th wheel RV. They will bend over backwards to make your stay a pleasent one. Response from these guys is very quick. I consider myself a very needy person in the retrospect that i need absolute perfection in cleanliness and functionability. I received it here! If you stay any where when you go to disney or sea world make sure you give this place a try. If you need a conference room for business like i did then even better. The staff will accomidate your every need.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: Barry A
Reviews.Content: Another average Residence Inn. Everything was basically ok but could of easily been better. The room was spacious but the mattress was lumpy, the sheets were clean but worn, and the towels were very rough. Breakfast was enjoyable but something tasted prepackaged. But like I said, it could of been better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Great family experience”
Reviews.Author: DavidrIglesiasS
Reviews.Content: Really nice, I was last week of March wtih my wife, my two little girls and father&mother in law! basically the suite is a two independent room, great location at 5 minutes to Disney, very good service. Definitely I will stay there again and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Renny79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista for 14 nights from March 23-April 6, 2012. We chose this hotel because we have stayed at Residence Inns before and of all the Residence Inns in Orlando this was the best value in the area we wished to stay. I am so glad we chose this hotel. As a frequent traveller both for business and pleasure, I have had the opportunity to stay in many hotels and must say I was impressed by the service at this property. It is extremely well run. You can tell they have hired the right people for the right jobs as everyone seems happy to work there and it is a true team environment. The General Manager is not scared to get his hands dirty as he was even in the breakfast room on more than one occassion helping to clear dishes. All this translates into happy staff and excellent customer service. Here are a few helpful details: Breakfast - the breakfast runs 6:30-9:30 M-F and 7-10 on the weekends. The hotel was sold out during our stay and we never had a problem finding a seat. We also got to see the breakfast food rotation. I can honestly say I ate off this buffet for 14 days and didn't get tired of it. They have muffins, toast, bagels, juice, fruit, yogurt, 3 waffle makers (with all the toppings), cereals, scrambled eggs and sausage rounds daily. The rotational food items consisted of croissants, biscuits, bacon, hasbrown potatoes, pancakes and french toast. Manager's Reception - Tuesday-Thursday nights from 6pm-7:30pm. They post a schedule of the "theme" in the room. It rotates from italian night, mexican night, sausage and pulled pork night, hamburgers and hotdogs and "comfort food night", which is meatloaf and mashed potatoes or mac and cheese. It is great for a light dinner and select beer and wines are complimentary. Room - we stayed on the 5th floor in room 516 which was fairly close to the central elevator and lobby elevator. This room was on the hghway side and I can honestly say the noise didn't both me. The rooms are very well insulated from noise...we couldn't even hear the neighbours. The room was well appointed and had 2 tv's and free wifi. Even a dishwasher and garburator. I loved that the fridge had a built in ice maker so no need to walk the hallways with a bucket! The beds were very comfortable with 5 pillows per bed! The shower water pressure was also amazing (I missed this when I got home). There is a laundry room on each floor and rates are $1.50 per wash/dry (quarters available at the front desk). If you have a full load it is required that you put the dryer on twice. Pool - the pool is open 8am-10pm daily and the bar opens at 2pm. There are always daily drink specials which are fairly reasonable. Pool towels are available at the pool. There is a kids pool, hot tub and a main pool. There are also two outside showers around the pool area. As previously mentioned we were there during a sold out week and while busy we always managed to get a chair. My only wish is that parents would teach their kids to observe the pool rules (such as no diving and all kids must be accompanied by an adult). This is not really the hotels responsibility, but did see kids misbehaving as there was no parental influence. Location - I loved the location of this hotel. There is a 24 hour super walmart 3 miles up the road and also a winn dixies, walgreens, gas stations and various restaurants in the other direction on the 535. Drivers in Orlando can be crazy so I enjoyed being able to use Palm Parkway and Turkey Lake Road (back road) to get almost anywhere and avoid the I4 highway. The 535 road however can have a lot of traffic. We just avoided it at peak times. Overall this hotel was perfect. The only thing we missed was a balcony off the room, but knew this wasn't an option before we booked this property. We felt secure as a room key is required to get in all entrances (except main lobby) and when we did deactivate our key one day we had to show id to get it reprogrammed again. Thank you for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: Sagespop
Reviews.Content: We had the best time. Service was outstanding...so much more than we expected. Great breakfast and the room was beautiful. We had a family suite which slept 7 and it was outstanding. Half the price of a room at Disney. We will stay here from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: GramaAna
Reviews.Content: Management of this property is dedicated to paying attention to all the little details to make your stay a memory of lifetime. During our stay our little girl fell ill with a fever and vomiting and needed a down day of rest and quiet. The hotel accommodated our request for a larger suite as we were in a standard double bedded room in order to provide the privacy of a separate bedroom. Not only did they assist us with our move, Jeffrey at front desk which also runs the breakfast, insisted on sending up a complimentary juices and chicken noodle soup. The only down side, was that we never had room service for the 3 nights we were there, even thou we spoke with the house keeping manager. This attention to detail is truly appreciated and puts this property at the top of my list of all time favorite hotels. The onsite amenities make this a hotel all by itself. We hope to visit again soon. Thanks again to the team at Residence Inn and Jeffrey for the caring special touches to make our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, they keep up with the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: surfinginflorida
Reviews.Content: When we first entered the hotel I was a little concerned because the elevator was dirty and we were on a floor with college spring breakers sharing a group of rooms – but it was all wonderful. Our room was really big, and very clean. I have to say they must have the best staff ever – our room was always cleaned nicely, she even put my shoes together! The breakfast is great, but it is disturbing to see just how rude, careless and sloppy other hotel guests can be! I can’t imagine how the staff kept up with the mess, and with smiles! (I would have wanted to teach some parents some parenting skills!) The management staff is eager to make everyone’s stays wonderful, and had a laissez faire attitude towards rules e.g., they expected parents to ensure their safety of their children and didn’t interfere when the kids were doing dangerous activities like diving off the rocks. They also let this woman bring her dog to breakfast every morning (not a service dog) which was a health code violation. Great that it is a dog friendly hotel – but like parents, dog owners need to be responsible but sometimes management needs to remind residents of the rules. We had a great stay, and I truly admire the staff at this location! Helpful hints: The parking lot gets full and people park in the street – we always found spots in the back of the lot. Traffic congestion is really bad in this area – to go to Disney we found a “quick cut” to Buena Vista that bypassed a long intersection --- check Google maps for the alternative route. The hotel is not near restaurants, and the kitchen is not as well equipped as most Residence Inn’s. There is delivery, and a Manager’s reception Tues – Thurs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for families, and pets are welcome too!”
Reviews.Author: Clarendo_PASherry
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Residence Inns in various cities, I was expecting to be completely satisfied. This hotel is by far the best! The General Manager was always visible, ensuring all aspects of the hotel services were exceptional. The meals were outstanding, both during the daily breakfast service and the weekday evening meals. There is no need to leave the hotel, which means more time in their beautiful pool! Our rooms were spotless and comfortable. It was a perfect 6 day visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Laura A
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a great vacation location! Our family of 6 had a two bedroom suite and was very happy with it. We stayed for 6 nights and had plenty of room for us and 4 kids. Clean and kept clean the entire time by housekeeping. Fabulous job. The whole staff was great the entire time. The pool area is beautiful and relaxing! Outdoor bar and bartender, again, great! The daily free breakfast is perfect. Selection of food and service was wonderful. I forgot a battery charger in my room after we left. They found it and sent it back to me without any problems. We will stay again if we come to Orlando!! Thank you to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is showing its age...definitely not a 5 star location!”
Reviews.Author: ATLGirl2012
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Residence Inn in Lake Buena Vista during Spring Break for the past 4-5 years, and unfortunately, the hotel is showing its age. While the rooms do offer a nice amount of space for families, the beds are comfy, and it is clean, the rooms are starting to look a little shabby. The furniture in our room had lots of scuffs and scratches, the counter top in the kitchen area had several burn marks, and there was a hole (with visible splinters) in one of the cabinets. Our coffee pot didn't work, but it was promptly replaced when we reported it. It seems housekeeping is facing cut-backs as they didn't replace coffee, soap, or shampoo during a 3 night stay. There were only 3 bath towels and 2 wash cloths for 4 people, but additional towels were provided (again, very quickly) when we asked for more. The hot breakfast is a nice feature, however, once again, we got the feeling that the hotel was cutting back as mugs & cutlery were replaced with paper cups & plastic cutlery, and they ran out of fruit each morning we were there. This was probably the last time we'll stay at this location as there is a newer Residence Inn just a few miles away (near Sea World).

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great free breakfast, good location!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again!!! We booked a 2 bedroom/2 bath with kitchen (full size oven/stove, dishwasher, fridge) for a full week at Disney World. The location is close to the I-4, so Disney was a quick trip away (about 10 mins). It was a perfect set up for grandparents in the king sized bed and parents/kids in the 2 queen beds. We had great maid service every day and the full hot breakfast (waffles, yogurts, fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, grits, bagels, muffins, etc) was a perfect start to our full days of fun and better than most R.I. locations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay Offering Quality and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: NoVA_8
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed here over the last weekend in January through the 31st. The two-bedroom suite plus our favorable past stays with Residence Inns, underscored by a good value price, were our reasons for selecting this property. The Hotel offers the high quality of service, comfort, and amenities that one expects from a Marriott property. Staff was very nice and showed their appreciation for people (guests) choosing their hotel. The breakfast scored very good grade for quality and variety, offering several choices of hot and cold cereals, fruit, yogurt, beverages, hot breakfast bar and the ever popular make-your-own Mickey Mouse shaped waffles. It’s a bustling breakfast room seating many people with nice views of the courtyard that helps guests start their day of Disney adventure. Our room was clean and appointed with nice furnishings and the essential kitchen appliances, all in good working order. We stayed in a two-bedroom, 2-bath suite with my wife and I in one room and our teenage kids in the other. Amazingly, despite the hotel being full of families with many young kids and teen agers, the rooms were very quiet at night! We checked in on a Friday evening and when we went to breakfast Saturday morning, I could not believe the many young guests. The noise level or lack of noise level does not suggest a hotel of kids but they were all staying at the hotel. The hotel is next door to another hotel and situated in a quiet area at the end of a road with an empty filed across the street being prepared for development. Travel down the road at few miles in one direction and you find shopping centers and restaurants and quick access to Route 4, which brings you to Disney. Travel the road in the opposite direction for three miles and you find a Walmart operating 24/7, which is where we purchased a few grocery basics at a decent price. The only flaw I experienced, which was minor, is the chance a few guests might not find a parking space if they return to the hotel late at night, such as after midnight. That happened to us one night and we parked on the island in the middle of the entranceway along with four or other five guests. The island is on the hotel grounds and not on the public street. We found it to be completely safe and, as the hotel staff advised, it would not be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Dato B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not old but aging. Good location, close to downtown Disney, a couple minutes to Sea world. Room was clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable. The breakfast was good enough. Front desk staff was helpful and very friendly. Pool area was clean. Parking may be the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Staying Here and It's Still Great!”
Reviews.Author: DondiD
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here 11 years ago when this hotel first opened and it was wonderful - the breakfast served each morning was delicious and the variety suits everyone's needs (the Mickey Mouse shaped waffles are a huge hit for kids and adults!); the staff is extremely welcoming and is always trying to accommodate your every need; the pool and fitness facilities are well-maintained. We stayed here one other time in the mid-2000 and now just 2 weeks ago with my daughter's field hockey team. Everything is just as I remembered it! The fixtures and carpet and kitchen area is showing wear in the rooms but it's still extremely comfortable, convenient to EVERYTHING and the staff and facilities wonderful for families and team events. I won't hesitate to come back a fourth time.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: MCO_Addict
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the hotel on our recent trip to WDW. The rooms were a good size and had a full kitchen and living area. The beds were confortable and the hotel was is reasonable condition. We did find there was not enough parking for the number of guests and people ended up parking on the median over night. The breakfast buffet was kind of gross though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Golfers”
Reviews.Author: MEM-DMM
Reviews.Content: Four of us visited Orlando for a 4 day golf get away 2/10 to 2/14. This was our 4th stay at the Residence Inn. It is a perfect place for 4 guys playing golf. They have a few suites that have 2 bedrooms- 2 doubles in each- each with a full bath and then a large living rm and kitchen area in the middle. They offer a full free daily breakfast buffet that opens at 6:30 AM so you can make a 8am tee time easily. The bedrooms are pretty tight but work OK for us. Pool area is really nice and has a tiki bar. Tons of good golf in the area, some of our favorites: Orange Lake Legends (Palmer design) Arnie really outdid himself here! Hamony Preserve in St. Cloud- 45 min drive Eagle Creek- 10 min from airport, so a good 1st day or last day stop. Celebration- very nice Disney Magnolia- PGA tour course.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, tucked away with lots of room to spread out”
Reviews.Author: sissybabe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. We were traveling as 2 couples the 2 room bedroom suite with 2 queen beds gave us plenty of room to spread out. Loved having our own separate bedrooms and bathrooms. Beds very comfortable. Didn't use the kitchen portion but would have if staying longer than one night. Pool area was clean. Bar in pool area nice, freindly staff, good prices. Breakfast was excellent. Was a busy morning and they kept things well stocked and clean. The hotel is tucked away from the expressway making for a very quiet stay, however, not to worry... still easy to get to. We enjoyed our stay and will most definately stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “An great option for families - staff is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantViking
Reviews.Content: Our rooms had a bedroom and main room, each with its own bathroom. The shower and toilet in each have a door so family members can be getting ready at the sink and mirror while another has privacy. There was a full kitchen and small dining table. It was easily large enough for a family of five. The breakfast was fine with lots of options; the Mickey Belgian waffles with LOTS of topping options, cooked oatmeal with toppings, a yogurt and fresh fruit station, grits, eggs, french toast, sausage, breakfast burrito fixings, and a large section with bagels, breads and muffins. The hotel is aging a bit but really just minor aesthetics. The real stand out was the staff. Great front desk staff that made hussled to take care of my early arrival. I called down since my room didn't have a corkscrew they ran one immediately up (and at this price range I would normally have had to run down to the desk myself). They really hussled and kept the breakfast area filled, cleaned and cleaned tables available. As for location, it was terrific for the parks. A couple minutes to downtown disney, a couple minutes to Seaworld, 15 minutes to Magic Kingdom, and 20 minutes to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value, will need modernization in the future”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista for 10 nights in January with my wife in vacations following a business trip. The reason for selecting the hotel was the great rate including breakfast and internet and near Disney parks. The 1 room king bed had a good bed, but we could notice that mattress was not so firm. TV sets were large LCDs, and the standard kitchen space and amenities provided us the comfort we needed. Free internet was fast but not reliable at all times, it would disconnect you eventually from time to time. Towels were old, I would definetely suggest for them to buy new ones. Carpets also looked kind of old, and that contributetd to the impression that the room could be cleaner. Hot breakfast was very good, and the hotel also offers complimentary snacks and beverages 3 days a week, which I didn't enjoy due to the time they are offered. All interactions with staff were good. All very polite and looking to support you.Really near Disney parks and specially Sea World and its parks.

Reviews.Title: “Sawyer universal trip”
Reviews.Author: MushiMom
Reviews.Content: Once again we visited universal studios and the Marriott never disappoInts us. We have 3 children and the space in these rooms is perfect. I don't like to be crowded in a room, so we booked a family suite. Very clean, quiet, and comfortable. The only complaint would be at breakfast. Everything was great, except the space for breakfast. When the hotel is close to full, you cannot get in for breakfast. We stayed four days and only had breakfast once. This is a wonderful hotel, the only place we stay! And as always universal was completely Awesome! Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but best if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: flo220
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in a 2 bedroom suite in this hotel. The hotel was clean, the rooms spacious and the staff very friendly. The price was also very good. But you should be aware that, while it does offer shuttle service to disney, it is best if you have a car since it is not near anything other than 2 other hotels -- stores are not within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Residence Inn Lbv”
Reviews.Author: susan j
Reviews.Content: the staff was excellent, and the hotel was clean... i enjoy staying there

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aquarius008
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights from Jan. 1/12. We were 4 nights at another location by International Drive. I originally booked a pool view room but our room wasn't ready so I accepted a main floor 1 bedroom with a parking view. No big deal. Our room was right by the door so easy entrance and exit to car and also the breakfast room. Actually this room was the better deal as you don't have to deal with elevators. The room appeared smaller than the other room I had in the other hotel. We had 2 queen beds and the bathroom was in the bedroom by our beds. No big deal as it was just my 2 girls, 19 & 14 and I. The full kitchen was at the entrance to the room and there was a chaise lounge with a tv in this room and a tv in the bedroom. This is a big deal as one of my kids tend to hog the tv so no issues with this. The room was quite with no outside noise. The breakfast was a full size. My only complaint (to myself) was that some items tend to get cold at the buffet. Seating was sufficient. Breakfast was extended to 11:00 am which I like. My girls were at this point of the vacation feeling sick with a cold so they were resting and sleeping eg. they had a lazy day but we still had 1 more day to do Universal Studios. The day we went was a very cold day and we cut it short one hour to come back here. The pool area was really lovely but we hit a couple days of cold so we didn't use it. The sun somehow did not shine by the pool area. We did use the hot tub as that was very relaxing. We also had the managers reception on Wednesday and Thursday. The Wednesday reception was good; pasta with alfredo sauce, garlic bread, salad and I think another pasta. The drinks I think were unlimited but I had the wine and a beer. The bar was at the pool. Not that many people at the reception. My girls enjoyed their time with me and asked to stay another night. It was great. There is lots of restaurants around the area but not within walking distance. There was a little mall down the road. Downtown disney took me about 30 mins to get there because of the New Years day crowds. Great place. You can save money by the free breakfast. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good One!”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousPeople
Reviews.Content: very nice location, awesome hospitality. All in all a good place

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel suite”
Reviews.Author: jackiesamy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights recently in December 2011 before New year and it was very busy the hotel was full but the service was very good, the hotel is clean, and we got a suite w 2 doble beds, and a sofa cama in the living area where there is also a dining room and the kitchen fully equiped. the breakfast was extended until 11 am, great for us that we slept longer, and it was pretty good to be a basic buffet, it has more variety of what I expected, and better than the residence inn in Canada ave by teh international drive. the hotel is very spacious, a little hidden and hard to find, but was a great experience, is very close to the entrance of downtown disney , has alots of choices for restaurants around, but need a car to reach them. great experience

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Spacious New Hotel near Disney”
Reviews.Author: PeterRose14
Reviews.Content: A great location for a hotel - being both very near Disney and close to the other Orlando attractions. This is a new hotel that provides many perks - breakfast included, 'happy hour' on week nights with snacks and even dinner choices and complementary beer and wine. The pool is large and is clean with a good size hot tub. The staff are helpful, especially when issues arise (our room was not cleaned until the end of the day and on alerting to this, staff quickly came to fix the situation. The only issue we had is the lack of air mattresses etc. The one bedroom suite really can only sleep 3 comfortably, as the pull out couch is small. Having a few air mattresses around with extra pillows would really go a long way to help folks out in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney, awesome breakfast, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan N
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and spacious, we had the 2bed 2bath room with a kitchen. We did not spend much time in the room as we took full advantage of the proximity to Downtown Disney (~5-min drive),Universal Studios, and the shuttle to Epcot. If I had to pick one thing that I liked best at the hotel it would have to be the breakfast that came with our room that served fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, breakfast potatoes, and my personal favorite make-your-own Mickey waffles. Quick Note: The shuttle bus was very convenient and was not too busy as it only served one other hotel right next door. However for those used to staying at an on-site Disney Resort, this shuttle bus drops you off in a different parking lot about a 5 minute walk away. While the only stop is Epcot do not let that discourage you as you are now in the hands of Disney transportation system which is probably the most stress free travel experience I ever had. From Epcot you can take a Disney bus to the Animal Kingdom, Magic Kingdom or Hollywood Studios. If you are tired of busses, you can also take the monorail to Magic Kingdom from Epcot (my favorite) or go through Epcot and come out the other entrance and take a boat or walk around the beautiful and fun Boardwalk to Hollywood Studios. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, the location was close to all the action but far enough away to be relaxing. I look forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Check out this hotel if you visit Orlando; great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Praya M
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if I supposed to post how much I paid to stay at a hotel; but I was very pleasantly surprise how little they charged us to stay there. My wife with 3 kids and I along with my friend and her son shared a 2 bedrooms 2 baths. We stayed the week before Christmas. It was very cheap! Each room has 2 queen beds and it own bath. There is a kitchen, dining, living room with 2 persons sleep sofa. Flat screen TV in each bedroom and living room. The 7 of us stayed very comfortable in this unit. The hotel is clean. The rooms are clean. The free breakfast was great; not just donuts, coffee. It's full breakfast: waffle, fruits, coffee, tea, juices, boiled eggs, scramble eggs, bacon, tortilla, sausages, grits,oatmeal, hash brown, potatoes, toast etc... The hotel has plenty of free parking, Basket ball court, swimming pool, jacuzzi, gym. The hotel located in a nice, quiet area away from all those busy, noisy part of town yet close enough to shopping and attractions. Great value, great for family vacation! Did I motion it cost so little to stay there? One thing I wish this hotel has is jogging path. This hotel has limited side walk, so you can't really jog outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 5-Taking-A-Break
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 bed 2 bath room with 5 people. It was perfect. One of the rooms had a king and the other 2 queens. The sofa even had a pull out. The location was good. There was a convenient full grocery store about 1 mile away. The breakfast was amazing for a place like this. They had a great selection and they never ran out of food. Some days they even offer dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great week long stay while on business”
Reviews.Author: jwrembert
Reviews.Content: I booked a 6-night stay at this Residence Inn (RI) while working actually in Lake County. The drive was about 40 minutes one-way, but I didn't mind it being that this is hotel is in a great area of Orlando. It's within minutes of the Mall of Milenia as well as the I-Drive Outlet mall and I-Drive. The hotel itself was designed slightly different than what I'm used to when lodging at a Residence Inn but this is because the central area is the pool and the suites surround it. The design was actually very neat. I stayed in a 1BR suite. The first night I walked into my room to find a lingering food stench. I couldn't move to another room because the hotel was booked solid that night. The next morning I got up and the smell was still there so I went down to the lobby, told the clerk & was immediately able to have my room changed. The staff person that helped move my luggage explained since the rooms are "extended stay" type rooms, people often cook in the kitchen and sometimes the smells carry throughout the rooms but they deodorize the rooms when situations such as that occur. The breakfast was great with a wide variety and selection of items to choose from. The only negative I have about the hot items is that they often times when I picked out something and tasted it, it wasn't hot. This is no big deal since the rooms have microwaves. I did not partake in the manager's reception, so I'm not sure about the food selection during the nights it was offered. The rooms itself were nice. I typically stay in RIs when traveling so I loved that this hotel had the modern decor typically found in RI locations. The fitness center is great if you tend to work out. Overall, this hotel was great and I'd stay there again if in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: loimln
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom suite is an excellent value for 2 couples traveling together. We each had our own bathroom within our bedroom suite with a common living room/kitchen area in the middle. Beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. A little work is needed on the closet doors which were falling apart and did not slide very easily. Just off the main drag and very close to Disney. All rooms face the pool area in the courtyard. The pool looked beautiful but we didn't have time to use it There was a free manager's reception offered each weekday evening at the pool bar. Very pleasant place to stay. Will definitely visit again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: mmmrf
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and it was really a pleasant experience. It is close to all attractions and the food is great...

Reviews.Title: “lovely room great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: winton_of_jakarta
Reviews.Content: I came to Orlando for business conference and stayed here I traveled alone but they put in the family room which was very interesting. There is kids room decorated with oceanic style. There are 2 giant LCD TV with full channel. The amenities are not luxurious but of good quality. There is also self service laundry. The only problem is the distance to the community center is a bit far without car. There is community service to transfer us to the disney world. The breakfast was great. I love the taco that I don't normally have in my part of the world. In the lobby area, there is elixir water provided for free. I also enjoy it. The staffs are also very helpful in arranging taxi bookings for us. A little disappointment for me only to find the actual size of pool which is smaller than what they got on their website.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value near Disney and Sea World”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: i had the pleasure of staying at the Residence Inn at Lake Buena Vista, and was very pleased with the value provided. While the accommodations were not luxurious, they were very adequate and provided a great deal of room. I had a two-bedroom suite with a king bed in one bedroom and two queens in the other. The couch in the living area was a fold-out bed. Most important for the family were the two bathrooms. A nice kitchen area allowed one to fix meals if desired (we didn't). The breakfast, included in the room rate, was OUTSTANDING - high quality and a very wide variety of items. All of this was provided for well under half the price of a condo or a room at a Disney property. I highly recommend this location and I'm sure I will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for large family”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui-in-FL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located near Walt Disney World and Orlando shopping/restaurants. Right across I4 from one of the outlet malls. The property does back up to I4 and this was the side our room was on. We did not notice any road noise once inside. The decor is standard...nothing really posh or fancy, but it is clean and the staff is friendly. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite...perfect for family of 5 and the hotel is pet friendly so our Boston Terrier was able to go with us! The couch in the living room pulls out to a double bed, one bedroom has 2 queens & bathroom and the master has a king bed and its own bathroom. Each room has a large flat screen HD TV. Great channel choices. The beds are comfortable, lots of storage, full kitchen (full size coffee maker, dishwasher, hotel supplied glasses/utensils/plates, fridge with ice maker in freezer, microwave and stove), good water pressure with plenty of hot water (although Orlando water is hard). Good workout room and a heated pool (which was pretty, but it was a little too cold to swim). They offer a shuttle to WDW, but we missed the 10am shuttle by 5 minutes (our fault) so we drove to the park (3 miles or so). The best part...the FREE breakfast. It is a SPREAD of good food...eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, grits, fruit, bagels, toast, danishes, belguim waffles, oatmeal....we usually look for hotels that offer a free breakfast and I must say, this goes down as the best..both for quality and variety. .

Reviews.Title: “Small family reunion”
Reviews.Author: DesrtDrmr
Reviews.Content: We booked four rooms at this motel during Thanksgiving week. We booked two king studio rooms, one two bedroom suite, and one, one bedroom accessible suite with a roll in shower. We had guests ages 9 years to 70 years. We had a great time! The staff was mostly very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and welcoming. The beds were comfortable, but a little high for the short folks among us. We had one slight housekeeping issue that was taken care of immediately and with a smile. This location, while not on the Disney property, was very convenient. We did have to drive to get to a restaurant, but not too far. There was a card in the room entitled Room Service which had several different restaurants on it. We were all tired from traveling all day, and ordered pizza. It took over an hour and a half for it to arrive and the price for two large pizzas and one order of cheese sticks was over $60, including the mandatory tip. Later we saw boxes in the hall from Pizza Hut and other chain pizza restaurants, and we wished we had ordered directly. The breakfast was one of the best we have seen at a Residence Inn and everyone in our group was pleased. There were several different types of dry cereals, oatmeal, grits, fresh fruits, yogurt, waffles, scrambled eggs, a different meat daily among bacon, link sausage, sausage patties and canadian bacon. There were waffles to be self made, in the shape of Mickey Mouse............the kids loved doing this. There were bagels, muffins and toast, cut up fruit for granola and oatmeal, and make it yourself breakfast burritos or something similar each day. There were orange and another juice, coffee, tea, and cocoa mix. That was a great way to save money while going to amusement parks nearby, which were all expensive. The pool area was very nice, and had a bar. The kids actually swam at the end of November, although they did say it was cold, and they only did it once. Adults contented themselves with the hot tub and just visiting outside. Only downside to pool area was that you could not bring drinks in, you HAD to buy them on property. We're not sure if that meant you could buy them in the little store in the lobby, or whether you had to buy them at the bar. Some of our party did buy beer from the bar and thought it was a bit spendy. We should have asked for clarification on this issue, but we didn't. We really enjoyed our stay and would book again at this reasonably priced hotel. The only negative I can think of was that when we met in the lobby at 4am on our departure day, and wanted to check out, the desk attendant did not acknowledge our presence or even say hello for about ten minutes. He was busy doing something, and I guess he didn't feel that acknowledging the guests standing at the desk was one of his duties. That is the first unfriendly person I have seen dealing with the public at any Marriott property. Perhaps he should be working behind the scenes instead of at the front desk, or maybe he was having a bad day. All in all, it was a great stay, and we appreciate the hotel taking such good care of us and making us, for the most part, feel so very welcome. It was our first, and maybe our last, little family reunion, and exceeded our expectations. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Dog-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: sillyyorkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove to FL from NJ with our two small dogs to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. The hotel was very clean and attractive-- both the exterior of the property and the interior/rooms. Our room was spotless and pleasant. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I loved that the bedroom had a door that separated it from the kitchen/living room area. The room was very dark at night and quiet--excellent for a light sleeper like me. My only (small) complaint about the room was the way the bathroom door opened-- it swung extremely close to the toilet, making it a bit of a squeeze to get in and out at times. There was also only one sink/vanity, so my husband and I could not get ready at the same time in the morning, I had to wait for him to finish, but that wasn't a problem. The breakfast was wonderful-- very tasty with a lot of selections, including scrambled eggs, sausage patties and/or bacon each day, pancakes or french toast, and waffle makers (shaped like Mickey Mouse, which was fun!) They also had bagels and cream cheese, muffins, yogurt and fruit. The dog walking area was wonderful-- well-lit and lots of grass and trees as well as a paved pathway, and it was very clean. The hotel is not far from restaurants and Downtown Disney, and it is quite close to the Disney Best Friends Pet Care Center, where we left our dogs for daycare each day while we went out. The hotel has a really nice pool with a pool bar. They also offered free dinners on various nights of the week, but we did not get a chance to partake in this as we we didn't return to the room until late each night. I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and would be likely to stay here again when we return. We did not experience any problems at all while we were there. I felt very safe, even when walking the dogs outside by myself late at night. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: vikingstwinsman
Reviews.Content: I joined two members of my family who recommended I stay at this particular Residence Inn in Orlando. They have stayed there several times and said the hotel and friendly staff were exceptional. I agree! The hotel, friendly staff and great breakfast made me a believer and I plan on staying there again on future trips to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: earsropen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times with my family. It is very convenient to get to the Disney Parks and to Downtown Disney & Marketplace. The rooms are nice & spacious and the pool is very inviting. The free breakfast has a nice selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we needed a two bedroom suite close to Disney. The price, $143 per night including taxes and trip advisor reviews were the deciding factors. We stayed two nights and with trips to parks did noy spend much time in the hotel so cannot comment on all the amenities. The room itself was clean, tidy and spacious. Breakfast was fairly simple but there was a good choice of options and it is easy to fill up for the day ahead as you can eat as much as you want. This does add to the value as it is included. All the staff we spoke to were helpful and friendly. The hotel met all our needs and expectations providing good value.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Molly F
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at another residence inn and thought we would try this one since it is a bit closer to WDW. We received a free upgrade to a family fun suite which had an adorable little room with twin beds and sea animal themed painting n the walls. OUr six year old loved his room! The kitchen was huge with a full sized oven, which the other hotel does not have. There was comfortable sleeping for six though only three of us and three big flat screens. The carpet was a bit dated, but the room was bright and clean. the free breakfast was excellent with different choices on saturday and sunday. there is a large dining area so we never had to fight for a table. the staff was extremely professional and helpful. the towel rack broke off the wall at about 8pm and after a quick call to the front desk it was fixed in about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kweiss6454
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn again for our quarterly sales meeting. Once again the service was over the top! The staff here go out of their way to attend to your every need. All you need to do is ask. Location is incredible for variety of great restaurants. We had a big group to Kobe steakhouse, which is literally just down the road. Keep up the great work, will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Handled our crazy family with style and class!”
Reviews.Author: mavfan16
Reviews.Content: When selecting a place to stay for our week-long family trip, we certainly did our research: we needed a place centrally located, affordable, and something that could accommodate our family of four + two grandparents. Location: We couldn't be happier with the Residence Inn. By being at the end of a long row of hotels just outside the Disney World properties, it gives the feel of being "off the beaten path". I would recommend reserving a room a little higher up that faces into the pool area. Affordability: We got a great rate just by booking directly through the Marriott website. Additionally, the property has a tremendous breakfast buffet which is included in the price of the room -- literally saving this group of 6 close to $70 - 80 per day! Not to mention, we also took advantage of the hotel's complimentary afternoon/evening snacks in the cafe. Service: Here's why I decided to write this review. It's a shame that bad service experiences prompt more reviews than good ones, so here's my attempt to show off how happy we were with this hotel: After day 3 of our stay, my wife and mother-in-law decided to do some laundry. After going back to pull out the second load of darks from the laundry room (each floor has its own) they discovered it missing from the dryer. Chaos ensued. Accusations of lack of safety, poor service, and ultimately robbery were made of the hotel staff. The GM took it upon himself to rectify the situation, having us make a list of all the items we thought were in that load, searching every laundry room on his own up and down the hotel. After about an hour of searching, a knock came to our hotel room door. The GM had a pair of my boxers in his hand -- still damp. It turns out, my mother-in-law had never transferred the load from the wash to the dryer, yet still put $1.50 in the dry and hit "run". Needless to say, apologies were made. The GM handled it with class. We're pretty sure this will go in his weekly report back to the home office!

Reviews.Title: “A nice room that came with a roach and poor service”
Reviews.Author: florida70
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. It looked exactly as pictured on their website with flat screen televisions, full kitchen, living room, and separate bedroom. The front desk staff was helpful, but housekeeping was horrible. Also, it was a great location (convenient access to all the parks, WalMart, the FL Mall, and restaurants). The breakfast was complimentary but just okay; it was nothing to brag about. The first main issue I had was the roach in the living room that my sister killed (gross!). The second issue was when the housekeeper finally showed up, she did not make the beds, and although she took the used towels, she did not leave fresh towels. So when we returned to our room after a long rainy day, we had no towels! The third issue was on the day we were to check out, housekeeping knocked on the door to find out what time we were leaving. I responded by asking her what time check out was. There is no need for housekeeping to knock on each door BEFORE check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be upgraded”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: This property has been our base in Orlando for many of our yearly family trips. Stopped staying here a few years back when Parc Soleil Opened. By pure coincidence had to book a short four day family trip and decided to see it again. This place really needs to be fixed. Wear and Tear is noticeable. Room smelled like soup, towels where pretty beat up. Staff however is as nice as usual. Breakfast in the morning is also a good experience with the Mickey Mouse waffles. Will not stay again until the announce a fix.

Reviews.Title: “Probably more of 3.5 star stay”
Reviews.Author: gatorcountry112
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Residence Inn. Let me start this by saying that I was overall happy with the stay. The staff is extremely nice and was very helpful. We checked in and was given our room quickly. The reasoning for the 3.5 star to 4 instead of 5 is because this hotel is showing serious age. There was only one slow elevator in the building we were staying in but I never waited very long. The cabinets were actually falling apart some and the oven in one of the rooms did not work very well. There was an obvious repair to the ceiling in the first room and the lighting in the bathroom wasn't the best. The furniture was also showing serious signs of old age and use. The room did have three new and fairly large flatscreen TVs in the room. I had a family suite which was perfect for my group. A large king bedroom with the bathroom and closet and then a small kid’s themed room with two single beds. The room was very clean and the beds were nice. Although tucked next to I4, I didn't hear much traffic noise from the second room and none at the first. To explain a bit about the two rooms. We returned one night, out of three night stay, to find ourselves locked out of the room. I ran to the desk and learned that there was major roof leak and our room had to be moved. In their defense, they did try calling the number on the booking but the phone was left behind. They also sent a staff member to help pack up the room and move our stuff one floor down and management called within minutes to discount the one night stay. I'm sure they could of done more but we were happy with the staff's response and had a great rate anyway. We went from a pool view to the room next to I4, but all in all, it was still pretty good. The breakfast buffet is a plus and takes out the worrying about what to feed the kids in the morning. The location is great, especially if you know how to get around this area. It is very close to Downtown Disney and Seaworld. I can't speak on the transportation, but there is a shuttle service offered. The stay was interesting, to say the least, but work out perfect for our needs. I have stayed at every hotel on Disney property and many off. This hotel was perfect for a 3 day trip with young kids. I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, reasonable prices. Dog loved it too.”
Reviews.Author: rgill12
Reviews.Content: Nice place and dog friendly. Staff was polite and helpful. Room was neat and clean. Free breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS! No compassion for a child!!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at here for two nights with my husband and two kids, ages 10 and 4. The place seemed nice with a living rm area, full kitchen and separate bdrm. After staying there for 1 night, the next morning I noticed that my 10 yr. old daughter had numerous large bites on her arms and legs. I didnt know much about bed bugs so I wasnt sure if that's what it was. She complained about them being itchy. So I did some research on the internet and found they come out at night as soon as there is a warm body in the bed. We did a brief visual search of the mattress before she laid down but didnt see anything. Since I had to go buy something in the lobby I told my husband to ck the bed after she had laid down and the lights were off (about after a half hour). I got a call from him saying "They're here right in the bed. There were numerous bloated ones full of blood inches away from her!!!" Obviously they had just feasted on her. I ran to the front desk. I was hysterical, never imaging this could happen to us. It was about 11:30 p.m. I screamed, "you have bed bugs here!" There was a young girl at the desk who didnt seem to know what to do. I demanded they either move me immediately to another room or another hotel. I told them I would not pay one penny for this. She called a maintenance man to accompany me to help move us. I returned to the room to find my daughter crying and scared. All at once we had to pack up all our belongings and uproot my family in the middle of the night. The little one also was in tears. We were moved to a higher floor (this occurred on the 1st floor, I believe it was #105). We went to the 5th floor. The maintenance guy stripped the sheets and checked the pillows.He assured us it was okay. We had a very long night (it was about 2:00 am when we finally laid down). My daughter had a difficult time sleeping, worried about being bitten again). My husband collected some of the bugs in a cup to show the front desk girl, as proof. The next day the manager apologized to me. However, we just wanted to get out of there and go back home to NJ. This totally ruined our vacation. We were too tired and distressed to enjoy anything else. The bottom line was that the Marriott paid for my dry cleaning, which took 3 months to receive. (we went in May and got reimbursed in July. They refused to pay for an inspection of my home(just in case we brought some back). Now for all my daughter's trauma and a ruined vacation, the insurance company offered me $50 for her pain and suffering. I just wanted them to be fair with me and at least offer me complimentary future accommodations perhaps at any of their Marriott hotels with no strings attached for a nice vacation. Sure the mgr. insisted on wanting to give me a free stay only on Fri.s or Sats, on a Residence Inn subject to availability of a particular code, where not all accept this, depending on their location. However, the attitude of the insurance company was disgusting. They showed absolutely no compassion for what my little girl went through, and just dismissed this as a small inconvenience. I will never stay with them again. I work for a major airline and believe me, my hundreds of customers and co-workers will be informed of the unprofessionalism of the Marriott and the lack of empathy for its guests. I suggest you stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress. They are so acccomodating and can't do enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: Had a business mtg at the Hilton across from Downtown Disney. Decided to come down with the family (wife & two girls: 8 year old & 19 months), but thought staying at a standard room at the Hilton would be too cramped. Plus, we have assorted allergies & dietary preferences so we needed a place with a fridge. As I have Marriott Rewards, this was a no-brainer. We chose this property over the Residence Inn near Sea World because it was a bit closer to the meeting and had been more recently improved. The property was very easy to get to from the airport off of I-4 - just a few right turns and you're there! Parking was ample & free. We went for a two king-size bed room since it was priced similarly to other options. It turned out to be an excellent decision! The room opened to a kitchen/living area with a flat screen TV, and a king size bed and full bath just off the room. Kitchen had a table for 4 and the living area had an easy chair & a couch (sleeper, I believe). The other king was in a separate bedroom with another full bath. Liked having two bathrooms! There was a good-sized fridge, plates/glasses/utensils as well as a sink, oven (& cookware), a microwave and a dishwasher. Found the room to be very clean upon arrival, though I pity the person who had to clean it after we left... The hotel offers a *free* breakfast with eggs, sausage, biscuits, typical breads & spreads, waffles/pancakes (or something you could put syrup on, because there were packages of syrup aplenty), fruit & fruit juices. More than a continental but slightly less than an all-out buffet. The hotel has a decent-sized pool and an adjoining spa (hot tub) with plenty of poolside seating. There is also a small food stand/bar. Other amenities include a coin operated washer & dryer on each floor ($1.50 each), ice (only on the first floor), soda machine on each floor, game room, single computer & printer ("business center"), discounted tickets to all the parks & attractions (not just Disney) and a shuttle to Epcot that left at three a.m. times: 7:55, 9:55 and 11:55. The location was a short drive to Downtown Disney, International Drive, tons of restaurants and provided easy access to the Disney parks (being close to I-4). Even though the property backs up to I-4, we weren't bothered by any road noise. It's also just a few miles from a Whole Foods, where we got our additional provisions. The only downside was that our stroller got stolen out of our trunk, although it's unclear whether it happened on the property or at the Hilton where I drove to for work. In any event, it's always wise to lock your car doors. Also, the alarm went off throughout the whole hotel for a few minutes one night because someone burned their toast. Fortunately, the kids slept through it... All in all, a very pleasant experience and we will almost certainly stay there again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: danmax2007
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We had a 2 bdrm 2 bath, living/dining/kitchen and it was perfect for five of us girls have a girls weekend! . Big, roomy and clean. 3 huge flatscreenTVs, too. Breakfast in the morning added to the great value. Big pool area with a bar! Not far from lots of fun things to do. Would definitely go back! hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: phyllisjax
Reviews.Content: Our two day trip to Orlando was so nice thanks to our great two room suite at the Residence Inn Inn at Lake Buena Vista. The room was nice and spacious. Very clean and the most comfortable beds and pillows you could ask for. We really enjoyed having the full kitchen, complete with dishwasher and ice maker. The bathroom area had plenty of room and even had vanity drawers which was very helpful. Breakfast was impressive.....sausage, bacon, eggs, grits, oatmeal, waffles, fruit, yogart, coffee, milk, juice, hot tea, etc. By the way, breakfast is included in the price. Back to the room, we also had a large flat screen tv in the living area and another large flat screen tv in the bedroom. The living area had a sofabed, coffee table, chair, and a four drawer chest which the tv sits on. A dinning table with two chairs sits between the kitchen and living area. The pool area is really pretty and the pool is large and clean. The staff was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: Simply put, we were blown away by our stay at Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista. Not only were the accomodations perfect for our getaway, from the moment we checked in there was nothing but positive things to say about the staff, environment, etc, etc, etc. We will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations for families - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis D
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for two reasons: the hotel is centrally located between Disney World and Universal Studios, and we've stayed at a Residence Inn before at Disney Land and were very happy with the experience. Our experience at this Marriot has been awesome as well! The rooms were clean, well furnished and very comfortable in spite of the heat. The price for our two bedroom suite was incredibly reasonable, the included breakfasts were nutritious, varied and very tasty. In addition to all this, the Marriot staff was outstanding! They were all very friendly and helpful. It would be hard to single anyone out from all the great staff but we would like to give a special shout out for Adam at the front desk. He went out of his way to help us negotiate the fledgling public transit system in Orlando, as well as pointing out local amenities and how to take best advantage of them. We're now committed Marriot Residence Inn customers!

Reviews.Title: “Room Super Clean - Our stay was outstanding. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Steve123407
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent two nights at the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista hotel and I must say it was perfect. The room was spotless, spacious and looked like it was brand new. The breakfast was outstanding with the best selection I have ever experienced with a free breakfast. The pool and hot tub were very clean and well kept .All the staff we encountered were also very nice and helpful. We had an outstanding time. We look forward to returning again when in this area of Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlutz
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the Residence Inn in Lake Buena Vista in a 2 BR suite and were very happy with our visit. The daily hot breakfast was wonderful. I was very impressed to see staff replenishing items with only 10 minutes to go before service was to end. The breakfast area was huge and as it got later it did get filled up. The hotel is very conveniently located to DIsney and Universal Studios and a short drive away from many area restaurants. The pool area was nice, front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Although I did not go in the pool, I sat in one of the deck chairs and found the area comfortable and pleasant. The pool bar could have had better hours, I don't think they were open Sunday afternoon/evening. I considered the $145 rate to be quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Once and Done”
Reviews.Author: jreilly2010
Reviews.Content: Overall disappointment describes our reaction to our recent weekend stay. I concur with other reviewers that the facility is tired and needs to be brought up to current Residence Inn standards. Room was of adequate size but tired. Bedroom door would not close without hitting the bed. Bathroom shower was pretty laughable - new shower / tub surround by when it was updated the height of the tub floor was raised. Problem was the height of the shower head was not, providing a pulsating torrent of water no higher than my sternum. And I'm 5' 7"! I had to bend over to wash my hair or adjust the shower head so that it basically shot the length of the tub and against the far wall of the shower, resulting in a soaked bathroom floor. Breakfast was inedible. Good thing it was "complimentary." We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, helpful, getting a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Steve7419
Reviews.Content: Not sure how long this RI has been there, but I know we've been there a couple of times over the past ten years. What I love about this place is the availability of two room suites. For a family of seven you can't beat this place. We paid $169/nt. to house everyone and we got a full breakfast every morning! That's a deal in Orlando. The hotel is located a minute off Rt. 535 which runs right past the north entrance to Downtown Disney. There's tons of restaurants and other services nearby. Of course, D'Town Disney has all the entertainment options too. Be advised, however, that the convenience of the location comes with a dose of awful 24-hour traffic. It's always difficult to get to I-4 or Downtown or the parks just because of the traffic. Get used to it, it's still better than being out on International Drive or somewhere like that. So, the hotel has a good sized pool, big rooms, a game room for the kids, a work out room, laundry facilities for washing towels and bathing suits, and a big breakfast room. Add to this a very helpful and pleasant staff. My only gripe is that the hotel is starting to show it's age and the housekeeping services could be better. I had to call for extra towels every day (two bedrooms and I called yesterday should clue them in, but...) and most days the cleaning is really just making the beds and starting the dishwasher. Also, there are places where the wall paper is starting to peel. But it's not really bad. Certainly not bad enough to keep me from booking one of their suites for my family again.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Hotel not worth the price; itchy towels”
Reviews.Author: TybeeJJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay for families, but for about the same price, you can get two adjoining Disney value resort hotel rooms in Disney World with disney extra park hours and free transportation, etc. The rooms at this residence inn are dirty and the air conditioners are loud. They are also over-priced. Also, something in their laundry (towels,etc.) causes your skin to itch, turn red and get hives. It happened to every member of the family on both occasions. In need of renovation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Comfortable, Close to Disney and Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: polola21
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very comfortable for our Family of 6. We stay in a 2 bedroom Suite for 8 people. The beds are amazing, very cozy, we sleep very well. The breakfast buffet was great, with lot of choices and also Tuesday and Thursday you can eat a free snack at 4-5 o clock complimentary of the hotel. Very nice hotel highly recommended to Family´s visiting the Parks. Excellent Vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out!! Be careful when paying with your credit card!!”
Reviews.Author: TNmomofone
Reviews.Content: Be careful of holds placed on your credit card by this hotel !! At check in it was explained to us that a hold would be placed on our card for part of our stay plus a little extra in case of damages and at check out our card would be charged the full total for our stay. Well, that is not what happened. I had the full amount held on my card, which was fine because I expected to pay that amount. However, the day after check out, the hotel placed another hold on my credit card for $300. So, the full amount plus extra for any damages were held on my credit card, on check out the actual total for our stay was charged to my card, and the day after check out another $300 was held on my card. I had a total of $2000 (my bill at check out was $850) , in holds and charges placed on my credit card while on vacation from Residence Inn. The holds do fall off, but it takes 3-5 days for that to happen. I had to call the hotel for several days to finally get these holds removed from my card. Needless to say, this took up a lot of my available credit on my card while on vacation to Disney. I have never had this happen before with a hotel and we travel alot!! The room we were given at check in smelled musty and they moved us to another room which was better. the furniture in the room looked worn and dated. The breakfast buffet was horrible. The pool was large and not very crowded which was great. We will be returning to Disney soon, but will not stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very well managed property, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: PinkFloyd2001
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Residence Inn three times over the last 9 months. During a December stay, we had a horrendous experience when we checked in at midnight. However, when we brought it to the manager's attention, they went above and beyond what was required to correct the mishap. In my two subsequent stays, I have seen this property's excellence shine, as they take care of guests and the property itself. I saw the general manager of the property regularly walking around, making sure that guests were happy, and he even follows-up in email afterward (if they have your address) to make sure your stay is what you expect. A very rare gem compared to most other similar hotels where you're treated like "just another guest".

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: andrea
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this property. The staff was extremely accomodating as we brought our pets. They provided additional towels, etc and placed our room close to the elevator which allowed for easy access to walk down the stairs or take the elevator which was co-located near the pet walking area. For someone who has ever traveled with a dog, they know that all of these factors mean alot. The breakfast was included and I had no complaints, parking free and the location was perfect for our stay. The pool area was clean and so was our room. The only annoying problem that we had was the outside door to enter the hotel which did not work consistently with the key card. Otherwise, we will definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mediocre for a Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: ValKilmer
Reviews.Content: Finished an extended stay at this hotel. Found that the accommodations were nice, but not even close to the cleanest hotel I’ve stayed at. The first room we were put in had a noise in the furnace/AC compartment that would have driven us crazy. When I called down they sent up a technician. That is when the best thing happened, we got upgraded the family suit. (The room as not as clean as I like, I’ll bet the carpet hadn’t been cleaned for a long time.) The 3 flat screens HD TV’s were nice (but no wires to hook up laptop). There was a microwave, full fridge, and dish washer. The pool area was clean, but I never once seen the pool being cleaned. There was lots of “stuff” in the pool – Band-Aids, dirt/sand, black algae etc…. stuff that should be cleaned out. I don’t know what acceptable standards are for a pool, but they were on the line. The help in this hotel is very good. I just think its what they have to work with that isn’t that good. I have to say that the breakfast buffet was the best I’ve seen and I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels that offer the free breakfast. They had cereal, fresh fruit, waffles, breakfast meat, and juice. This was the best part of our stay. (I just hope that the kitchen is cleaner then the rooms.) The hotel is only 5 miles from Disney World and was very convenient. My main complaint is this: Bed Bugs… I myself got bitten by them. When I first asked about my spots when at the Universal Park first aid the Dr on staff there did not hesitate to say they were bed bug bites. When I asked about it to the Mgr on duty he told me that they had “never” had an issue with bed bugs. But then I spoke to other managers who didn’t seem as confident. I seen other people at the pool with worse cases of bites then I got. But when I spoke to the front desk about what I seen, I was told that “unless the people come talk to us, how will we know”. That kind of position is un-professional…. I like staying at a hotel where the management is proactively keeping the location clean and free of bugs instead of pretending that they don’t exist. The breakfast is not good enough to overpower the thought of getting bits at night. This hotel needs a deep cleaning, carpets, tile and the pull out sofa beds need new mattresses. I don’t think I’d stay in this location again or refer. Plus the wireless internet was very slow and impossible to stay connected. Also, our keys would stop working, the outside door locks didn't work most of the time. We'd have to walk around to other doors to enter the property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ladeyday
Reviews.Content: Treated my son, daughter-in-law, 2 grandsons, and myself to 8 days in Orlando. We stayed here for 7 nights. After a plane delay, and arriving at 2 AM, we stayed one night at another plaace (which was also fine, but not as good). We were able to check in at 10 AM whcih was a pleasant surprise. The 2 bedroom suite (with sleeper sofa was exactly what we needed. It was clean, spacious, and the plumbing worked well. There were 3 flat screen HD TV, a microwave, a freezer compartment which worked quickly, and towels in abundance. The pool area was clean and uncrowded. The staff was very hospitable, and there was always a dispenser of refreshing chilled "elixir" water (cut lemons, limes, and mint) in the lobbby. But the star was the breakfast buffet: pleanty of fresh fruit, hot items (including the Mickey Mouse shaped waffles), coffee, and fruit juice. It was never overcrowded and the women of the wait staff were very friendly. From what I had read in reviews, I was afraid of noise from dogs as they're allowed. However, I did not see or hear one animal. We stayed on the fifth floo pool sider, so any outside noises were muted. I booked the hotel through southwest airlines at the same rate that I would have gotten through AAA discount. It was a one stop shop. The property was located very close to Disney World venues and various shopping and dining choices, so coming and going was comfortable.
