Parking at the hotel was always available no matter time of day or night. There should be a law that all hotels are cloned to be like this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very nice rooms with full kitchens, and terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: elmococker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! The staff was attentive, helpful, and very accomidating. I would stay here again anytime. We were at the hotel for the week leading up to fourth of July. We booked a package with Disney tickets included. We needed a few more so they added them to the package for us. That worked out perfect for us because we were using Marriott Gift Cheques which could be used to pay for the room and any charges against it. They have a bus that will take you to Disney, but it only runs a few times a day. Great for saving on Parking, but not good if you don't want to keep to a schedule. The location seems a little far away from the main streets, but it is all the better for it. If you enter from the south you will see alot of congestion from the Downtown Disney traffic, but if you drive north you will have open road and a convenient on ramp to I-4 South directly to the Disney exits. This ramp is also the Seaworld ramp so you are an easy drive to Seaworld. The hotel is shaped like a big C.There is a small sliver of access to the pool from the parking lot. This is inconvenient if a few people want to grab a swim or breakfast and you leave the key with folks in the room. They were also getting alot of tour busses filled with kids dropped off at the hotel. Great for business, but they have the ability to get rowdy. I think this would be true at any hotel in Orlando. The staff is top notch. Li and Marc were particularly helpful and a pleasure to work with.

Reviews.Title: “We really loved it and would stay there again if we go back to Disney World.”
Reviews.Author: Donna_Newburgh_IN
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. It was close to Disney World and the breakfast was really good everyday. We stayed there for 7 nights and didn't have a single complaint. We usually stay at Hampton Inns but this trip sold us on Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: mmiller623
Reviews.Content: This hotel is meant more for family vacation than business travelers. Although, I will look forward to staying here again in the future. We had a two bedroom suite with two beds in one room and one bed in the other room. Perfect for us. This had a really nice pool, spa, and kiddie pool. We had one issue initially where our room smelled funny and the A/C did not work. The staff moved us to another room right away and it was much better. Excellent breakfast every morning. Keep in mind you are in Disney area so it will be crowded with families fueling up for their day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations and great location”
Reviews.Author: Calisto18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights while visiting Disney, Universal Studios and the Kennedy Space Center. We had a two bedroom suite (one with a king, one with two queens) that had two full baths, full kitchen and sitting room (with a fold out couch which we didn't use). The beds were great - we had a great nights sleep each night. Housekeeping was very good - they did forget a bath mat and bath towel for both bathrooms one day but that was our only complaint. Room price includes a full breakfast. The hot buffet changed every day and they also had oatmeal, cold cereal, yogurt and fruit, assorted juices, pastries and make your own waffles (including two waffle irons that made mickey mouse waffles which the kids loved). The dining area is fairly large - we never had to wait for a table. The pool area is nice and they provide pool towels. The desk staff were very helpful providing restaurant recommendations and driving directions. We had a rental car and the location was great - easy to get to all of the parks, plus lots of restaurants, shops and gas stations very close by. They do have a shuttle to the Disney parks but we did not use it. The price was very reasonable and it was definitely a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: luvdeals
Reviews.Content: buffet breakfast was wonderful saved us lots of money...must have Mickey Mouse Waffles! Very close to everything...about 1 mile from Walmart, grocery store, gas station, So many things to see and do. The rooms were very cleaned, every time we came back our dishes were done in the dish washer. We were close to the laundry facility! Very quiet didnt hear a lot of noises. Pool was great! loved the outdoor area! Loved the smell in the lobby! Marc was great to work with and a very friendly staff! made you feel welcomed! We loved the snacks in the afternoon! on Thursday was grill out day! save money!! Very close to Orange County Convention Center. We stayed here for a volleyball tournament! Very close to Internal Drive. close to an outlet mall, lots of places to shop! You will not be disappointed staying at this beautiful hotel! Thanks to everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff! :]]

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service!!”
Reviews.Author: Canitha
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and the rooms were great! Not to mention the price was one of the best deals we have ever had. They had a really friendly staff and the house keeping was wonderful. They offered a full course breakfast daily, a snack, and free drinks for the adults at the pool side bar. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Orlando in the near future. The beds were very soft and the rooms were spotless! My family and I will be planning another stay with them soon.

Reviews.Title: “Everything That Was Promised and More”
Reviews.Author: jwkrengel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Residence Inn from prior experience as well as the wonderful reviews found on Trip Advisor. One often wonders if the reviews are all genuine. My experience with this hotel is emphatically YES. We found the name of the hotel manager, Maria Martinez, in many of the reviews and they all had glowing things to say. Since we were booking three suite and 14 family members I knew we wanted to be close together. Upon reading additional reviews we agreed that we would like a high floor away from the highway noise (which we thought was nearly non-existent while there). I called the hotel and requested the managers e-mail and without hesitation they gave it to me - that was a good sign as well. I wrote her requesting the above items and she saw to it that it was taken care of. Our family was tickled to be on the top floor, close together and the cousins could run back and forth from room to room to play. That in itself was perfect. At check in they knew immediately that we were the family requesting rooms close together (made us feel special). Once inside our two bedroom suite we were more than pleased with what we found. The rooms were clean, attractive and the kitchen was more than adequate. The refrigerators have ice makers so no need to be running down the hall to get ice. Also the perfect place to freeze beverages before a day at the park. We used the pool almost daily (there are towels provided) and the children loved it. It was never too crowded. I should also mention that parking was always easy - seemed that there were always extra spaces even though the hotel was full. The housekeeping staff is very friendly and accommodating. The location of the hotel is excellent - just minutes from everything. If you are looking for groceries like our family was, just ask the front desk where the Winn-Dixie is. It is actually walkable but only two minutes by car. Go the opposite way and there is a Wal-Mart just 4-5 minutes away by car. We purchased most of our Disney gear there. They have a whole department that is nothing but Disney. Usually half the price of similar items found in the park. Go there first. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning (we stayed 8 days). The staff works like crazy to keep all of the food fresh and full. There is something for everyone. Arrive early for the least chaos and best choice of seating. If you arrive 30 minutes before breakfast is finished you will find most tables full and more lines at the food lines. We were able to make waffles several times with a minimal wait. While the hotel provides a shuttle that we thought we would use we opted instead to drive to the park for more freedom to come and go as we pleased. Here is a tip that we found and want to pass on. Disney charges $14.00 to park at their theme parks but there is no charge to park at their water parks and some hotels. We parked daily in the lot across the street from the Boardwalk Resort behind a Hess station. The lot was always just half full so we didn't even have to arrive early. Across the street in front of the hotel is a Disney bus stop that takes you to Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom. Walk behind the hotel and you will find boats that will take you to Epcot or Hollywood Studios. It was a 20 minute trip from the hotel to the parking lots. There have been some comments on the internet. It worked well enough for us although a bit slow at times. It was nice to have the two computers and printers in their business center to use. I would be remiss if I didn't mention that they have a Manager's Reception three nights each week (Tue, Wed, Thur). One night it was meatloaf and mashed potatoes, next was soup and salad, then a bar-b-q with hamburgers and hotdogs. A really nice plus especially after a long day at the park and you just don't want to have to go out. There is also a mini-store on premises to purchase chips or candy etc. All in all an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: nrcy
Reviews.Content: They staff was very nice.....the rooms are somewhat clean, bring air fresher and Lysol....this hotel takes pets so of has a lil smell to it but not bad....my husband and the kids enjoyed the free breakfast every morning(saved us lots of money) and my Hubby especially enjoyed to free drinks by the pool from 3-5 says it was his favorite part of the trip. Very convent locations Walmart less than a mile a way......lots of food places to eat and Disney is less than a mile away and Universal is very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hearty_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 was very happy with this hotel. The rooms were spacious and the breakfast was very nice. It is located very close to Downtown Disney and Crossroads shopping center, 5 minutes driving. I would definitely stay at his hotel again. The only downside for us was the fact that they take dogs. One night the dog in the room above us barked constantly for hours, however when I called the front desk to complain they told me they were trying to reach the owner on their cell phone. I do appreciate the fact that they were aware of it and trying to locate the dog owners.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: luman0528
Reviews.Content: just ask them and if possible they will make it happen . the pool and spa were clean and Gloria at the breakfast buffet was very nice . they made my 12th anniversary very special . i would stay here again thanks the luman

Reviews.Title: “great stay..nice hotel for a good value”
Reviews.Author: travellingangie
Reviews.Content: We stayed mid May for 3 nights while taking the family to the Harry Potter park & Epcot. We had a 2 bedroom suite and for $159 a night for 6 of us plus 2 dogs, it was fantastic. Plenty of space for all, comfy beds, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, free in room wifi and free buffet breakfast made this stay excellent. Our only complaint--and this is more about inconsiderate guests--is that other guests with pets were not so great about cleaning up after their dogs. This is not a poor reflection on the hotel, though. Great the place was dog friendly and a great value. For a place to stay in Orlando that is not too far from Disney & Universal, it was great. It is also close to many traditional fast food establishments and a couple grocery stores so that you can make good use of that full fridge area and save on snacks. The family enjoyed the pool area, too.

Reviews.Title: “Still good”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: Hadn't stayed at the Residence Inn in Lake Buena Vista in a few years. Our recent stay was OK, esp. for what we paid. Positive features: didn't have king bed available so was upgraded to suite (separate BR w/ king, twin beds in room w/ no door off LR), three TVs (w/ remotes that worked), full kitchen w/ microwave & DW, free parking, free wireless Internet access, free business center open 24/7, free breakfast buffet (although the 9:30am cutoff during the week is too early) w/ friendly staff, free hamburgers & hotdogs & drinks on Thursday night, central location for Disney properties, late (1pm) checkout given upon request, and free WSJ & USA Today daily newspapers -- all for a very low room rate. Negatives: couch was stained & should have been removed/cleaned, A/C didn't really cool room down to acceptable level even though thermostat was set at 60 degrees (supposedly an engineer looked at the A/C but A/C was not fixed), allows dogs (wouldn't want a room after a guest w/ dogs). But, all in all, a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “We just keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: flapharder
Reviews.Content: We come to Orlando usually once a year, from South Africa, and stay for about a month at a time. Right from the first visit, we stayed at the Residence Inn. Arriving tired from a very long trip that first year, we didn't know what to expect, as we had booked on the internet and after looking on trip advisor. We were not disappointed on that first trip, and have not been on any of our subsequent visits. I have to say that the cleaning staff are stellar: Not only do they do their jobs well, but many times we find a little note with a smiley face, saying "enjoy your day" from one of the cleaning staff. Whenever we have needed our room cleaned at an unusual time, they have been more than happy to come and do it. We also appreciate the communication from management, by a simple letter under the door when something unusual is happening. Staff do go out of their way to ensure that you are having a good time and that you are not inconvenienced in any way. We were also very happy last year when all the old TVs were replaced with brand new flat screen tvs, that was great! Last year my husband arrived at the Residence Inn one week before me and my daughter, and we had a family room. Unfortunately once we arrived to join him, we had a problem, as my daughter was scared of the noise from the airconditioner in her side of the room. Staff and Management graciously arranged for us to choose between three other rooms, let us view them and choose the one we wanted, without any complaint or extra charge. Their consideration made our stay so much happier. I must say that Residence Inn, Lake Beuna Vista could teach the other Residence Inns around the USA a thing or two. My husband has travelled all over the USA and booked into various Residence Inn Hotels, but none can compare in customer service like this one! We look forward to seeing you all again in December 2011. Thank you for the happy memories :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: mareby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel often. And I have never been disappointed with our Residence Inn stays. This was in an area of what appeared to be all new hotels. We were staying down the street at the Hawthorn. They were not able to give us a third night, so we moved to the Residence. I had not even gotten through the door when I was greeted with a smile from 2 lovely ladies. Our check in was fast and they were able to give me the floor I requested. The room was perfect. We are senior citizens and sometimes it is the little things that make it perfect for me. For instance, the bedroom lamps have and outlet on the base so I am able to plug in my I-Pod. The switch was also on the base, making it easy to turn off the lamp. The room was comfortable and everything we needed was there. Breakfast was more then enough and plenty of room. We were near shopping and dinning areas. Entance to Disney was easy. I would return and would recommend this hotel. I appreciate the smile's and hello's that always came from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for vacationers”
Reviews.Author: guy_traveller
Reviews.Content: I must echo the compliments given to the GM Maria Martinez and her staff. I had the opportunity to be able to speak with her and she is a delightful woman to talk to. Although the staff contributes to the success of the hotel as a team, and there are some behind the scenes actions, there are some that do stand out, such as Carolina, one of the attendants at breakfast, who always made sure to give us a warm welcome. When you look around at the size of this Residence Inn and think about how many extra rooms there are, one can appreciate how it is no simple matter to put out such a massive breakfast. I expect the occupants per room is a bit higher than the normal residence inn also. I wish I could remember the first name of the very helpful young lady at the front desk, but I believe the GM may remember whom I was talking about. The two bedroom suites here are set out to be suitable for more people travelling. For example, one king bed and a desk in one bedroom, and two queens in the second bedroom. I've seen some of the complaints...it is by a highway so part of it will get some highway noise. We didn't get any. It is a multi storey building, so if the people above you choose to be inconsiderate, you may hear some noise also. The best advice is that if you can't sleep for some reason, call the front desk. If the highway bothers you, there are people like me who don't care if they get a room by the highway (most are not). If the people upstairs are making noise, they need to get told to smarten up. All in all, this is a well run hotel that has an exceptional staff and a good GM who takes the time to talk to her guests and I expect spends a lot of time with her team as well. The internet did not work as well as I would have liked, but I am told this is being addressed. They had one component left to put in and upon departure, saw the two Embarq trucks at the hotel..so maybe some subsequent guests can comment on the net. It wasn't slow, it would just disconnect too much which is a problem if you're conducting online meetings. Hopefully this is fixed.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable stay as always.”
Reviews.Author: Salbaheo1
Reviews.Content: My family and I are a huge fans of the Residence Inn chain of Marriott hotels. We will almost always stay at a Residence Inn whenever we go away on vacations. For us, Residence Inn has set the bar. In a nutshell: they are an exceptional value. The complimentary hot breakfast is a great value. Good tasting food. A good variety. This Residence Inn has a waffle maker with a Mickey Mouse shaped head which makes it fun to eat (for the kids of course). The variety changes very little on a day to day basis; scramble eggs are always there; sometimes there's sausage patties, sometimes bacon, sometimes both; bagels, toast, pastries, hot & cold cereals, yogurt with fresh fruit, etc (it goes on). I also appreciate it that they serve flavored coffee creamer as a choice. It is typical cafeteria-mass public consumption type of food but COMPLIMENTARY. So ignore the negative reviews about the food. My response to those people are: Don't eat it; Go waste your time getting dressed, drive somewhere, wait in line and pay for the similar tasting food elsewhere. Having breakfast in the hotel is a big time saver. One can either go there right before they head out or show up in your pj's like we did at times. They will also allow you to "doggie bag" something. The staff almost expects it. And speaking of staff, they are kind and respectful. They are very helpful during breakfast times in the dining area. Someone is always there refilling the buffet table, cleaning post occuppied tables, or getting something for you from the kitchen (like an extra carton of chocolate milk to take along with you, etc). Housekeeping does a great job tidying up your room while you're away. They kept supplying us with hotel soap even if we didn't use them and generous with bath towels if you requested for some extra. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. The televisions were flat panels. The sheets were clean and soft. The mattresses were really comfortable; even the mattress from the sofa bed. All in all it was a pleasurable experience and would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations on everything- especially the staff!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMom11
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and pleasure- this is the first time the hotel truly enhanced my trip. Everything about the hotel was fabulous, but there were a couple items truly worth pointing out. 1) The staff- beyond incredible! Everyone was always friendly and helpful- the person who checked us in; multiple people in the breakfast area; the person who cleaned our room; and the hotel general manager who answered a few questions for us. The most incredible staff person was named Carolina- she was always there at breakfast with a smile on her face. On the day we left, my kids tracked Carolina to give her a hug goodbye! The kitchen manager who worked breakfast on 4/17/11 was also great (I think her name was Katie?? I'm totally guessing). The one time they ran out of chocolate chips for about 2 minutes, she brought a bowl of the chips out to our table to make sure my son fully enjoyed his waffles. 2) The breakfast- hot breakfast which was always kept fully stocked. There was a great variety of food and it was very tasty!! Mickey waffles; bacon/sausage; variety of juices; flavored coffee creamers; oatmeal; fresh fruit- you name it, they had it! 3) Location- it was ~10 minutes from all the major sites. Overall- everything was great. For our family vacations, the hotel is usually just a place to sleep and change clothes. This time, the hotel was part of what made our vacation so great. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service and Accomidations!”
Reviews.Author: scknowles11769
Reviews.Content: The staff at this property were incredible, from the GM Maria Martinez (awesome), to the front desk staff Marc, and to housekeeping service with Lexy. Thank you all for a great stay and I look forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Kweiss6454
Reviews.Content: I have been stating at this hotel for the past 2 years and have to say it is the best in Florida. I hold quarterly sales meetings here and continue to come back each time. Lexie, Mark, Li Ou, Maria and the entire crew always go the extra mile to make our meetings and stays the best. I have never been to another hotel where the staff from top to bottom all think customer service all the time. The management is doing it all right here. Thanks for all the great stays, I look forward to many more. Ken Weiss VP of Sales Guardian Fueling Technologies

Reviews.Title: “A place of Happyness”
Reviews.Author: broomfieldd
Reviews.Content: After spending all day on a place, I was delighted to find my hotel. This is a beautiful property, I have stayed at many hotels, and this hotel I have to put as one of the best. I was welcomed with smiles and courtesy. Not to mention the fact that the rooms were very spacious and comfortable. Maria Martinez, the ( GM) was fabulous in regards to having and welcoming a special re pore with her customers. She seemed to know allot of people on a first name basis and was very friendly to everyone. Her staff new how to accommodate everyone and even went out of there way to make sure that all of the customers have a positive experiences that they will never forget. I truly had three days of total enjoyment because of this hotel and the staff within. I will never stay anywhere else when I am in Orlando Fl, I have found my place in Orland, FL and it belongs at the Residents inn lake buena vista hotel and the family that resides within. Joshua N Hoyle Colorado Springs, CO

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: luckyandcocoa
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly people, rooms are excellent, daily breakfast is everything you would want, courtyard and pool excellent. Shuttle to the area theme parks everyday. . Definitely will be returning,no need to look anywhere else to stay. Travelled with my 2 dogs, not a problem . You do need to pay an extra $100 for your entire stay with your pets, I find that very reasonable. Did I mention a dog walking area in the back of the hotel!! Very nice!!The staff is very polite and very friendly. Katrina and Jeannie at the front desk are very nice people. Raymond, in maintenance very kind man. Thank you for your hospitality! Will be back .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler199
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Orlando with my teenage son over Presidents week. This is not a luxury resort but a very nice clean hotel at a good price. Had a 2 room suite with a full kitchen. The rooms had new nice size HDTVs. Hotel had an excellent breakfast and very nice eating area with plenty of tables. Even thought the hotel was sold out it didn't seem crowded. The hotel is very close to the Disney parks and Sea World, 15 minutes from Universal. Very nice heated pool. Only downside is our room faced I-4 which is a very busy highway and heard the road noise. Ask for a courtyard room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasant staff, super breakfast and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Abbysmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel and would recommend it highly. There were 4 adults and a 4 yr. old and the 2 bedroom suite (with a full kitchen) was roomy, clean, & located in a quiet part of the building. A breakfast buffet that was tasty, varied and plentiful was included each day. Furnishings were a bit dated and shuttle service to Disney was too limited to be convenient. But if you are not staying at a Disney Hotel, this is an excellent value, convenient to Downtown Disney (5 min.) and the Disney World parks. Staff was very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, no more, no less”
Reviews.Author: yussi1870
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with 2 bedrooms, one for the parents and one for the three kids. The kids room has fun pictures on the wall of animals which the kids liked. They were also excited to have a tv in their own room. The room was clean. There was noise from the highway but it didn't bother us. The hotel is not really located near anything, you pretty much have to drive to get to any restaurants. The shuttle service is convenient to Epcot only. The average commute via shuttle and then internal disney transportation to Magic Kingdom is 1.5 hours (not sure driving would be much better though). This is because it's a 10 minute walk from where the shuttle drops you off at Epcot to the security checkpoint where there's a line to check your bags. Then there's a line to the monorail which takes you to the transfer station. From there you need to either wait in another monorail line or the ferry line to the magic kingdom and then go through a security checkpoint again to finally get in the line to enter the magic kingdom. The hotel is a quick drive to Universal. The breakfast buffet is pretty good including a mickey mouse shaped waffle maker. The hotel also has a nice looking pool but we didn't use it. The wireless is very poor and even the landed connections are not good. The hotel ought to upgrade its network.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinorlando
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn Buena Vista sits on top of major highway. If yoy like constant never ending truck traffic noise ALL NIGHT LONG then this place is for you. My advise is STAY AWAY and look elsewhere!!!! Be warned. Ruined mt vacation, well my wife's too.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beelacat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Residence Inn location for 6 nights (during the first week of November, 2010), as part of a family trip to Disneyworld. The hotel was really nice and very clean. We stayed on the 3rd floor and found it to be very quiet even though there were lots of families staying there. The room itself was a decent size. It had a small kitchenette with a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, a pantry, 2 burner stove, a breakfast bar with 2 stools, pots/pans and dishes/silverware and a desk with a lamp. Our room had a King size bed with a sleeper sofa. The bathroom had a nice vanity (sink) with a few drawers and a cabinet underneath the sink. The towels and washcloths were very soft and thick, not see through like some places. There was one dresser with 3 large drawers. The flat screen TV sat on top of the dresser which was located in between what would be the living room and bedroom areas. In the laundry facility, there were 2 washers and 2 dryers ($1.50 each) inside of a large room with a counter for folding, as well as a sink and hand towels. The room was very clean and had 2 chairs to sit in, which was nice because most places only have the washer/dryer. The breakfast area was awesome with a really good buffet. Of course, it was standard items – waffles, eggs, bacon, potatoes, sausage, toast, bagels, cereal, muffins, etc. There was only one Mickey Mouse waffle maker though so it could take a while to make one of those. The breakfast room was fairly large but could get very crowded. Since we were there in November it wasn’t bad, but I’d hate to see how crowded it would be in the middle of the summer when the park(s) are in full swing. Overall though it wasn’t too bad because people were coming/going all the time. We didn’t use the pool on this trip but we did get in the hot tub one night. It was wonderful – nice and toasty warm. I could smell the chlorine and from what I could see of it during the daytime, it looked really clean. It was too chilly outside for me to enjoy the pool but we did see people in there, especially in the morning hours. The only negatives I had (and they’re small ones) – there was no in-room safe, the AC was a bit loud when it first comes on and the bathroom is right next to the bedroom so if you get up in the middle of the night and turn the light on, it could be bothersome for the other person in the bed. Only other issue I had was that the lobby computer was very slow and there are only 2 of them. Overall, I highly recommend staying at this Residence Inn. The staff was very friendly and the location was great for going to Disneyworld as it was only about 10-15 minutes away. Best of all, this hotel was very clean and reasonably priced during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A dour smelling below average Marriot hotel with lousy internet”
Reviews.Author: richardthelost
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple times. If you are coming for business purpose be aware that the free internet service is almost non-existent. Best bet is to go across the street to the Hilton Garden Inn and sit in the lobby if you need a connection. On positive side, the staff is pretty nice, the rooms are spacious have great TVs if you can get over the old run down hotel smell that seems to permeate the rooms. Its also convenient to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dietrying17
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is good except I feel housekeeping should be more attentive. Some areas aren't cleaned properly. We arrived to a room that had a really wet carpet from cleaning. However, we were moved quickly to another room by a friendly front desk. I didn't realize there was no safe in the room. Overall good stay, bed was soooo comfortable. Great breakfast in the morning with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Reasonable & Amenities We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: grayesun
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd stay here was as good as the 1st (May 2010); we were given a handicap room for 4 adults when a standard 4 adult room wasn't available - this worked out fine for us. The rooms were spacious, clean, quiet, comfortable and convenient to the parking lot - making luggage transfer painless. Well equipped kitchen made eating in pleasant and a fine cost saver. Pool area was generous but appeared to be a bit worn and in need of some cosmetic maintenance - we didn't use the pool facilities due to cold temps, but many kids/teens weren't deterred & semed to be having a great time. American breakfast was excellent, the 4 of us all found just what we wanted. The breakfast pavillion area was wild and rowdy with lots of jazzed up kids running everywhere and screaming frantically, no doubt anticipating the day ahead at Disney or Universal. Get there early or after bus departures for quieter breakfast experience or you might have to wait for indoor seating. The complimentary shuttle bus service to Epcot also fit our plans perfectly - pick-up right on time at both ends. All service people we encountered were friendly & helpful, including the folks involved with turning in our camera that we left behind in our room - that we had to drive back to retrieve a couple days later.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with a great nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: FlashGordon79
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel..comfy beds great hospitality. Only stayed for 1 night and the staff made me feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay With Pets”
Reviews.Author: HarpEire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with our dogs for an additional nominal fee. The rooms had a nice lay-out but were a bit dated. I opted to cook small dinners in the room each evening so that we could relax and stay with our pets. There was a good selection of pots, dishes etc. The pet walking area is convenient and well lit. The breakfast was plentiful and offered many different items. We stayed on the pool side ground floor and as expected did hear the normal activity that always accompanies group fun. You do have to keep your curtains shut for privacy. The only concern I had with this hotel was the extreme use of "air freshner" used in the hallways. I am very sensitive to odors and the smell was overwhelming. It was not too bad in the room, but I had more control of the air flow from the thermostat. Keep in mind you will not have housekeeping during your stay with pets. The location was about 10 minutes drive to Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and well maintained, quiet, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: designlmb
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very nice and clean, comfortable beds, many towels, room service is great. It's very convenient to have a kitchen in he unit, large flat screen tv, pool area is attractive and clean. I am impressed and enjoying my stay! My only complaint is that the hallway (on the 5th floor) has an unpleasant odor, and my room has a very masculine smell like aftershave. Overall though, it is a very nice hotel and good value!

Reviews.Title: “okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: gmoore6001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the room spacious. Just 2 of us but they gave us a 2 bdr. suite. It would be nice for a family with children. Shuttle goes to park only a few times a day. Only restaurant within walking distance is at Hilton Garden across the street. Okay for a couple of meals but after that it gets kinda old. Little store in hotel is very expensive. Bring your own food if you plan to do any meals in the kitchenette, or even just for snacks. Breakfast buffet was better than many we've had, there were a few hot items plus yogurt, waffle--usual hotel free breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “Poor internet and cable, ok otherwise”
Reviews.Author: onoes
Reviews.Content: I am a long term resident at this hotel - have been staying here since October. I am in Orlando for work. The one thing that I need the most is Internet. The Internet service at this hotel is poor. The hotel does not even provide WiFi access. You are given a cable and have to connect to the internet using cable. The speed is slow. But during much of the day, the Internet doesn't work at all. If you are a business traveler, this just doesn't work. Same with the TV. The hotel provides two magnificent flat screen TVs per room. But they are useless. There are only about 40 or so channels that are available. But the HD channels don't even show up. If you switch to an HD channel, all you see is a black screen with the words "No Signal" floating around. This is not acceptable from a hotel that is branded a Marriott. I recently stayed at a La Quinta Inn in Miami and they had amazing Wifi speed. If lower level chains like Days Inn and Econolodge can afford to provide their guests with good internet, Marriott should certainly be able to do this. This is 2011. Providing a roof over the head is not enough for an inn. Guests, and especially long term business guests, need a lot more. Otherwise the hotel isn't bad. The staff is great and very courteous. The staff is perhaps the best thing about the hotel. The beds are very comfortable. Apart from a few nights when i woke up due to barking pets, the sleep quality is generally very good. The pool area and the hotel overall is clean and well maintained. If you are visiting the parks, this hotel is great value. But for a business traveler I don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay because of amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: SamSpringHill_TN
Reviews.Content: Our Christmas vacation to Walt Disney World was mostly wonderful because of the amazing staff at this Residence Inn. The staff here goes above and beyond the usual expectations of any hotel. The breakfast here was' almos't as good as Chef Mickey's (which cost us $144 for a family of 4!) and the service was much better!! Thank you, Jeffrey, for an awesome job! We stayed in a 2 bdrm with our 2 children (13 and 10) and small dog. The rooms were ample in size and kept very clean. The beds were very comfortable. I would highly recommend the pool side of the hotel as it was peaceful and the view was pleasant. Thanks so much to Maria (General Manager) and your amazing staff! We had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: WindAndSolar
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely amazing, they truly cared about the quality of my experience and their customer service was top-notch! The breakfast is amazing - it has everything you could ever want or imagine. The front desk is very attentive and if they don't know the answer they can point you in the right direction. When I called to have things brought up to the room, the service was prompt. The housekeeping staff was friendly and the room was spotless! The shuttle only goes to Epcot, but the public bus goes right by the hotel and gets you anywhere you need to go. The only problem was that nobody really knew anything about the bus, but the drivers certainly helped me figure it out. This was the best family vacation we have had at a Residence Inn and would definitely come back to this place!! It is a great deal for the $$!!!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL - Third Exceptional Visit”
Reviews.Author: atldisneyfan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my third stay at this ultra clean hotel. The rooms are immaculate, the amenities are fabulous (including full kitchen with full-size refrigerator and sizable microwave) and the staff is friendly and extremely accommodating. I stayed in this hotel twice in 2008, and again in October 2010, all 3 rooms and stays were pleasant and worry-free. I'm there to visit the parks, but sleep late. As long as you put a "do not disturb" sign on your door, it's a quiet place, even in light of the families who always are the predominant guests at this reasonably priced hotel. My main compliments for this hotel are that the staff has always been super efficient, and extremely helpful and friendly any time I've had even the slightest issue or question. Way above the quality staff I've experienced at much higher priced luxury hotels! And the free breakfast is a wonderful amenity. Surprisingly plentiful and fresh. Going back again next month for my fourth stay in 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for large parties who want to stay in "one room"”
Reviews.Author: yvrtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn Orlando Lake Buena Vista in 2006 (just the two of us) and came back with family. One "room" is actually three - one bedroom with two queen size beds, one bedroom with a king size bed, and a living/kitchen area with a pull out couch. Easily sleeps 6, could sleep more. Got our nights for $119 each night for two evenings. Close to tons of restaurants, about 5 miles to downtown Disney, about 15 miles to Universal and all the Disney parks and resorts. Hotel is very clean and accomodating. The highlights to me are: #1 very comfy beds, #2 quiet room (could not hear anyone above, below or beside us), #3 central A/C worked perfectly, #4 hot breakfast with THREE waffle makes (one you have to ask for because it's inside the kitchen), #5 a spectacular heated swimming pool and hot tub area. Easily one of my favourite Marriott hotels anywhere in North America.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience. Super convenient to the attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Karen_DePas
Reviews.Content: We just had one night in Orlando, so convenience was VERY important. We were able to get to our attraction easily and had a great room to come "home" to. The staff was welcoming and the room was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more :)”
Reviews.Author: babyadamsmakes3
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were greeted with wonderful smiling faces. We were even upgraded, which was really nice. My husband and I took a little weekend getaway away from everything and really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms give you a feel as if you were at home. Plus the location can not beat anything...turn to your right and you are like 5-10 minutes away from SeaWorld and turn to your left and you are like 10 minutes away from Disney World. They even are a Disney hotel so they give transportation. Not to mention the FREE HOT BREAKFAST BUFFETT...anything and everything you want for breakfast it is there. We are already planning our next vacation in May and plan on staying there.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL WZ POOR SERVICE&NO STANDARD OF SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: S-R-AME
Reviews.Content: We are 2adults & 2 preschoolers and usually use Marriott's INNs. I've loved Residence INN brand bcz of their "Full-equipped kitchen" and their standard of service. BUT this one didn't fulfill our expectatations at all. Out of 6night stay just last night we have all we needed and requested. In rest of days housekeeper(s) -lost my personal stuff (I left a message to ask about it and she/he ignored it and just took the pillow tips!!!-I put them together) -didn't put any bath towels(1day) -didn't put bath towels as we requested(we have requested an extra towel) -didn't replace any amenity in the bathroom(1day) -replaced just hair conditioners (no shampoo/1day) -didn't replace ANY coffee/tea/sugar whole week -nerver put salt, which is included in kitchen equip even though she/he knew we didn't have it -didn't replace dishwasher detergent and we couldn't wash anything one night, but the next day she/he left all the dirty dishes just as they were in the sink!! -didn't even fold blanket of the crib -didn't replace a paper towel Something else?? Oh yes. -Hotel staff don't say hello in hallway. -Tour desk staff was talking aaaaalllll the time with her colleague about their personal problems. (Now I know her name, her son's name, her cel phone number, her son's medical history and name of his medications, his school!!!!) -A cost free computer located at the lobby area is contaminated by some virus. (After using it I started to receive contaminated e-mails in my hotmail account and had to cancel it!!!!!!) WHAT ELSE TO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL?

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tbirdgolf
Reviews.Content: Service, value, great accommodations to be sure. But it is the spirit of the staff that makes this place so great. High energy, very engaging. They let you know that they will do their best to make sure your stay is a good one. When have you ever seen a General Mgr making sure your coffee was warm and filled. She carried the pot. Not telling others what to do. Everyone had one job... take care of the customer. If you have pets you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Stay in Busy Area”
Reviews.Author: mll563
Reviews.Content: When we travel to Disney World we always like to stay the night before at this hotel. It is away from the busy area and we have been treated very well every time we have stayed. They have a huge breakfast which is a great start to our days at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Agrivating Housekeeper”
Reviews.Author: itravelalotGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn for a quiet weekend we thought, the Hotel was clean and the room was in great shape, and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast bar had plenty of food and tasted decent, but get ready to be stampeded by rude people that act like they havent eaten in a week. Free food causes people to go crazy, reaching over you and cutting in line etc. so you might want to just drive to the Chick Fil a and have a calm start to your morning. All the room entrances are internal to the building, obviously they have a security problem because inside our door every night was littered with Pizza coupons on the floor, so be careful from a security standpoint. Each room door is equipped with a nice looking door knocker which on the day of checkout the Housekeepers will begin knocking around 8:00 a.m. and walking off just to agrivate you enough to leave early, even after talking to one of them they continued the process until we left, what a nuisance. What a shame to have a good stay ruined in the last few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, short drive to everything.”
Reviews.Author: pr_littlemermaid
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to everything, if you drive. Close to Disney Area (especially Downtown Disney), very close to Sea World. Many restaurants within a short drive (Turn left out of the hotel at Palm Pwy-Olive Garden, Pizzeria Uno, Sweet Tomatoes, to name a few), 24 hrs grocery store, pharmacy, (turn right @Palm Pwy)-Walmart, Whole Foods. If you walk at night to restaurants, walk at your own risk. Half of the road to hotel is very dark at night (no lights), and there is traffic. Very attentive staff, excellent customer service. Save $14 on parking at the parks. They provide free shuttle service to/from Epcot (Leaves hotel at 8:15AM-10:15AM-12:20PM. Latest return to hotel at 9:45PM. If MK park closes at 11PM, then 11:15PM is the latest). From Epcot you take free transportation to the other parks (by bus or monorail). We stayed in a 2BR (2QB each room + Sofabed), comfortable beds, lots of pillows, flat TV's on both rooms + living room, spacious room, full kitchen with pots, dishes, etc, including dishwasher. A/C central unit with own thermostat. One side of the hotel faces Highway. We stayed almost on the side facing I-4 (Aruba Bldg), and at night I could hear traffic, but nothing bad. I slept fine. They provided dishwasher detergent. Housekeeping was excellent. When we came back at night, room was organized, clean, dishes clean, etc....Wired High Speed Internet in rooms was OK, not excellent. Wireless in public areas. Save $$$ and eat breakfast at hotel. Is good, including Make your own Mickey's waffles-nice touch. Staff gave our kids stickers and bubbles. Pool was a little bit cold, but weather is changing in Florida right now. Pool closes at 10PM. I don't know if the pool has heater. Kiddie pool and whirpool. There's a pool bar and complimentary light snack+beer+wine from tues-thurs. 5PM-6:30PM. Coin Laundry on site-$1.50 in quarters per load.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with family? Look no further.”
Reviews.Author: TallmanWPB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with family of adults and children. You can't beat the value. We stayed in a 2 bedroom which has a king in one room, two queen beds in the other room, and a fold out couch if you need it. Room was nice and clean, beds were very comfortable, staff very friendly. Hotel is very close to everything. Extremely close to Disney, and you come out of hotel take a right and stay on one road all the way to Universal. Great location!! Breakfast included for whole family. Full breakfast including eggs, sausage, bacon, yogurt, waffles, muffins, etc........You can't beat it. Have a nice breakfast and hit the parks. What a savings. They even allow pets if you are traveling with one. They have an excercise trail to walk your dog out back. We will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great place to stay near the parks”
Reviews.Author: NJkenzie212
Reviews.Content: I took my two young kids to Disney on my own for a quick 5 day trip to Orlando. This hotel has it all, everything you need. The location is superb, you are close to everything and there are quite a few restaurant and shopping options nearby. The full service breakfast is good and the servers in the dining room are extremely attentive and used to dealing with families. They brought me a high chair every morning and watched my kids while I went to the buffet. The pool is absolutely lovely, better than I expected for a Residence Inn. When the towels ran out, they were replaced within minutes by one of the dining room staff. These folks really seem to care about their jobs and about you as a customer, very refreshing! We had a family suite which is actually more like a two bedroom with a separate kids room, a family room area with full kitchen and a master bedroom with the one bathroom. It was perfect for us. The TVs are all LCD and HUGE, we had the Disney channel on all the time. The beds were comforatable. The only complaint I can muster, is the carpet is quite worn, dirty and was coming up in places. Having a toddler, that was a bit of an issue, as she kept picking at the loose carpet and putting things in her mouth. Also, the pack and play they brought me has seen better days, and should be replaced. Other than that, it was a great stay and i would recommend this property for a comfortable place to sleep and swim while in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Check out other Residence Inns Before you book here”
Reviews.Author: Ginkwunk
Reviews.Content: We stay in hotels about 50 nights per year - mostly Marriott brands. This hotel was a disappointment. Pool is dirty - seems to be black dirt or mulch on the bottom that never goes away. Pool towels are not restocked, didn't receive housekeeping service 2 days, carpet in room was dirty, TVs would sometimes work and sometimes not. Even the hotel engineer when trying to fix them said he couldn't explain it. He said the satellite dishes work great sometimes, but not always. No dish soap to wash dishes - even asked at front desk and was told they don't provide it. Called Marriott customer service once we got home and was told they absolutely should have provided it. After rooms were cleaned bags of trash were left in the hallway for several hours. Bathrooms need a serious overhaul. You could tell that the shower rod had been pulled out of the wall and screwed back in several times. Garbage disposal shook the whole room but didn't do much else. Check out Residence Inn Seaworld. There pics look much nicer and website says they were recently renovated. Wifi only in lobby not in rooms. A positive note - the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome we really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: frankdf
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay if you are going to any disney attrations. If you rent a car everything is close by from restaurant to shopping. Great staff, excellent breakfast every morning, nice pool, big rooms with comfortable beds, kitchen with stove, fridge and microwave. Overall great place to stay for a Lake Buena Vista visit.

Reviews.Title: “We are a family of four and found the one...”
Reviews.Author: 5mac
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and found the one bedroom very comfortable for our stay. Breakfast was included and there was a complete buffet to choose from, and friendly staff to assist you in the dining room. As an added bonus there was also a Manager's special Tuesday through Thursday that included a great barbecue one night for free. Our kids loved the pool so much they didn't want to leave the hotel to go to Seaworld. We had a wonderful stay and can't say enough about all of the friendly staff, cleanliness of the hotel and great food! We will definitely stay here again! Great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: HoopsterLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks for a sports tournament at Disney in July. Overall, I give this hotel a 7 out of 10. We had a two bedroom suite with a king and two queen beds, which was nice size. The positives: Great pool/patio area and huge breakfast area, although still packed at peak time (around 9:00 am), but they had an overflow space. Hot selections were available. The manager’s social Tue-Thu with food and free drinks (beer, wine, soft drinks) was nice and Thursdays had a cookout with burgers. Manager Maria was great and even served coffee at breakfast. Location is close to restaurants and attractions, although I believe a car is a must. Walking and shuttle schedule will not do it. Peak in season traffic at rush hour will add to the travel times –learn the back routes and your will save I-4 rush hour traffic. Beds were very nice. Drawbacks: Although there was a complete kitchen with stove, there is no way you can cook daily for a family with the equipment provided: One small sauce pan and a frying pan. Dishes were 4 coffee cups, four wine glasses, four salad plates, and four very small bowls. If you stay here to save money and cook meals, you will need to bring pots and pans. Our room’s carpet was also a mess - very stained and dirty, to the point we hated even going barefoot. It needed serious cleaning or replacement. Housekeeping also frequently did not replace dish towels and hand towels. After a day or two there, they shut down the juice machine at breakfast and from then on only a watery, fake juice mix was offered. I’m not a techie, but they claim high speed internet service (not wireless) but it was very slow compared to home high speed service. Overall, staff was good, but one evening room next door had several very loud, playing, screaming kids an 1:30 a.m. We notified front desk, but it continued for another half hour. When we called back, they said the “night man” walked the hall and didn’t hear anything. We offered to let them come hear it from our bedroom and she said they understood, but nothing was done. We finally called the room directly at 2:15 a.m. and asked them to respect their neighbors and they immediately quieted down. Apparently the front desk is too worried about offending guests by dealing with the issue. Every day, offsite pizza delivery would stick flyers under the door, which meant these non guests had daily access (the hotel had a sign stating not to use them). The space for the price was good with a good Disney location and minutes to Universal/Sea World, and staff was good with requests except the noise incident.

Reviews.Title: “Great for long stays and hitting the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: nypenman
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed here for a week with my wife and 2 boys, 7 &10, and the stay was very pleasant. we usually rent a car, so i can't comment on the shuttles, but the location is close to everything by car, not close to anything by foot. there is a shopping center full of restaurants about a half mile down palm parkway, but i wouldn't want to walk there in orlando's summer heat. we took a one bedroom with 2 double beds, and everything was fine. the kitchenette had a refrigerator, stove, microwave, utensils, plates, bowls, and a couple of pots - no dishwashing liquid though. the beds were very comfortable and the housekeepers did a good job every single day. my only complaint about the room is its size - relatively small for a suite. the dining table was pushed up against a wall, and only had 2 chairs, which made it difficult for a family of four to eat together. other minor issues were a broken can opener and batteries not working in one remote, which were taken care of efficiently. there was internet access in the room through an ethernet cable, but wifi was only available in the common area. unfortunately, the cable is on the dining table, next to the salt and pepper, so every time we ate, we had to move the computer. the breakfast buffet is quite nice, though it's easy to get tired of after several days. my son loved the mickey mouse shaped waffles. needless to say, it was crowded. it's nice to start off a day at the parks with a big breakfast and this hotel has one of the better ones, especially considering it was included in the price. the swimming pool is adequate and towels were always available. this is a pet friendly hotel, so for a couple of nights, we had barking issues. we did the promo where they also gave us a $25 disney gift card for every night. that means we received $175 in disney gift cards. this helped a lot in paying for those theme park expenses. after reading about it from another reviewer on this site, i asked for all the gift cards in the beginning, and it was accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RImom02886
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at this Residence Inn. We were very pleased with the size of the room. We loved the breakfast! The food was fresh and delicious. The rooms were clean. When we needed more towel housekeeping sent them up immediately. The location was great! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBallFamily
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business and stay in Marriotts and we went to Orlando for a week as our daughter was playing in a basketball tournament. We decided on this hotel and did not know what to expect. Our expectations were surpassed! The people working here were all very nice and accomodating. The breakfasts were outstanding. Our family suite was spacious and was just right to accomodate our family which includes 3 kids under age 14. We even used the backetball court each day - for as long as possible as it was very hot each day. We have already said that when we go back to Orlando, we are planning to come back to this hotel. Thank you very much for helping make our trip a great success!!

Reviews.Title: “They are more friendly than the Disney...”
Reviews.Author: GramaAna
Reviews.Content: They are more friendly than the Disney people is !! Just want to thank you guys for making our so wonderful and special! Everyone from the housekeeping department engineering, front desk ( Amanda was the best ) And thank you Jeffrey for making my granddaughter birth so spcecial it was really awesome, Maria Martinez Never seen a GM like her!! Thank thank you ! We gonna come back to see you guys againg !! XOX

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RETURN TO THE RESSIDENCDE”
Reviews.Author: weirhammer
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Ressidence Inn July 2009 and July 2010 and as always it was fantastic. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Cleaning staff supplied extra towels when required. Breakfast was always well prepared very hot and lots of c.hoice. The LCD televisions is a great addition this year as is the new sun loungers around the pool. It is ideally situated for both Universal and Disney theme parks. Perfect stay in a perfect hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: GrammyT027
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our daughter along with our 3 young grandsons, my husband and myself planned this 10 day trip to Orlando over a year ago to enjoy Disney World, Sea World, Universal, etc. with our family. From the moment of check-in and throughout our stay, the entire staff at the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista could not have been more accommodating. The friendliness of all the employees and the promptness of fulfilling any requests we had (extra towels, etc.) was remarkable. The hotel itself along with our 2 bedroom suite was immaculate. Even the carpeting in our suite appeared to be either new or recently cleaned. Big Plus. The lay out of the suite is such that you never feel cramped for space. The beds were extremely comfortable-especially the pillows! In addition, we all enjoyed the pool-plenty of chairs available. The buffet breakfast was very good and included more than enough choices to satisfy adults as well as children. The selection included: bacon, eggs, sausage, hot and cold cereal, muffins, yogurt, fruit, muffins, pancakes, waffles-big selection. Visiting the parks were no longer than a 10-15 minute drive-so convenient. There are many restaurants also within a short drive including the Downtown Disney area. In addition, there's a Walmart not far from the hotel to purchase any groceries you may want for your suite-great way to save money! We couldn't have been more pleased in our choice of the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista for our vacation. It truly is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Towel Shortgage- Request a Room away from Highway”
Reviews.Author: traveled2010
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the management staff if most accomodating. The housekeeping staff needs another overhaul this year- was told it was a new one from last year. There is not enough towels-old towels- requested towels- washcloths, was brought one or two for a family of five, no towels by the pool, the pool is dirty, the hot tub is dirty, very slick spots at stairs by the pool that need addressing. The hotel rooms smell a bit musty and moldy. Carpet needs replacing and very dirty, roaches in our kitchen do not leave food out on counters. Was pleasantly surprised to see flat screens added to the rooms this year. The beds were comfortable again, pillows do need replacing and the mattresses on the pull outs need replacing- if you sleep on it- only sleeping on the metal frame. Shocked to see large dogs allowed here- and cats. For the amount of nightly charge- this Marriott needs to step up their game.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my wildest expectation”
Reviews.Author: ampagoom
Reviews.Content: I have always know that the Marriott has a fine reputation for customer satisfaction, but the Marriott Residence Inn in Orlando was very accommodating to our family. The politeness of the staff, the cleanness of the entire facility , their breakfast buffet were just great. The staff was always there to help with directions to different theme parks, stores, etc. Just ask them and they would have pre-printed directions to where you wish to go. If they don't, then they would go on line and find it, then print it. It was just a great experience and I would recommend it to any body to go there. When I plan another trip to that area, I will book my stay there. Great job and thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go there again!”
Reviews.Author: leisuretraveller16
Reviews.Content: Room was stuffy when we entered it. Maintenance came and set the airconditioning. Found live bug in bathroom. Dirty sofa bed covers and sheets.Breakfast was the only saving grace! Bathroom doors did not close. Room for 6, but had to call in for extra coffee mugs,only 4 were kept. Had planned for more than 2 days. Checked out after the first day. Not coming here ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay-the best!!”
Reviews.Author: tgmWarnerRobins
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business but definitely will take my family back. I travel a lot--all over the world. i don't know when I've enjoyed a stay more. This is genuinely the first time I've ever been impressed enough to write a review, unless (in the past) I had a negative experience and wanted to warn others. The opposite was true in this case.The room was superb-spacious and clean, luxurious even. The staff was friendly and helpful. Amanda at the front desk particularly impressed me. She was gracious, helpful with anything I asked for, and always smiling--just the kind of person you'd want working for you and representing your company.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff, well used property, good spot for local attractions”
Reviews.Author: wbtbismarck
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently completed a 7 night stay at this location and were very pleased with the room, pool, breakfast buffet (seats 100+), and service received. A grocery store is just a mile away, attractions are 10-25 minutes by car, and restaurants are abundant. I do recommend using a car while staying at this location. The bus service provided to the parks is questionable. Spend the money on a cheap rental car, if you do not bring your own. The hotel staff spend a great deal of effort on the breakfast buffet and house cleaning services. If you sleep in one morning (HIGHLY suggested for multiple days at the local parks); just let housekeeping know when you leave the room for the day. Otherwise they may not have time to get back to your room. Pool side towels are available. Later in the evening the towels are small. Early in the morning they use the larger bath towels. I suspect that when the pool side towels are being washed, regular towels are put in their place. If you are headed to the local parks, ask for the best directions at the front desk. They are likely to send you RIGHT out of the hotel about a mile, then RIGHT at the first light to enter I-4. You can turn LEFT out of the hotel (well, just down the street), but that will lead to the Downtown Disney area, which can be conjested.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased with facilities and staff, professional and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: MoseleyFrank
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very pleasant, the rooms were clean, all accommodations were excellent. The staff, from the front desk to the room stewards, were friendly, and helpful. They immediately responded to some request that we made. This facility and staff exceeded our expectations, will use this as our place to return to, when we are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have made a better choice.”
Reviews.Author: MoodyPoint
Reviews.Content: My wife, my mother-in-law and I just returned from a week-long vacation touring the Orlando parks. This was my mother-in-law’s first trip to Florida. After much searching on the internet, we settled on the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista. We could not have made a better choice. We were looking for accommodations with two separate bedrooms and a comfortable living space. We wanted this trip to be as trouble free as possible and our five-night stay at this hotel was exactly that. First, the rates were fantastic. Reservations were a breeze. All of the front desk staff we encountered via phone and during our stay was always polite and informative. Our two-bedroom suite was well equipped with a full sized stove and refrigerator. It also had a dishwasher and plenty of cabinet space. The living area had a comfortable couch and chair with a TV, a spacious table and four dining chairs. The main bedroom had a comfortable king sized bed, desk, office chair, a bathroom with separate sink and mirror area. The second bedroom had two comfortable queen beds, ample closet and a similar bathroom arrangement. Housekeeping kept the room clean and neat at all times. The complimentary breakfast area was very large and despite the fact that we ate breakfast along with a very polite one-hundred forty-piece band from Texas and other guests, we never ran out of food or had trouble finding a seat. There was a wide variety of breakfast foods from which to choose. The crew in the breakfast area came around filling our cups with coffee. They were very polite and helpful as they cleared our tables. During the week, the manager provided a late afternoon free snacks and beverages. Our entire experience at this hotel was well above what I expected and, in many ways superior to service at area hotels with higher price tags. If we ever again need suite accommodations in Orlando this is the place we’ll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for group or family travel”
Reviews.Author: pacificsea
Reviews.Content: I bring several groups a year to Orlando and wouldn't stay anywhere else. Lexy Bapst is fantastic at getting my room blocks all ready for our arrival and all of the front desk staff are very friendly and accommodating. Two bedroom suites are perfect for group economy. The rooms are large and comfortable and the beds are fantastic. The breakfast has a large variety of hot and cold foods and is a great way to start the day. Everyone who works there is genuinely friendly and willing to go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Great value for families as well.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but a couple of drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: bikehawk47
Reviews.Content: spent the nights of Apr 29 and 30th 2010 - This hotel is a bit difficult to find so have a gps or map it before you travel. Great staff, nice rooms, beautiful pool, breakfast and managers reception were outstanding. On the negative side, TV's need an upgrade - old big box TV's with VCR's - the towels at poolside were small and threadbare - Motel 6 has better - the hot tub was not heated during our entire stay - there were not enough seats poolside. Also this hotel allows pets and, unfortunately, there were a lot of them there. I really do not like to hear dogs barking in other rooms

Reviews.Title: “Another Incredible Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: scknowles11769
Reviews.Content: I have stayed ay the LBV Residence Inn on many occasions. All have been AWESOME! Lexy Bapst the Guest Service Manager along with Marc the front Desk manager as well as all of the service staff, are always very accomidating and professional not to mention very helpful. Maria Martinez the GM of this property has put together a great team of Guest Service employees. She is always very engaging with me and many other guests. I will return soon and recommend to any business traveler. Regards, Sidney Knowles

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfy and (mostly) clean!”
Reviews.Author: Infiniti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a tour group in mid April. My room was a one bedroom suite which included a full kitchen (with dishwasher!) and two ancient but functioning TVs' (one in the bedroom and one in the living room.) Sleep wise, the bedding/mattresses of our 2 kings beds were of the very high standard expected of a Marriott, the air conditioning was quiet (a must for hot Orlando nights), and the soundproofing let in no noise whatsoever from outside the room (except for the booming thunder one night!). The bathroom wasn't cutting edge, but very clean and well maintained. Having the sink outside the bathroom was a nice touch. Towels and toiletries were plentiful for 4 people. My only complaints about the room would have to be a lack of Wi-Fi, a bit of dirt on the carpet near the door, and miscellaneous stains on the pull-out mattress from the couch. Chances are if you're coming to Orlando to tour the parks, you aren't looking for a great shopping/restaurant scene right at your doorstep. Even so, there wasn't a single business (other than more hotels) within walking distance of the hotel! At least the free breakfast buffet was of high quality and had virtually everything one could want. All the big parks are no more than a 15 minute drive away. All staff encountered were pleasant and competent. If you can just get past the comically bad "architecture" at the entrance, do not hesitate to stat here for touring Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all except one thing”
Reviews.Author: surprized
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything that has been written as far as all the good reviews go. It exceeded our expectations but if I had to say one negative thing it would have to be the laundry facility. We are a family of 4 and decided to pack light knowing we could do a load of laundry if we needed to. It turned out we needed to do two loads, however when I found the laundry room there were no coin operated dispensers for detergent and dryer sheets. We were on the 5th floor and although it was conveniant to have the laundry on the same floor I at that point had to work my way to the main lobby where they were selling the necessary items. However spending $2 for 2 dryer sheets and $2 for one small box of powder detergent (just enough for one load) was price gouging in my opinion. I guess it would not have seemed as bad had it been conveniantly available in the laundry room. I'm sure there might have been vandilism in the past that they are now selling it in the lobby. Again, other than that we will return because we loved it so much. Great service and VERY CLEAN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: absmit527
Reviews.Content: This was a church trip of 50+ people and everyone was very satisfied with this hotel. Li Oui with group sales was so helpful with the reservations and pretty much made this a very smooth process. The Hot Breakfast Bar is awesome and the food is good. After a day of fun and chaos at disney, it was great to come to a quiet, clean, realaxing hotel. The beds sleeps great! The Shuttle to Epcot is also a plus. If I come back to Disney, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: thub7
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The rooms were so roomy and the service was great. The free Deluxe breakfast every morning really saved us a lot of money because we ate so much for breakfast that we didn't want anything inside of Disney world until later in the day. The hotel was close to everything but far enough away to keep a quiet atmosphere. Being that close to the interstate was not a problem at all because I never heard any road noise. Li at the hotel helped us out a lot since we brought a group of 53 people to this hotel on a tour bus. There is nothing negative I can say about this hotel. Our stay was great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great value”
Reviews.Author: JJudy
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are all very friendly and go out of their way to be accomodating. On Easter Sunday the hotel manager herself was in the buffet handing out Easter eggs to children. The rooms are not large but are clean and have kitchen facilities. The fitness room is well maintained with working equipment. The hotel is well located close to Sea World and Universal Orlando. During our stay Easter weekend the hotel was full and children were everywhere, therefore I would not rate this hotel highly for a romantic couple weekend. For a good value in the Orlando area and as an alternative to staying in the more expensive hotels in the theme park areas, this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hospitality and Service beyond compare!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieThomasPam
Reviews.Content: Our family had the pleasure of spending five weeks at the Lake Buena Vista Residence Inn in Orlando Florida. We have been to the Lake Buena Vista area for vacations dozens and dozens of times but this was the first business trip. We needed to stay for five weeks. Since we took two young children with us, we needed space. I discovered the Residence Inn on line and made the reservation. I was delighted with every aspect of our stay. Our stay included a breakfast buffet daily. The folks who work in the dining area were always so cheerful, kind and helpful. The food was wonderful - bacon, eggs, muffins, Mickey Mouse waffles, juices, and cereals. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We had a family suite which included a child's bedroom with a TV and twin beds. Since we homeschool our children, we were delighted to see the child size counter with child size chairs - the perfect spot for our school work. We also had a spacious bedroom with a king size bed, a bathroom with a separate sink area and a nice sized closet. My favorite part was the full kitchen. We had a full size refrigerator and there was no need to find the ice machine in the hallway - we had an ice maker in the room. All the ice we wanted, all the time!! We had a dishwasher and the maid filled it and started it whenever I forgot or did not have time. We had a full size stove and a microwave too. We also had free high speed internet service! The most surprising part was the $25 in Disney Dollars which we recieved for every night of our stay. I warned the children before we left home that this was some sort of gimmick and surely we would not get $25 in Disney Dollars or any other dollars. Imagine my amazement when the front desk manager asked me on the first day or our 34 night visit if I wanted all $850.00 now or did I want it each week!! They handed me $850 in Disney gift cards which I used for restaurants, gifts, fast food, you name it. I could spend it at the parks, the resorts and even the Disney store at the Florida Mall. We were so centrally located. We were five minutes down a non-busy road to a Wal-Mart. It is a Wal-Mart like none I have ever seen before. It is actually an upscale Wal-Mart (I did not know there was such a thing!). We were ten minutes from the Disney Parks. I could drive the kids to the parks more quickly than when we previously stayed on Disney property. The front desk was responsive to our every need. One night there was problem with a pool part and we experienced noise. When I called the front desk, they responded by giving us keys to a second room, just for sleeping so that we would not be required to move all of our things to another room. I have never been to a hotel which gave me access to two rooms at the same time. The rooms were quiet and decorated nicely. Even after five weeks, I was not sick and tired of that room even though I was a bit homesick. I would recommend the Residence Inn to anyone staying in the Lake Buena Vista area or the Orlando area. You will be removed from the busy traffic areas, you will be near the parks, shopping and restaurants and you will have a quiet and restful trip. You also will leave with a friend or two.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable great service”
Reviews.Author: jimbird94
Reviews.Content: I am retired and stay in 6-8 difference hotels a year, for the past 9 years. The staff and management at this hotel is the best I have ever experienced We stayed four nights and the sales manager was in the breakfast room every morning checking with almost ever guest to see if things were OK. The hotel was nice and what you would expect for a hotel in this price range. Again, I just can't get over how nice the folks were.

Reviews.Title: “The VERY BEST hotel/staff you could ever want....awesome, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: kkandrocky
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th stay and each time, if that is possible, it gets better. The staff are awesome and cannot be helpful enough to you in all matters. I am a widow traveling with my little dog and I feel totally safe and secure here. I had a friend stay with me this time and she could not believe how great the staff are and how attentive they are to everyone for whatever their needs are. I am having great difficulty with a hip now and they could not have been better to me and my dog.
