They are all fantastic people, caring, efficient...the hotel is exceptionally clean and the food is great. In a rating of 1-100 , I would give them a 100 +++++. It is better than being at home....thank you for great stays, year after year!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Eddiepeddie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been around the world at least twice. I was a Travel Agent for 25 years and have stayed at more hotels than I care to mention. This hotel was among the best. You can't beat the value and location of this property. When I saw the hotel manager, Maria, walking around with a coffee pot at breakfast, I knew that this stay would be different from any other hotel that I've stayed at. She was actually speaking to her guests to find out how their stay is going. Hmmmm, a manager who actually cares and shows it? You go girl!! Not only is she happy but her staff is happy too and it shows in their work. Our "little apartment" was perfect. After a long day, it was so nice to come back to a clean and efficient space. We love to spread out and had plenty of room to do it in. There are a million hotels/motels in the Disney area. After 28 years of going to Orlando, trying all sorts of hotels, I've FINALLY found one that I'm happy with.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and generous”
Reviews.Author: kimmccambley
Reviews.Content: the people who work at this hotel treat you as if you were family, one person was nicer then the next, even the managers come in to the breakfast and dinner room and help work, it was a wonderful place to stay and very reasonable in price. I highly recomend this hotel,the pool was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “treated like family, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: kimmccambley
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in a 2 bedroom suite i have 3 children my husband and myself and my mom. we were able to check in early and get late check out with no problem. they had an awesome breakfast with the best waffles . i got the best night sleep great beds! the service is great always right in top of things i would truly reccommend this hotel and i will be returning next time i visit lso a big thanks to maria martinez for her hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat for 6 year old”
Reviews.Author: crikey68
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 5 nights here early March in order to experience Disneyworld and Epcot, oh and a 6th birthday for a princess! Had been in Tampa at the residence inn downtown then caught Amtrak from Tampa to Kissimee, then cab to hotel. Easy check in albeit with Marc the crazy Pom....LOL at least he wasnt as bad as front desk man Ricky! Only joking these 2 guys were awesome but there are some more people to mention, but we will get to that later. Had a family suite with king bed in seperate bedroom and 2 twin beds for the 6 year old, which she loved as the walls were painted with rainforest designs, very nice. Room was awesome, clean, spacious with 3 TVs....yes 3 TVs and a full kitchen and got a great rate direct with hotel. 2nd floor room with views of the pool, lovely pool heated a little to take the chill out of a cooler spell of Florida weather with a nice spa. Breakfast everyday was awesome waffles, eggs, bacon, pancakes, hot/cold ceral, fruit, pastries, breads juise, coffee list is endless, hard sometimes to find a table but staff worked hard to clean and clear a space for you. Had managers reception Mon to Thurs but we were never back in time to experience. Important to note here that the politeness, respect and courteous service was consistent and very much appreciated for our family from all disciplines of staff. Our housekeeper was magnificent and we spoke directly to the housekeeping manager to let them know what a great job she did for us. Just to clarify all my ratings were 5 except for location, probably Ok if you have transport but we didnt, made it hard to get to places even though you drove past plenty of dining options. We walked to sizzler one night and back but was tough on the 5 soon to be 6 year old. (mental note to self give sizzler a big miss). Hotel had shuttle, leaving 3 times a day 8am, 10.15 and 12.20 then coming back from Epcot at 5.30, 730 and 9.45pm. First day we hit majic kingdom and thought we would come back at the later time.....big mistake froze our butts off waiting in temps hovering around 30, seriously thought we were back in Alberta. Bus drops you at Epcot and you make your way from there to where ever you want to go. Loved Epcot, had lunch with the princess's absolutely magnificent, lots of pictures and the princess's were awesome especially Mary Poppins, apparently she is a princess now! The most enjoyable part of our stay was the last day, little did we know that front manager Lexy (we love you) arranged for a birthday cake and card to be delivered to our room when we got back from our last time to Majic Kingdom for our Daughters 6th birthday. She and the lovely Katrina gave her disney gifts from the gift shop and this really made her trip. This was an extraordinary jesture something in all out travels throughout North America we have never encountered and brought home to us the true feeling of a family hotel, good one Marriot. With more staff like Lexy and her team, people, including us will be back and cant recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for Disney World Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Texantt
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney World and couldn't have gone better. The free breakfast was perfect with something for everyone. We rented a car and drove the 5 miles each day to the different parks. At night we would stop by the Qdoba or any other restaurant/fast food place on our way back to the hotel. This really helped with food expenses! The hotel pool was fine, but we only had time to check it out once. Rooms were roomy and typical of RI. 2 bathrooms seemed to help in the mornings with kids. When visiting Disney World, you really only need a hotel as a "complement". This was the perfect complement!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: aander927
Reviews.Content: I love Residence Inns because of their high quality, reliability and no surprises. Lake Buena Vista Residence Inn is no exception. The well-kept grounds with tropical plants and trellis, beautiful spa/pool/fountain area, clean spacious guest rooms, sumptuous breakfasts, and a tireless front desk staff who attend to your every need, all add up to a rewarding experience with each stay. The front desk is anchored by Guest Services Manager Lexy Bapst who not only ensures reservation accuracy per your request, but constantly checks to ensure the accommodations and hotel are meeting your needs. The breakfast staff is also tireless. On one occasion they ran out of an item as it was close to closing time for breakfast. A staffer asked what I needed, and proceeded to prepare a fresh batch of the item. Now that's what I call service. This hotel stands out as one of the best, because of the quality, service, and a very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: hinges
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right near everything. Easy access to the highway, and "I Drive" and Disney are very close by. There are also a variety of restaurants from all you can eat to top end. If you absolutely are intent on gettin downtown, the cab ride is about $30-$35 so if you are with group its not too bad. There is also a complimentary breakfast that you can feed all the kids with. Anything from pancakes and sausage, all the way down to fruit and toast. And you don't have to wake up at the crack of dawn to get it. I think breakfast hours are around 6-9 or 9:30. You will enjoy the spacious rooms and if you are with a family, the suite works out well because of the multiple TV's in the room so you don't have to argue over whats on.

Reviews.Title: “Accomidations at the last minute saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: cobbfamilySlidell_La
Reviews.Content: The staff and sales team at this hotel are amazing! The Residence Inn is very nice, in a great location and the most important we all had a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Housekeeping, avoid”
Reviews.Author: hyslopc
Reviews.Content: I stay 70+ nights a year at Residence Inns, and this place was way below average in most respects. The check-in experience was subpar. The first night I tried to cook a pizza in the oven, but while the oven was preheating, the room filled up with so much smoke that I had to turn it off - the oven obviously had not been cleaned in a long time. I called front desk and asked them to clean the oven the next day. Two days later I tried to use it again, and it had obviously not been cleaned at all. I called the front desk again and asked (again) for the oven to be cleaned, and they said they would send someone up right away, which they did (note that I did not receive an apology). A housekeeper appeared half an hour later with a can of oven cleaner and asked me what I wanted her to do. I shrugged and said "Clean the oven"? She asked me how, exactly, she should do it, and pointed out that the oven was warm, and that maybe it could be dangerous to do it while the oven was warm. She seemed annoyed at having to be there at all, so I said that it was fine with me if she came back in half an hour, but that got her even more irritated, since she informed me in no uncertain terms that she would be on her way home in half an hour. I then read the can, and showed her that it says on the can that the oven can be hot, but she said she might burn herself. So I opened the oven and carefully and quickly put my fingers on the heating element to see how warm it was, and then informed her that it was not that hot. She said that she couldn't take the risk, at which point I wrapped my hand around the element and held it there. After 10 seconds she rolled her eyes and said "OK", and started looking like she was preparing to actually - horror of horrors - clean the oven. At that point I grabbed the kids and we headed down to the pool, but we couldn't get into the pool - our card didn't work. We went to the front desk and explained that the pool gate wouldn't open, and they said that the pool gate we had tried often doesn't work, so just to try another. I was a bit stunned, but did as they said, and sure enough, the problem was with the gate. This problem persisted during our entire 2-week stay - they didn't bother to fix it. However since it took much longer to go around to the other gate, my 5-year old son came up with a solution - he could easily reach through the gate from underneath, and open it from the outside. Safe, eh? A 5 year old can open the gate and let himself into the pool area without an adult - mmmm. Once we got back to the room, my wife threw a pizza into the oven, but after 10 minutes we realized that our oven cleaning saga was not over - the room filled up with smoke. So no pizza that night - again. I called the front desk, who noted the problem and said they would fix the problem the next day (again, no apology - I'm just a Marriott Platinum member, who cares?). I was so disgusted that I took a photo of the oven, which had been completely sprayed with oven cleaner, but had not been wiped down, but I can't get the photo off my camera until I get home (will try and post it later). I could have gotten down on my hands and knees and cleaned the oven myself, like I do at home, but hey - isn't that why I'm staying at a hotel on vacation, to avoid having to do stuff like that? The next day they actually cleaned the oven (yippee), however the day after that housekeeping didn't show up at all. We didn't bother complaining. We're a family of 5, and since there were only 4 plates and sets of cutlery (despite the fact that we booked the room for 5 people), had brought up additional plates and cutlery from breakfast. They disappeared. Again, and again, and again - despite repeated calls to front desk, asking them not to take them. Housekeeping also threw out things which weren't trash - repeatedly, even when we hid them behind the TV, in a futile attempt to avoid the problem. Nothing really important, but just stuff we didn't want thrown out. Finally we asked to talk to a manager about all the problems we had, and after that, housekeeping stopped taking out trash that we put under the sink next to the trash bin, which wouldn't fit in the bin - groan. The final straw came on New Year's Eve, when we all put on party hats, brought out the chilled Champagne, and lightly pan-fried some awesomely thick Ahi Tuna steaks. There's no extractor fan in the kitchen, and the frying pan isn't non-stick, so we opened the windows before we started cooking. Despite that, the smoke detectors went off - big time. The sound was so loud, my kids started crying. Even my 9 year-old was crying, saying that her ears hurt. I am seriously worried about damage to their hearing - it was *that* loud. Of course we stopped cooking immediately, opened the door to the corridor, and I called front desk and asked for someone to come up to turn the smoke detectors off, but no-one came, and it seems the smoke detectors in this hotel won't turn themselves off automatically, they need to be manually reset. Finally I called again, and I'm a very calm person, but I told them in no uncertain terms that someone had to come NOW and turn the smoke detectors off, since we just couldn't take it any longer. Finally someone came and turned them off, but our New Year's Eve was completely ruined - my wife was hysterical, and my kids just wanted to go to bed. The next day I booked us into another hotel, and the day after that we checked out (2 weeks earlier than planned), and driving out of there, we just felt a huge sense of relief to put it all behind us. If you plan on using the kitchen, care about good housekeeping, or value the safety of your children, then I have one word to describe this hotel: Avoid. Stay at Residence Inn Seaworld, instead, or basically anywhere except here.

Reviews.Title: “Two words : Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary500
Reviews.Content: Need we say more. confirmed the bites and the cast off skins plus one bloody bug once we got access to the internet. The skins were found in the bed sheets on only one of the beds. Did not see much other evidence. changed the sheets and did not see any more.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: CanadianOkeh
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband for World Cup Paintball Tournament at Disney World of Sports. We both loved the hotel. It was close to lots of amenities but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Disney to be quiet and relaxing. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool here and soaking in the hot tub in the evening. Staff were lovely and the place was nice and tidy. The bar by the pool served some lovely drinks too. I would definately want to go back and would highly recommend it to people.

Reviews.Title: “What we've come to expect from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: journeypaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights just before Thanksgiving. We stayed on the fifth floor (top) facing the pool. We had myself (39), wife, and three children (12, 10, 8). We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom room. Plenty of space, well kept and clean room. The beds, as always, were very comfortable. It was great having two bedrooms and two bathrooms. Plus 3 tv's. The pool area is very large and was never crowded when we were there. We played at the parks all day and came back and would swim and hang out in the hot tub in the evening. The front desk staff were very helpful when we needed directions or asked a question. The breakfast had enough options, and warm food. It was good, not great. But for free - it definitely worked for us and was enough. I would suggest making sure your room faces the pool, as at least one of the sides of the building faces I-4. We never heard any noise on our side. We used the free shuttle service to Disney on one day. It took a little longer getting there, but not bad. On the way back we missed the shuttle and waited an hour - couldn't get a hold of the driver, and ended up taking a taxi. Trying to save $14 parking, we paid $22 for a cab. Didn't do that again.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean, got put in 3 different rooms due to uncleanliness”
Reviews.Author: heathermark28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our son's birthday trip to Disney World. We researched the hotel online and saw the great reviews so we were excited to get a 2 bedroom residential suite. Needless to say our troubles had just begun! We checked in and went to the room they assigned- where my toddler son found a condom wrapper on the side of the bed, and a hand towel that was wadded up on the bed next to the condom wrapper. Also, every time the door to that bedroom was shut the small closet to I believe the heater? opened with dirty q-tips laying on the floor. So we decided not to leave and give the hotel another chance... we understand sometimes housekeeping does NOT do their jobs! Second room, different level-we go in and their is a VERY strong chemical odor, we could not figure out what it was other than my husband being told the carpets were recently cleaned and maybe it was the chemicals used to clean the floors. We decided that we would not complain and just open the windows. After being in the room for about 20 minutes we all started feeling faint, had very bad headaches and felt nauseous. My toddler decided that he would take off his shoes and he immediately said told us that his feet were wet. Huh?? So we took off our sandles and sure enough the carpets were soaking wet!!!! I guess the concierge had forgotten to mention that the carpets were JUST cleaned!! Finally after my husband calling down to front desk and complaining that now we were in our second room and hello?! They then put us in another room on again another level and everything seemed perfect...after 2 and a half hours of switching from room to room to room we finally made it to downtown disney right at dinner rush. When we got back to the room we had a message to call down, they gave us a free night which made us feel alittle better, and brought us a large goody bag with wine and food. After waking up and packing up to leave Orlando my sister pulls down her sheets to make sure she didn't leave any phone accessories and what does she find?? A pair of earrings that were NOT hers or any of ours! We we're disgusted, but what else could we do? We will not be staying at this hotel again! Our relative that works for Marriott could not believe what we told her, in her exact words we should have been given both nights free. All of us had terrible headaches all night from the chemicals that were used to clean room # 2.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: cull_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista for 6 nights at the beginning of November while we were visiting Disney World. It's about a 15 minute drive to most of the Disney theme parks from the hotel. The multi-cultural staff was very friendly and cheerful, and most of the other guests we met in public places seemed to be happy. For those of you who like to travel with your canine friends, we saw plenty of dogs at this hotel. But my one recommendation is that if you have to use a computer while staying here, bring your own! The two computers available for guest use were always in demand, and one of them had a virus, which a staff member was trying to fix all week long.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: LCXY
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the beginning of Nov. As Marriott members we were given the courtesy of an upgrade which we appreciate. The rooms are spacious and clean. If you have more than 2 people the living area seating would be a little uncomfortable. The staff was very welcoming. They asked if we were happy with our room and when we said we'd like a larger one they found us another one. It is convenient having the hot buffet breakfast available. Also, having the flavored water at the check-in desk, especially after a busy day, is refreshing. A concern we had is the smoking allowed around the pool area, especially cigar smoke. It permeates the entire area and makes it very uncomfortable. We tried to move as far away as possible but were not able to get away from it. A suggestion would be to set aside one area away from the other guests preferably away from the pool. Found people that were there for a workshop/conference would come out at lunch hour and smoke. Also, the spa was constantly filled with toddlers which did not make it appealing it go in.

Reviews.Title: “It is ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: jim_bowler
Reviews.Content: As with most of the reviewers the rooms are very average indeed, but for the price we paid $290.26 for a two day stay over the weekend of Nov 6-8, 2009 it was sufficient. Yes the TV's are old tube types no flat screens here. We were not there to watch TV but spent the weekend at the Wine and Food Festival at EPCOT. Rooms were just so so but clean, our room showed its age. The living area had one couch that not very comfortable to sit on and one chair that only the back reclined. Not a very comfortable living room when you have four adults looking for a place to relax and have a drink. It is a bit out of the way nad next to the interstate, yes there is traffic noise if you are next to I-4. On the positive side you can save a few bucks by getting their breakfast which is nothing to write home about but you can make do with it and will fill you up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelchick1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to be kids all over again so we spent 5 days at Disney and stayed at this hotel. It was perfect! Free breakfast every morning, free parking, free shuttle to and from all the parks, close to Seaworld, free-beer happy hour with snacks during the week-I'm not sure if wine or liquor were also free. The rooms were clean, large, and ours overlooked the pool. The breakfast buffet changed slightly everyday. The hotel was near grocery stores, liquor stores, and outlet shopping. We ordered in one evening-pizza from Flippers, and it was fabulous!!! There was no restaurant on-site, however, they will give you (if you ask) a list of restaurants that deliver to this hotel. This was a great value and we would definitely stay here again if we were to go to Disney again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mediocre, would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm rating this hotel average is because I've stayed at other hotels in this area that cost more and were awful. This wasn't awful. The Pros: Nice Breakfast Buffet Reasonable Rates Free Internet but no WiFi No Parking Fee The Cons: The rooms are borderline shabby. Kitchen counters need updating and the entire room needed to be thoroughly cleaned, not just surface cleaned. The kitchen cabinet knobs were grimy, the room was stuffy and smelled like burned food. The bathroom also was in need of thorough cleaning and updating. The room size was nice but the layout wasn't great. The bathroom sink area was open to the bedroom and there is no way to have privacy at the sink if someone is in the bed. Outdated TV and uncomfortable sofa in the living area. No dish soap in the kitchen, there were only 2 pots provided for cooking; 1 very large and 1 very small, not at all sufficient. There was a horrible stench in the stairwell, making it very unpleasant to use the stairs. I would not stay here again and I expect much more from a Mariott affiliate than what I got here.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay at Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buffy333Florida
Reviews.Content: Wow! Wonderful hotel, great breakfast buffet, close to parks:: you have to experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: stephm0188
Reviews.Content: My husband needed to travel to the Orlando area for business, so I tagged along with our toddler to go to the Disney parks. We're Marriott Rewards members, so we were given a complimentary upgrade to a two bedroom suite. The staff was friendly and employees went out of their wayto greet us whenever they saw us in the halls or common areas. The dining area was large, and the breakfast buffet was better than most Residence Inns we have stayed in. The hot options were a bit lacking, but it was complimentary. The Mickey waffle makers were a big hit. The pool was larger than most hotel pools, and the surrounding area was nice. There was a small toddler wading pool in the shade, which I definately appreciated. There weren't any more pool towels available one evening, but the staff was quick to respond and bring more. We stayed in the Aruba section on the third floor overlooking the pool. It did get a bit noisy at times, but it wasn't enough to interrupt anything. The room itself felt a little damp, but that seems par for the course in Florida. The room appears to have been recently updated in some aspects, but it felt shabby in others. The TV's were older, and there was one VCR in the living area. Who uses VCRs anymore? I was disappointed to discover this Residence Inn did not have wireless access like many others we have stayed in. The connection was also very slow. The kitchen area was clean but a bit outdated. Parts of the room were in disrepair.. one shower rod was barely hanging on, the carpet was coming up outside the bathroom door, and the door handle fell off one evening when we were leaving. The beds were comfortable, the cable tv options were plentiful, and overall the room was clean and comfortable. Our room did feel a bit far away from the lobby and dining area. There are lots of dining and entertainment options near the hotel, but you will need a car to reach them. Several local restaraunts do offer delivery (Chili's and TGI Friday's are among the choices, as well as Italian, Indian, and Chinese restaraunts. One of the primary reasons we chose this hotel was was because of the free shuttle to Disney. The shuttle service was contracted through another company was was very lacking. The buses were dirty,hot, and did not have air conditioning, the pickup and drop off times were inconvienent, and the drivers were always late and unfriendly. The drivers were content to watch my try to juggle a toddler, stroller, and bag without ever offering to lend a hand, yet they still expected me to tip them. Had I known the shuttle service would have been so awful, we would have chosen another hotel within the Downtown Disney area so that we could have used Disney's bus service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: katzee_m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Orlando Lake Buena Vista on our recent trip to Orlando. We got a two-bedroom suite and when we got there, everything was in order. The suite and the rooms were just the right size. There were two beds, a bathroom and a TV set in each room. The suite had a living area and a fully equipped kitchen. You can cook if you prefer and if you have time. A complimentary hot breakfast buffet is served daily and we enjoyed that thoroughly. If you're staying for a while though you may get tired of the selection because I think it's the same everyday. There are plenty of dining options nearby though so that wouldn't be a problem. The location was perfect. It was a short drive away from the attractions but if you're not driving, you can take their complimentary shuttle to Epcot. Parking is free for guests. Other perks include a Managers Reception every Monday and Thursday, free drinks at the pool area at certain hours of the day. Housekeeping also kept our suite spotless all three days we were there. We had a pleasant time here and would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at a not-so-busy location”
Reviews.Author: xxtoyxx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with our grandmum, aunt, uncle and their 10-year old son on a two-bedroom suite at Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista. We were a bit lost going to the place and missed the road where we are supposed to turn right, but it is okay. Perhaps they should put a real big sign on that turn. The rooms in the suite are clean and it is quite huge. I wouldn't mind staying in the place for a whole week (though we only stayed for 4d/3n). The beds are comfortable. You can't expect a lot of view though, most rooms are facing the parking lot. Breakfast is complimentary. While they don't have an extensive selection, they have breakfast favourites like pancakes, bacon, eggs, hash brown, oats/grits, fruits and Mickey waffles--just good to fuel you up before you start a theme-park day. The inn has a mini-store at the lobby, but I suggest buying your stuff like water and grocery items on stores nearby as the items in their mini-store are expensive. People in the lobby are friendly and are always there to answer any queries. They offer free food and drinks every afternoon of weekdays (Mon-Thu) at the pool area (food varies every day), but we didn't actually availed of it as we were usually out. This is a good incentive for those who will arrive in the hotel early and stay for the rest of the day. Restaurants are just a few minutes away if you are bringing a car. We wouldn't mind staying here again in the future if we will go back to Orlando for our Disney or Universal fix!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Very clean! Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SilBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one week with my 2 year old boy, It was great! free parking! great breakfast (including waffles with Mickey Mouse Face)...the staff is very friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable. I recommend it 100%!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for Disney World proximity or if you're travelling for free”
Reviews.Author: DiscoParty
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty depressing. The staff was nice enough and the rooms were OK. All the rooms on one side face a very busy highway. On another side, they face the pool, which I managed to get. Other rooms face the parking lots, I suppose. The hotel is located on a fairly industrial stretch of road and I felt isolated there. There was a hotel being constructed right next to it that no one seemed in any rush to complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: FLRELady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 2 nights at this hotel and found it very nice for the value. We had a one bedroom unit and it had more than what we needed for our shot visit. We were on a budget this trip due to job losses but found this hotel to be very adequate. The location was very convenienct to restaurants and the Disney parks. The room size was adequate, clean and quiet. The morning breakfast spread enhanced the value and the area was much bigger than most Residence Inn's where you can't get a seat to eat your free breakfast. There was plenty of room at this location and the staff overseeing the food were very friendly. My only complaint about the location is there wasn't a convenient Starbucks in the vicinity! Oh well, I lived and we found one in the outlet mall that does open before the mall does..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: natrat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in a 2 BR/2 bath suite with a AAA rate of $132 obtained on the Marriott website. The room was supposed to have 1king and 2 queens w/ sofabed in living area. We had 2 queens in each of the bedrooms which made it very comfy for 6 of us in the room. The breakfast had a very good selection of dishes and tasted ok. Rooms were clean. They were a bit dated with VCR and no flat panel TV. Remote did not work in one of the rooms. A request to fix a closet door was responded to promptly with the door fixed and a nice note apologizing for the problem. Road noise was not a major issue. No wifi in the rooms but a network cable for free highspeed connection was provided. Two pc were available in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every visit”
Reviews.Author: revoFL
Reviews.Content: We rate this hotel an A+. We stay at this resort every visit to Orlando. We typically get either the family suite or larger suite. This gives us a main bedroom and a 2nd bedroom , a large living area, and a FULL kitchen. The free breakfast buffet offers a lot of selection and is located in a LARGE dining area. Every night (except FRI-SUN) the hotel offers free food of some sort between 5 and 630PM. Thursday nights is usually a cookout with hamburgers and hotdogs. This is the best deal in the area as far as price and what you get for it. We get the military rate, which gives a substantial discount on the room rates, but you can probably get good deals on AAA or AARP or the like. There is a brand new, extra large Walmart that has just been built about 3 miles up the road. The "back" Disney entrance to the Downtown Disney area is about 2 miles away. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BJHarroun
Reviews.Content: I had a two bedroom suite. The two bedroom suites have one bedroom with two queen beds, the other with one king bed and a desk, There is a pull out couch in the living room .This is a good hotel if you are going to visit the parks - especially with family. They have a shuttle which takes you to Epcot Center where you can board Disney transportation. You should mind the schedule so that you wouldn't be left. It is also near things like Sea World and Discovery Cove.. There is a free hot breakfast (and it is a fairly good, better than average Residence Inn Breakfast) which makes it economical. We housed six in the room. The dining area is quite large - and they have a nice pool area. On Thursday night they had a barbecue. They served hot dogs, hamburgers, baked beans, salad. This saved us a dinner expense. The management and staff are very friendly. Even the maintenance people asked if they could get me anything. The rooms are not completely up to date. They should replace the tvs and there was There was a VCR in the one in the living room area - and who uses VCR's anymore? - The internet connection is in the dining room, not the bedroom with a desk, but with a wireless connection you can take your computer anywhere in the hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: adee74
Reviews.Content: I wish I could rate this hotel 3.5 stars, but I cannot so I have to downgrade to just average. This hotel is located in a cluster of three hotels near Seaworld. It's near Seaworld and near restaurants and shopping but a car really is required to enjoy the area. We had a rental so the free parking was one of three main reasons why I chose this hotel. I stayed at this hotel in a one bedroom suite for 4 nights with my teen-aged son. The bedroom had two beds and there was a pull-out sofa in the living room. Check in quick and the suite itself is very nice, clean and spacious. I liked the fact that the bathroom and sink area are separate so two people can get ready at the same time. The kitchen area has a dishwasher, two burner stove, full-size microwave oven and full-size refrigerator - and all were clean inside and out. Free internet was the second reason why I chose this hotel - it can only be accessed at the (small) dining room table. Most hotels only have one access point for wired internet in the room, so I wasn't put off about it. The third reason why I chose this hotel is for the free breakfast buffet. It is free but I'd didn't like the hot options so I was a little disappointed there. Greasy sausage, powdered eggs, soggy corned beef hash does not equal decent food IMO. To be fair, there was also bagels, bread, juices, milk, and cereal being served so you had a choice of being healthy or not. We stayed in the Aruba section which requires a key card to access the building. That being said, three times a day, we were bombarded with local pizza shops sliding their menus under the door every morning, noon, and night. Housekeeping would just place the menus on the desk or leave on the floor for us to pick up and discard. Housekeeping also likes to knock on the door at 8 a.m. if you don't have the Do Not Disturb sign out. I didn't have it out, but I just felt it was a little rude and off-putting on bang on doors at 8 a.m. for people that weren't checking out. Also, the bathroom toilet ran very slow. You had to hold the lever down for about 20 seconds in order for it to flush completely. I also think they should do away with the VCRs and upgrade to DVD players just because it's 2009 and DVDs are more widely used. The pool area looks nice but we didn't use it. The printer in the business room doesn't work properly but the desk clerk let me use her computer behind the front desk to print my documents. She even faxed them for me for free so that was cool. All in all, between the free parking, free internet access, and free breakfast I probably saved about $45 per day. I enjoyed two out of three so I'm satisfied. I would recommend this hotel to others. However, I would probably only book this hotel again if other options weren't available.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: hopesicle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just one night while we were in the Orlando area. Everything was clean, the beds and pillows were comfortable, shower was great...we would definitely stay here again. Although it is a suite with 2 rooms, you wouldn't want to travel with another couple because the 2nd room has no door and no bathroom! So it's ideal for a family with children but also a great stay for just a couple. Great location, the pool area was very nice and the breakfast was absolutely the best I've ever had at a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms but noisy freeway”
Reviews.Author: JoeDaOrtho
Reviews.Content: Room was great size with plenty of space, nice buffet breakfast and easy access to all Disney, Seaworld, Universal studios. However room overlooked the freeway and was quite noisy. Ask for rooms away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel if you're going to Sea World, Discovery Cove, Disney etc”
Reviews.Author: guy_traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you are going to visit the parks - especially with family. Disney isn't all that far away and things like Sea World and Discovery Cove are nearby also. You need a car really if you want to get around very easily, but the combination of a lower hotel rate, free parking, free breakfast (and it is a fairly good, better than average Residence Inn Breakfast) make it economical even if you have to rent a car. The two bedroom suites have one bedroom with two beds, the other with one bed and a desk, which is optimal for families. The dining area is quite large - and they have a nice pool area. The management and staff are better than average. There are a few things that I'd like to point out just so it is known. -The TV's in our suite were not all that new. They worked adequately. There was a VCR in the one in the living room area - and who uses VCR's anymore? -The air conditioning kept it comfortable enough, but to keep it cool enough to work, for example, might be challenging. - The internet connection is in the dining room, not the bedroom with a desk. I imagine more than one person has settled down at that desk, wanting to hook up to the net and been surprised. - Some parts of the room are showing signs of wear, such as the closet doors and bathroom. Nothing really bad, just a point to make. However, if you want everything you need at a reasonable price, I'd say this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the mouse, yet so far away!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel101
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is perfect if you have little kids! This is a Residence Inn, so remember FREE breakfast! With that said, who could ask for more with the Mickey Mouse waffle maker! Its enough to make me want to go back. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are amazing! We stayed in a family suite, and there is a great room (imagine and open area off of the living room) where there are 2 twin beds. Perfect for our 4 and 9 year olds. Full kitchen, so why bother spending so much in the parks. The ONLY downfall is the bus to Disney. It only runs 3 times in the morning and 3 at night. It is the FIRST stop in a line of many hotels, so expect 45 minutes once you board the bus to make it to the park., Try asking a 4 year old to wait to see the mouse! The other downfall is you have to plan the return trip BEFORE you head into the parks. We ended up taking taxis home. With kids its hard to tell when they will run out of steam for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Service as it should be”
Reviews.Author: dougdaeditor
Reviews.Content: Being friendly, helpful and attentive goes a long way for a traveler...especially in these gloomy economic times. Me and my wife-to-be traveled to Orlando from Frankfurt on the spur of the moment to get married. Being a fairly loyal Marriott customer I shopped for one of those hotels in the area. Because we were going to be in town for nine days, getting something that offered more of a studio or suite setup made sense. So I read some reviews on tripadvisor and picked this hotel for me and a few family and friends who were coming in for the festivities. Next to my beautiful bride, it is the best choice I have made in a long time. The pool was wonderful if a bit crowded at times; the free beer and snacks everyday at 5 was a nice touch; the free breakfast was more than adequate; the place was clean; the workout room had up-to-date cardio equipment and free weights; the beds were comfy and the rooms were quiet...but that was not the best part of our stay. No, the best part was the staff headed up by the affable, hard-working GM George, who set just the right tone. You really got the feeling (believed) that they wanted their guests to have the best stay possible. And in all candor, once they found out we were in town to be married the service soared. Still, it was easy to see they wanted to make everybody's stay just right. No pouting allowed. I travel pretty frequently around the world and have not had better service than this anywhere. Major kudos to the folks that work at this hotel. You make the place.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable practical alternative for families”
Reviews.Author: cgklar
Reviews.Content: Our stay for three nights was delightful. Yes, it is close to the parks which suited us fine. Our room was clean and huge. The breakfast buffet is enormous. There is something to suit even the pickiest kids. It was nice to fill up on breakfast so we wouldn't have to pay park prices for lunch. It does get crowded b/n 8:30 and 9:00 a.m. and we found it difficult to find a table but the staff is great and very accomodating. The pool area looked very inviting but we didn't leave enough time for that. My only complaint was that I noticed on my copy of the bill that was emailed to me there were three erroneous telephone charges which we did not make. I called the hotel right away and they said they would reverse it. A couple of things to note outside the hotel is that there is construction currently going on at the building next door. The closest grocery store which is in a shopping center by McDonalds is VERY expensive. There is probably a more affordable alternative not too far away. Try checking out the Hess station within the Disney property on Buena Vista Blvd. There are many restaurant choices nearby--some within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but be careful!”
Reviews.Author: TrevBy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent in all respects. The breakfast was as massive as you wanted and well presented. The rooms were clean and cleaned daily. No complaints there! But we assumed that being "close to restaurants and shops" and having shuttles to theme parks (which were well timed and regular) we would not need a car. Wrong! It was not possible to walk to any restaurant or shop (not just distance, but no sidewalks) so we were forced to have Take-aways delivered for our evening meals. Apart from that we enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for young families”
Reviews.Author: RSW777
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three days/two nights at Disney with our three young children. This hotel is a great option, as it's only a few minutes from Downtown Disney & all the Disney parks. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff does a nice job. Nice breakfast selection, including Mickey waffles. There's a large courtyard with heated pool. Plenty of restaurants close by for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: carolinacatz
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here the week of Thanksgiving for vacation and birthday celebration. We looked at a lot of possibilities, including renting points for a Disney Vacation Club villa, but this was really exactly what we needed. Our two bedroom suite was attractive and included a king bedroom/bath plus another separate bedroom/bath with two beds (doulbes or queens) plus a full kitchen/living area. There were three tvs. The pool was nice but a little chilly in late November, and the hottub was something we all looked forward to in the evening. The breakfast was good--they had eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, pancakes, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, etc. The facility seemed very well run and attractive. We used the laundry facilities (there is no change machine but the bartender made change for us). In general the staff wasn't doting but did their job well and the manager saved one of our mornings by jumpstarting our car very quickly, which we greatly appreciated!!!!! For us, the location was ideal since we did have a car. It is really as close as some of the Disney properties and it is extremely convenient to Sea World and Discovery Cove. If you turned right you could avoid the congestion and get to things like WalMart, groceries, etc. We got a note prior to Thanksgiving Day explaining that service would be minimal for the actual holiday and to let them know in advance if we required anything more. I appreciated this as I think it shows they treat their employees with respect and that is important to me and I think it shows in the attitude. I think they handled it very well. I can see how the place could get overrun with big groups but I imagine that could happen anywhere. I would definitely return in the future! Elizabeth in NC

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!!”
Reviews.Author: brookst169
Reviews.Content: I booked the Residence Inn LBV after reading all the glowing reviews here. I made a reservation through the hotel directly back in August for Two 1-bedroom king suites. I confirmed my reservation with the hotel 2 days before check in as we were traveling to Disney for my son's 6th Birthday and my husband's birthday. We were also meeting my parents in Florida, whom we see only once a year. When we arrived at the hotel (which I will say is far away from everything) we noticed there were buses in the parking lot. When I went to check in I was told the rooms were far away from one another. Then I was told that one of my rooms had been 'upgraded' to a family suite. When I got to the room it was just one big box room. The purpose of my booking a 1 bedroom suite was so that I could put my 6 year old to bed and my husband and I could stay up...this was not an upgrade. Not only that, but both rooms we were given were handicap rooms. When I complained about the rooms, the girl was indifferent toward me. I opted to find another hotel in the area & check out the next day. When I checked out the manager didn't even offer an apology for the mix up. She barely even looked up. Not the kind of treatment you would expect from a Marriott chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Residence Inn Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Orlandufun08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn Seaworld the first week of November for 8 nights and had a great time. We booked a 2 bed/2 bath suite for $149.00/night, including full breakfast. Arrived at 4:40pm and check in was a breeze. Our corner room on the fifth floor was large and spacious for our family of 6, nothing fancy but right what we needed for our vacation: a clean hotel to rest after our long days at the parks and malls. We had 3 queen beds, seating area, 3 TVs (no flat screens but OK to watch the news and weather), a full kitchen with stove, fridge, microwave, dishwasher, coffeemaker, pots & pans, etc. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms and kitchen were very clean. Housekeeping made our room everyday and did a good job. Breakfast was OK, not great, but considering it was free we found it very convenient. They offered eggs, waffles, oatmeal, cereal, pastries, bagels, fruits, coffee and juices, just enough to start our day. Location is good, but only if you have a car. Easy access to I-4, International Drive and Vineland Ave (here you can find the Premium Outlets, Walgreens and a Publix to stock the fridge) Bottom line, we recommend this hotel for families looking for a clean-well-located-affordable hotel, without paying the extra $$$ for the “Disney Magic”.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A_and_B_from_PA
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights at this hotel in Oct., 2008 and were pleased by the highly competitive price. It was our second stay here and we were not disappointed in our return. The free breakfast is fantastic, the rooms are excellent because they are so much larger and have more amenities than a regular hotel room (full kitchen, sitting room, etc.). The five-minute drive to Downtown Disney doesn't hurt, either. We were impressed with the exercise room - including the individual TV screens for each treadmill and elliptical. The property also includes a fine pool and two outdoor hot tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FlaviaHC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option in this area considering its price. I´ve been there with my husband and kid ( 5 years) in October 2008, in one bedroon suite. It is a little bit small, but perfect for 3. I have no complain about it, maybe the breakfast that never changes its options. But, as I said, its great for the price. Very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SunnyGlossop
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks break and all things considered were very happy with the hotel. Room:- Large and spacious and kept clean throughout our stay, large fridge freezer, cooking facilities, microwave, toaster & dishwasher + all utensils supplied. 2 large TVs + 1 video. Good A/C unit and laptop access. Bath & good shower. Excellent sound proofing, didnt hear any neighbor noise througout our stay, corridoors were carpeted which certainly helped. Pool area:- Not overly large but did the job, never saw any time where all loungers were being used. Whole pool area is gated which means you can let your kids roam whithout worrying. Pool Bar is cosy but shut at about 10.15pm Location:- If you accept that you need a car for almost all trips then the location is not an issue, if you are the type who likes a walk in the evening then this cannot be done without first taking a taxi ride or driving. Only 5 mins drive from Prime Outlets (too far to walk) and 10 mins from Disney Downtown. All staff were excellent, nothing too much trouble. Breakfast was an added bonus although not varied enough, eggs, bacon, sausage (in the shape of slim burgers), waffles, 4 cereals, porridge, doghnuts, toast, coffee, tea and juices. (the drinks were available througout the day foc) Free internet access, although with only 1 terminal i did find it tricky to find out how the Latics (Oldham Athletic FC) were getting on. Watch out for the family of Racoons often seen around the back of the hotel Overall would i return?.....Yes Would i recommend to freinds?......Yes This Hotel does not have the WOW factor but i feel it certainly ticks all the boxes and is well worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good.”
Reviews.Author: awp2005
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suite was good, great size, functional kitchen and very clean. Breakfast was nice touch but the menu need some variation. The staff were friendly and helpful. This hotel is close to major sights but somehow located in the deserted area, no restaurant or convenient store within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly great!!”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat73
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I cannot say enough good things about it. My hubby and I and our three kids ages 11,9 and 5 spent 4 nights at this hotel in June, and it was great! From the wonderful and FREE breakfast each morning, to the close proximity to Disney World, from the large size of the rooms to the very kind people it was delightful, and I am picky! We had a bad experience last time at a comfort inn, so it was between Marriott and Hilton, and we made the right decision. The rooms were large (2 bathrooms and plenty of room, 2 TVs, full sized kitchen, plenty of pillows and towels). The breakfast was always fresh with a lot of options, from fresh fruit to pastries, to hot eggs, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, cold cereal, fresh juices etc. Although we didn't have time to enjoy the pool because of the running around the parks, it looked very nice and clean, we would sit outside with our breakfast each morning overlooking the pool. For the price we paid this hotel was good beyond expectations. There is really nothing bad that I can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Lola1965
Reviews.Content: We booked 6 rooms with other families for a sporting event at Wide World of Sports Complex. We enjoyed the two bedroom two bathroom suites. The second bedrooms were large and had two queen beds and the kitchen was ample for our needs. The rooms were very clean, the hotel modern and the pool area was large and good for socializing. The Managers and staff were very friendly and accommodating. The free warm & cold breakfast buffet was very good, and probably excellent considering most other hotels free breakfast we've experienced. The location and rooms were quiet. We would definitely stay at this property again. We received a slight discount for booking a large number of rooms for multiple nights directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the residence Inn one fo the best in the area”
Reviews.Author: penguin362
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the residence inn for a 10 day vacation at Disney. We have traveled to the area every 2 years for the past 12 years. We have never stayed at the same location twice but will rebook here for our next trip. The staff at the hotel could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Any needs were met immediately and with a pleasant attitude. We had a 2 bedroom suite with the queen beds. We had a pool view, at night you could hear the activity at the pool but once the pool closed the resort was extremely quite. The room was perfect for our family. We did not use the kitchen but it was adequate for cooking for a family. The breakfast buffet was great! There were several hot and cold choices and they supply was well stocked no matter what time you arrived. The staff was friendly and never impacted your ability to get your food (they would move out of the way if they were stocking an item so you could get something). The cold choices were the same each day but the hot items changed daily. We requested a high room and extra foam pillows prior to check in, each request was accommodated. The pool is a nice size for the number of rooms. The location is great, easy to drive to Disney with the ability to avoid the congestion. The hotel was clean and well kept. The other guests were pleasant and respectful. I can not come up with a negative about this hotel, and would recommend it to anyone traveling in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MON1967
Reviews.Content: My two young sons and I stayed in a family suite for 3 nights which consisted of 2 twin beds in an area with a jungle theme (not a totally separate room), a living room with a sofa bed and TV, and another bedding area with a king bed and TV (the room also had a kitchen with fridge, oven, microwave, sink, etc.). It was very open which was nice, but the two televisions were back to back and every time I turned the channel in the bedroom, the TV in the living room would change, etc. I found this to be very annoying, but cannot fault the hotel because I never complained about it so they never had the opportunity to fix the problem. The only other complaint I have is about a deodorizer which seemed to be coming from the kitchen sink. It smelled like really bad old lady perfume. Overall the hotel is very nice. We found it to be clean and the staff friendly and accommodating. One day housekeeping forgot to leave us washcloths so I called the front desk and they were delivered immediately. I found the location of the hotel to be wonderful. It seems to be in the middle of everything yet tucked away in a quiet area. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Practical place, good value!”
Reviews.Author: t_hajwane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the residence inn for a couple of nights in may... we had a 2 bed suite and the room was clean, nicely laid out with good ammenties... took us a while to find the hotel as its tucked away at the back but if you have a car then its not a problem. It'd be nice if the hotel had a balcony but seemed only a few in the area did. For the price we paid for the hotel, significantly cheaper then most in that area i think it was a great deal.. contrary to some reviews i wouldn't go as far as saying its the best hotel in the area.. but if you want a nice hotel to stay in without breaking the bank.. its a superb bet! I wasn't impressed with the breakfast, did the job, but i think the options were far a few.. but that could be because of the sheer number of people they have to cater for? The hotel was close to the outlets which is convenient and was a very short drive away from the downtown disney.. would defnitely stay again and would definitely reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: hfkmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights (July 10-14, 2008), and enjoyed it. Plusses included the complimentary breakfast buffet, the pool area, and the complimentary beer/wine cookout on Thursday night. We did not take advantage of the shuttle service to the theme parks, so cannot comment on that. The proximity to Disney was great, and although there weren't any restaurants within easy walking distance, there were plenty to choose from just a few minutes' drive away. Overall, we were pleased with this place. For the price, I cannot lodge any significant complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsToo
Reviews.Content: Travelers should beware! Our recent stay at this hotel was a nightmare! First, we did not receive the type of room that we had orginally reserved. We counldn't even get foam pillows, which we had also requested in advance. The hotel wreaked of foul air fresheners applied in attempts to mask over otherwise musky odors in the rooms and corridors. The staff, especially managemen was rude and less than helpful when we advised them that we weren't able to sleep through the night because all of the noise outside our room. Also, expect to pay additional charges tacked onto your bill after you check out; management at this hotel has no problem making unauthorized charges to your credit card after you leave.

Reviews.Title: “best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tinamina7
Reviews.Content: My family held a reunion here and it was so accommodating. The whole staff was friendly. I stayed in a 2 br spacious suite, with 2 beds in one and a bed and desk in another. Everything was so neatly arranged and there were no surprise charges like $5 bottles of water. The breakfast was the best that i've seen thus far. It leaves you looking forward to the next morning. The service to disney world was nice; not complicated. Nice location. I could go on for hours. You will never regret staying here. It is well worth it. I'm already planning for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Around!”
Reviews.Author: wdwfuntime
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at this wonderful hotel! I would recommend this great hotel to anyone. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite and it was fabulous. We took our 3 year old son to Walt Disney World and having the extra bedroom for him was one of the best decisions we made in choosing the hotel. He had two queen size beds all to himself! The staff was very friendly and helpful and best of all the hotel offered a FREE HOT BREAKFAST each morning - a great value when you are vacationing at Walt Disney World!!!!! The hotel room was clean and neat - it was nice to have a kitchen in our room too (even though we did no cooking!). We filled the refrigerator with tons of drinks and snacks to take to the theme parks each day. The best part of this hotel is the location. The hotel is off the main streets and intersections so that it is VERY quiet but is about a 15 minute drive to the theme parks. We were able to bring our 3 year old back to the hotel on the days we needed to take a nap (we rented a car). The hotel was very close to grocery stores, restaurants, pharmacies - just a great location. My husband and I feel this hotel was one of the best parts of our Walt Disney World vacation and I will definitely stay here again! You can't go wrong by choosing this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel deal in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: travelmaui
Reviews.Content: After reading the most of the reviews here on Trip Advisor, I had mixed feelings about booking here because there were several negative reviews. Decided to take a chance because of what this hotel offered for the money. Don't believe the negative reviews. If there were any problems in the past, they must have been resolved because we experienced none of what the previous complaints pointed out (except for the slow elevators;not that big a deal). And no matter whether you stay at a 5 star hotel or a 1 star hotel, if you come with an attitude, you'll probably get attitude back. The room: My wife and I were vacationing with our college age kids, so the two bedroom suite was just perfect for our needs and comfort. A full kitchen and even a dishwasher. Nice living area with a sofa and desk/table and TV. Free internet (ethernet cable) And each bedroom had it's own full bath and TV; the kids room had two queen beds, ours had a king. Try to beat that at any other hotel for what this hotel charges. The grounds: The hotel was very clean and well kept , with nice landscaping throughout. Easy free parking. The breakfast: The complimentary full breakfast buffet was great and saved us a lot of money. There was also complimentary coffee,tea, and juice available at all hours in the breakfast room. Nice touch! The staff: The entire staff was very friendly, from the front desk, housekeepers, and groundskeepers; everyone seemed to genuinely care that our experience at their hotel was perfect. Check in went very smoothly and Marc at the front desk made the extra effort to give us a very convenient room. The hotel ambassador, Michael, was very helpful with any questions we had about getting to and from places we were interested in visiting and about places to eat. He made sure that our stay was very comfortable and pleasant. I even had the head maintenance engineer stop to chat with me, just to make sure that all was satisfactory with our room, that everything was working as it should, and to invite us to the manager's reception that evening. Housekeepers did a great job cleaning our room and making the beds daily. 5 star service from a hotel rated at 3 stars! The location: Disney Parks, restaurants, and shopping are not within walking distance, so a car makes getting around convenient. There is a free shuttle to the Disney Parks, but you are confined to the shuttle's limited schedule. With a car, you can come and go as you please. Still, the hotel is in a very convenient location of the Lake Buena Vista area. I couldn't have made a better choice in choosing this hotel, and this would definitely be my first choice for our next visit to Orlando/Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando's Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: MoCaribfan
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Residence Inn this past week. What a great place to stay for the price! The rooms have just received new bedding and everything is very clean. Coffee, tea, sweeteners, dish washer detergent, paper towels, stocked in the room. Small market with snacks, soda/water, sundries in the lobby. Game room for the kids. Nice workout room with new equipment. Upon check-in you are given a packet of information about the hotel and what it offers: -complimentary shuttle to Disney theme parks 4x daily (leaving at 8:20 am, 10:40am, and 1:00 pm...returning at 6:00 pm, 8:00 pm and 10:30 pm). They take you to Epcot and then you catch your transportation to the other parks from there. -complimentary internet access located in the lobby...with free printing (used for printing our boarding passes) -phone number of the staff -hot buffet (extensive) 6:30-10:45 -hospitality hour Mon-Thurs 5-6:30 pm: Monday: nacho night Tuesday: cookie night Wednesday: dogs and meatballs Thursday: BBQ of burgers, hotdogs, chili, baked beans, chips and beer and wine...FREE -pool bar -washer/dryers on every floor (small fee) -restaurants/phone numbers in the area This hotel is conveniently located between Disney and SeaWorld. Literally a couple of miles in either direction gets you to the parks. We would definitely return. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The best Residence Inn in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: It`s the second time I stay in Residence Inn LBV and it`s the best Residence Inn in Orlando! It`s very clean,newly refurbished,with an extraordinary complimentary breakfast!The staff is very helpful! We were 4 people in a 2 bedroom suites and we got plenty of room! I strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: horizons92
Reviews.Content: I only stayed there one night but, I could tell that the rooms and the rest of that hotel had been redone since my stay last year. I'm not saying that the hotel looked bad before, but it looks great now. The only real problem I could find was that the lamp on the nightstand was far too big for it (it hangs off the edge). The breakfast tasted great and was really hardy.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: adventuresgalore
Reviews.Content: We stay at this Residence Inn most times we come to Orlando. It is near everything you are looking for in Lake Buena Vista, close to Disney and other theme parks. The hotel has a nice layout with a good pool. My family enjoys having a little more room to spread out in vs. the very small, very expensive on property Disney hotels. We have stayed at them all and keep coming back to the Residence in on Marbella. The two bedroom, two bath suites are nice with a full size kitchen. The breakfast in the morning is fantastic and would easily cost thirty dollars for a family of four at a sit down restaurant. We have stayed here at least five times over the last three years and are always pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: LdyLara
Reviews.Content: we stayed here while visiting the seaworld... fabulous hotel! the delicious breakfast each morning is a wonderful addition to an already great price on the room. (go early and be prepared to wait in line for the mickey waffle makers) very large king room with a REALLY comfortable bed. very clean all the way around! we stayed two nights and tried to add more but they were booked solid. would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than a Mouse Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Opus345
Reviews.Content: Very peaceful stay. Somewhat off the beaten path, but there was food and drinking establishments within a mile. Fantastic breakfast and hot dishes were changed on a daily basis. Nice pool and hot tub. Room was very clean. Staff was polite and professional. I had no issues that required any special efforts. My only issue was with the Internet access. No wireless, and only a two foot RJ-45 cable with the only connection being next to the table in the kitchen. Now I don't know about you, but I like to surf on the bed in the evenings. I ended up using part of my per diem to buy a 25 foot cable from Office Depot. I was in Orlando for a Computer Security conference that was held at the Disney Dolphin hotel. The Dolphin's conference facility is top notch, but the rooms need to be renovated. Dolphin was at least $50 more than the Residence Inn and it did not include that fantastic breakfast. Did I already tell you about the Residence Inn breakfast? Mmmmm. Opus

Reviews.Title: “Would've been excellent but....”
Reviews.Author: disabledfamily5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn because we had enough Marriott reward points to stay there for a week free, I read the reviews and decided that this sounded like a good place to stay. Plus, because we are a family with a disability, we like to stay in places that have two bedrooms for many different reasons. We consisted of myself, my husband, who is in a wheelchair, daughter age 14 and son age 8, and in a separate room my sister and brother in law. I would've given this place a 5 star/excellent rating but we had some issues with the room we ended up with. We booked a two bedroom assessible room with my sister in law who owns a travel agency and because we have the handicapped accessibility issues, she always double checks our reservations because we have had problems in the past trying to get a room that is both handicapped accessible and is big enough for a family. This time, she called the hotel directily three times to make sure we had a two bedroom handicapped accessible room and all three times they said that is what we had for a reservation. . But, the room we ended up with when we got there was a one bedroom, one bathroom, accessible room with a pullout couch. My sister and brother in law came to check on us and couldn't believe that they had a two bedroom, two bathroom that they could get lost in and we had no place to put our luggage and a wheelchair. So, I ended up calling and going to the front desk to try to change our room to the original reservation of the 2 bedroom/handicapped accessible room. The lady at the front dest was really nice, but I still don't know if they actually had a 2 bedroom handicapped suite in the first place or if she was saying that it wasn't available for the whole week or what was going on, I did find out that they were booked full for the week, so it was hard to change anything. In the meantime, my sister and brother said that if we could get them a regular one bedroom (regular because a handicapped accessible bathroom doesn't have a tub) they would switch rooms with us because they felt bad that we were in such a small room for 4 of us and they had the 2 bedroom that they didn't need. I then went to the front desk and told the lady the situation and she did switch us to my sisters/brother in laws room (which was not handicapped accessible and a pain for my husband, but we are used to this because it happens all of the time to us, so we make due) and they switched my sister and her husband to a one bedroom with a view of the roof (I felt really bad about this but they were fine with it) and I did end up getting the hotel to knock $20.00 per night off their room. We did end up liking the room, two kings, a pullout couch, two bathrooms, kitchen area, for the price it was great/excellent. But, my poor husband is a trooper dealing with the lack of the handicapped accessible bathroom . Luckily I have some kind of muscle to help him out! The pool area was really nice, the breakfast was awesome, my 8 year old son was addicted to the Mickey Mouse Waffles. You do need a car rental to get everywhere. There were a lot of restaurants, etc, close by. Would stay here again if there is an actual 2 bedroom handicapped accessible room. I think hotels need to realize that there are actually handicapped families that travel together that need more bedrooms. In the past, we had one more child with us, but he happens to be in college and didn't go with us this time. In the past, we have stayed at Boardwalk Villas and Old Key West Resort in Disney that had wonderful 2 bedroom, handicapped accessible rooms, plus handicapped accessible transportation to all of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “So close to Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Bmwdsny
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel!! We stayed three nights recently on Marriott Rewards in a 1 Bedroom Suite. Room was clean and we had a nice view of the courtyard where the pool located. We were easy 1 mile from Walt Disney World which was very convenient. Breakfast was outstanding and had a variety of choices each morning, plenty of seating area even when it was crowded.. Staff was very accomodating and friendly. Would stay here again in future without hesitant.

Reviews.Title: “A great Orlando property”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for a family on vacation around the area. Service was outstanding. The staff at the front desk outdid themselves trying to make our stay as comfortable as possible. They even let us see three different rooms to choose from when checking in. Breakfast was good and very convenient, laundry, internet and park assistance are all inside the property. Our room had a separate area for the kids and we thought that was a great idea. Would change the animal print decor for that room but the space was well received. Our child had a blast. This is going to be our future home base for Orlando if they keep this up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Orlando vacations”
Reviews.Author: jill401
Reviews.Content: After considering several hotels in the Orlando/WDW area, I booked a two-bedroom suite for our weekend stay. Living only a couple of hours away, we spend 5-6 weekends a year in Orlando and have stayed at several Orlando properties, including Disney hotels. I love staying at Disney hotels for the "Disney experience" but their suites are out of our usual budget. Therefore, this hotel ranks tops on my list for a suite. Check-in went smoothly. Despite not arriving until after 8 pm, the staff graciously accommodated my request when I asked for a pool-view room. It is close to I-4 and I was concerned about traffic noise; although the interior seems well sound-proofed, if you are a very light sleeper you might want to ask for a room facing away from the interstate. The staff at all hours was unfailingly polite, helpful and efficient. Our housekeeper even arranged all of our child's stuffed animals in playful poses and left us a very nice note. The room was spotlessly clean and seems to have been redecorated or renovated within the last few years. The small kitchen had full-size appliances including a refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher and coffee maker. It was fully stocked with pots, pans, dishes, glasses, utensils, etc. The kitchen table was small but adequate for four people. The beds were soft but not too soft, with soft sheets and plenty of pillows. Both bedrooms (one with a king, one with 2 queens) had full bathrooms. The living room area had a chaise lounge instead of a full couch, which I found odd, and a club chair. There were 25" televisions in the living room and in each bedroom. Contrary to previous reviews, there was free wireless internet access in the room, not just wired. There was a free wired access port located at the kitchen table as well. The complimentary breakfast buffet always featured scrambled eggs, two different meats (bacon, sausage patties or links, corned beef hash, etc), grits and some sort of bread (such as biscuits or pancakes). There was also a make-your-own waffle station, bread and bagels for toasting, a breakfast taco station, and plain oatmeal with brown sugar, cinnamon, raisins and nuts to add in if you wished. The cold bar offered granola, several varieties of cereal, strawberry and plain yogurt, fruit salad and bananas. For beverages, coffee, hot tea, orange juice, apple juice and milk. The food was as good as some Denny's breakfasts I've paid for, and there was plenty of staff on hand restocking with fresh food and clean plates, and clearing tables. Self-parking was free, and we did not have a problem finding a parking space. We noticed cars parked out front on the street every morning, but I think that was because they did not wish to drive around back where there were plenty of available spaces. The hotel had an exercise room but we did not use it. The pool somewhat small and plain for families used to slides and fountains at Disney "theme" pools. However, it was clean, never crowded and plenty of pool towels were on hand. Given that we stayed during prime spring break week, I really expected that the breakfast buffet, pools, parking lots, etc, would be crowded but did not find that to be the case. Given that a our rate of $189 a night included free breakfast, free internet access, free parking, two separate bedrooms and a full kitchen, I'd say it was a bargain. I will definitely recommend it to friends and family, and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kodie123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for March Break week. Overall, a very nice hotel. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bath suite. Very spacious with two separate bedrooms (king bed in one and two queens in the other), comfortable livingroom with sofabed and fully equipped kitchen. Good floor plan - central kitchen/dining/livingroom area with king bedroom/bath on one side and the queen bedroom/bath on the other side of suite. Nicely decorated and very clean. A few minor issues, but still highly recommend this hotel. Buffet breakfast is included, but hot items at buffet do not vary much. We found ourselves bypassing the buffet by mid-week and eating elsewhere. Coffee isn't very good either. Hotel is a little further away from restaurants and stores, so a car is recommended. Parking is free, but there are not enough parking spaces for the number of rooms at hotel. Cars were parked all along entrance at front of hotel. Staff at hotel very attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A good value but”
Reviews.Author: Sauce75
Reviews.Content: Overall my husband and I were pleased with our stay. The room was large, clean and comfortable, but could probably use a bit of updating and TLC, e.g., the drapes were coming off the windows, the refrigerator was a bit beat up and tended to freeze things. The free breakfast was an excellent value -- plenty of selection and the staff does a good job of keeping things replenished, clearing the tables quickly, an all around good job. There is construction going on in the area immediately surrounding the hotel. Noise was not a problem, but it did detract from its appearance, especially as you drive in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, need restaurants within closer walking distance”
Reviews.Author: NoVAFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RI LBV while attending a conference. The hotel is very nice and looks to be recently remodeled. I had a ground floor 2 BR, 2BA suite. Lots of room, very quite, and free high speed internet. The exercise room was a nice size with treadmills, bicycles, elipticals, and free weights.
