One of the highlights of the place is the nice hot breakfast each morning, which is included in the price. They served bacon, eggs, sausage, oatmeal, waffles, bagels, fruit, cereal, muffins, yogurt, milk, juice, coffee, tea, and a few other things. What I didn't appreciate was that unless you rented a car, you were forced to wait for a random cab or use the very expensive shuttle. Even a trip of less than 1 mile cost $8. I was forced into this option one night b/c of a torrential thunderstorm. The closest restaurants are still about 1 mile away and walking during the storm was not an option. Also, while I did appreciate the free high speed internet service, there was only one port in the suite and it was at the kitchen table, not even at the desk. Wireless or more ports would have been a nice feature. Overall the experience was very nice. If you stay here, make sure you have a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Southamerican
Reviews.Content: We are fairly frequent international leisure travellers and just came back from a three-night stay at this hotel; we were very positively impressed by the overall condition of the hotel (it was recently renovated, everything looks pretty new and very clean!), staff was very kind (check-in very smooth, they even call us right after check-in to make sure everything was good with our room) and the location was close to most amenities, restaurants and shopping. The only thing we did not enjoy was the breakfast buffet, no fresh fruit (only canned fruit), several greasy items and limited variety of bread and pastries. After our first attempt, we opted to buy breakfast on our own. Our average rate ranged around US$160 per night, which overall results in a great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Added enjoyment to our Holiday Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bobbynick
Reviews.Content: We went to Florida for a Holiday get away. The Marriott offered us a suite the was beyond my expectation. My wife and two sons had seperate room with 3 seperate TV's to accomidate everyone. Every morning we went to the resteraunt for a free buffet breakfast. Not ony was it free but we were welcomed by a gracius group of staff that I have remembered to this day. Standing out in my mind were Amanda and Scott. I can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “3 Star, You're Kidding.”
Reviews.Author: Millet-Fanger
Reviews.Content: This is the newest, well maintained and best resourced 3 star hotel I have stayed at. We stayed for 4 days in early January at $99 a night for a studio suite but were up-graded to a 1 bedroom suite (slightly larger but still with a seperate bedroom). Front desk staff were excellent at all times. Fast check-in and out, provided any information requested and made phone calls on our behalf after enquiries. Rooms were well maintained, beds were good but a little soft, full kitchen, fast free internet and not noisy. The hotel had 3 free shuttle buses running to Disney each day. It's on it's own but about 10 - 15 minutes walk gets you to a good variety of shops and restaurants. The shuttle buses will drop you at the restaurants on your way home after a day at the parks. Breakfast, which is included, was good. There was a large variety, fresh; enough to keep the whole family happy. Mickey waffles were a favourite. We used a rent-a-car, Advantage, to and from the airport. A local hotel has a desk and provides pick up and drop off service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for larger family”
Reviews.Author: Surgie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-bedroom unit from Jan. 1-6. We had five adults in our group so it was great to have more space than a traditional hotel room and 2 bathrooms as well. The price on the hotel website was $159 per night with AAA discount. The included buffet breakfast was good and varied daily. It opened officially at 7:00 am but actually was open between 6:30 and 6:45 - great for early birds! I had considered staying on-site at Disney but could not justify the cost when the Residence Inn was such a good value. It was a quick 10-15 minute drive from the hotel parking lot to the theme park parking lot. There are laundry rooms in the hotel which also came in unexpectedly handy. The front desk staff was very helpful and directed us to a nearby sports bar so we could watch the Rose Bowl on the day we arrived. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and comfy”
Reviews.Author: ElaineT1
Reviews.Content: Hotel just off the main drag so quiet, but a 2 min. drive to restaurants and shops etc. Easy access to freeway to Disney etc. Some road noise from freeway, but not much. Rooms spacious, comfortable bedding, good kitchen. (although only had 1 cup, and kept asking for 2 more - never got them) Coffee & popcorn provided although coffee was terrible. Not much space to put clothes (3 people in our room) The soaps and shampoo's and tissues very cheap and nasty. Breakfast was excellent. Pool and hot tubs very nice. Free papers, internet and shuttle to park and free snacks most evenings. Game room, concierge, small shop. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would stay again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MomTX99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residence Inn with two young children starting on Nov 10. The staff is friendly and professional. Check-in was prompt, and took less than 5 minutes. The hotel's rooms have been extensively renovated, though the hallways are still a little dated. The room itself is updated and modern. There is fresh paint, carpet, etc. There is much attention to detail, ant the staff takes pride in their work. We, loved it! Everything was CLEAN and spotless. The bed was comfy as well. The shower has nice water pressure. The rooms offer complimentary high-speed internet, and we used it to check park hours, etc. Breakfast was SO convenient and well prepared. There is something for everyone: eggs, breakfast meats, pancakes and/or Mickey waffles, cereal, bagels, yogurt, granola, grits...fresh fruit salad, fresh fruits, the list goes on and on. The hotel is within a short driving distance of Disney. It is in close proximity to I-4, but we prefer to take the scenic route! There are many eateries nearby. I highly recommend this hotel, we are already planning our next getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: ohmygaww
Reviews.Content: We loved the newly remodeled Residence Inn! Everything is all updated to a very modern look, nice colors and most of all very comfortable beds and clean. The pool is a nice area, there is a kiddy pool as well and also a hot tub, open until 10pm. Nice to come back to after a long day at the Theme Parks. A complimentary breakfast is served in the dining room, the coffee is yummy. The staff is very helpful and make you feel right at home. Theme parks and restaurants are close by~ we will definately stay at the Marriott Residence Inn on our next Orlando trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional comfort, value, and fun!”
Reviews.Author: JAMiddleburghNY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Residence Inn on Marbella Palm in Lake Buena Vista. While I've stayed at Luxury hotels before, this was the best overall experience my family and I have ever had at a hotel. The comfort, value and facility quality made it so. First the room was great. A kitchenette with plates, pots, etc was wonderful, expecially since a dishwasher was included. The 1 bedroom suite had 2 full bathrooms, 2 TVs and was lovely. Beds were king sized and work space for someone in on business would be great. My 13 year old son enjoyed the game room and the very large pool. Pool area--with large hot tub-- was well maintained and easy to get to from the lobby. Continental breakast included 5 separate buffets: bacon, egg, etc: muffins and make your own waffles; cereals; yogurt and fruit; and beverages. Parking is free. Access to Disney is easy, although we didn't try the shuttle. Grocery stores, pharmacies and gift shops were all handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jaakvik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Residence Inn at Lake Buena Vista in April 2005, and we loved the place. It might not be the best hotel we ever stayed at, but it was perfect for our needs in Orlando; big room, good beds, clean, well equiped kitchenette, great location, nice pool-area. Basically the perfect hotel for a weeks stay in Orlando. The staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hosnest Review!!!”
Reviews.Author: xodadasupreme
Reviews.Content: Speaking Very Honestly.... I give this hotel rating a 4.5 out of 5. The rooms were very clean and the beds were extra comfortable. I repeat... EXTRA COMFORTABLE!!! I fell asleep way to easy on that bed. The bathroom was clean, average size and the shower head had good water pressure. All the rooms are equipped with nice full kitchens (w/ microwave and coffee maker) and living rooms. They even give you complimentary popcorn, tea, coffee! I was very impressed with cable tv because we had EVERY cable station (about 50 or 60 cable channels). It was great having the option of ESPN for me and HGTV for my girlfriend. The rooms also have VCR's and if you want they have a video rental machine in the lobby! The free breakfast was good. They switched up the menu everyday and they had a nice variety of food. They also offer free food @ night during the weekdays (like hot dogs, pizza, etc). The hotel also has a video arcade that has air table hockey and about 5 arcade game systems. The fitness center is average size and clean. The service @ the hotel was beyond excellent. EVERYONE was very helpful and went out of their way to accomadate our needs. The only reason i'm not giving the hotel a full 5 star rating is because of it's location. Let me explain.... the hotel is located on a long road where there is nothing but hotels, restaraunts and shops. The only thing wrong is it's located @ the very of the street. Even thought it was ony about a mile away from the Disney property, i just felt like it was selcluded from everything else. Everyone i talked to seemed to enjoy that aspect. The street has a variety of stores different eating places, even a Hooters (hidden in the back of an outdoor mall). Oh yea.. and the area super safe!!! I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a great price”
Reviews.Author: CECRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two days while in Orlando, and then one night on the way back home after visiting Key Largo. What a bargain! The hotel itself is clean with a friendly staff. Rooms are large with a full kitchen, nice bathroom, and very comfortable beds. The free breakfast was much more than we anticipated with eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, waffles, pastries, toast, yogurt, and much more. This hotel is a great value and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: topsail123
Reviews.Content: Everything it should be - close to Downtown Disney - easy commute to parks and attrations - nice pool area -

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sassy2427
Reviews.Content: We stay the Residence inn From July 27 -Aug 6/07 on our honeymoon and loved it. When we arrived check in was quick and fast, they had our disneypass waiting and ready to go. Our room/Suite was facing the pool and was very spacious. It had a full operating kitchen with a fridge that made ice, dishwasher, two burner stove,microwave and lots of dishes etc... They even had popcorn for the microwave..I thought it was a nice touch. The living area had a large sectional couch that pulled out into a bed, also a desk and TV/VCR. The bedroom had a large comfortable, fluffly king size bed with lots of pillows and the bathroom had a separate sink area from the tub/shower and toliet. The complimentary breakfast was a great delight. They served from 7:30 til 10:30, the selections was great, mickey mouse waffles, eggs, sausage, pancakes or french toast, cerals, fresh fruit, assortment of breads,donuts,corn beef hash, etc.... It was always changing. Also during the week they feature different evenings offerring cookie night, hotdog night, taco night etc... Its located close to sea world, lots of dining, shopping and of course the parks (disney). We would definitly stay there again, the service was great, grounds immacculate, pool nice...everthing we could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Pearl00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista for 9 nights. We reserved a 2 bedroom room for our family- husband, wife and 2 teens. The two private bedrooms each have adjoining bathrooms and are separated by the family room and kitchen. Upon arrival, we were assigned our room on the 4th floor. A beautiful, spacious room- 2 queen beds for the teens and a king bed for the parents- unfortunately it was on the backside of the building, next to the freeway. Even after a very long day of jetting across the USA, we weren't so tired as to not hear the freeway traffic at 3:00 in the morning. We were anxious to visit the Magic Kingdom the next day and start our vacation. My husband talked to the staff at the front desk and they told him for us to pack our luggage and they would move us to a different room while we went to Disney World. We were thrilled to return to a pool side room on the first floor- same 2 bedroom size room. The staff even saw my note on the frig in the first room, that we had put food/drinks inside- that all got moved to our new room. I really enjoy having a kitchen when we travel. The Residence Inn rooms have a full size frig, 4 burner stove and oven, dishwasher, etc. I recommend the Publix grocery stores in town, don't go to the nearest little tourist trappy ones, the prices are outrageous as we found out our first night there. We bought stuffed salmon at Publix, baked it in our oven, microwaved potatoes, had green salad and bread as dinner for a couple of nights. We bought flats of bottled water as water away from home always tastes funky. I'd partially freeze them for our treks to the Disney Parks. A great tip I read from some genius traveler is to take a zip lock baggie of Tang or Crystal Light with you into the Parks and fill your water bottle as needed throughout the day. We did that several times- my big kids really appreciated it, and I didn't have to reach for my wallet. The comp breakfast at Residence really is impressive- you can really tank up before a full day of walking and rides. Housekeeping did a wonderful job cleaning our room, fluffing our luxurious beds and replenishing supplies. There is coin operated laundry available ($1.50 a load, uses quarters). My kids used the pool late in the evenings- proved to be a good teen hangout. We had a wonderful vacation and can highly recommend this Marriott Residence Inn (be sure to request a pool side room.)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nevus67
Reviews.Content: We stayed there June 17th-22nd 2007 and really loved the place. It was very clean, we got to the hotel early and had no problem getting our room, front desk check in was barely 5 minutes with very friendly, helpful staff. They have directions to all the local attractions/malls/restaurants, etc which came in very handy since we didnt know where anything was. The pizza hut onsite was great in the evenings and they also have a grill where you can order sandwiches and dinners. The bar was also nice. Checked out the fitness room and used some of the equipment everything was very clean. Abundance of towels at the pool, I dont think the tent that held the towels was ever even close to being empty. mY 10 year old daughter loved the pool (it wasnt huge) but didnt get deeper than 5 ft but again, the grounds were spotless, pool was spotless. Hot tub was a nice place to relax in after walking all day at the theme parks. Breakfast was great alot of food from scrambled eggs, waffles, danishes, cereal, biscuits/gravy, fruit, granola, juices, bagels, toast. Not to far from disney/mgm/epcot. Overall, I really felt comfortable and safe at the hotel, the rooms were very clean. We had a one bedroom suite the only thing i noticed is that the bathroom could have had a divivder or door from the bedroom to cut down on the noise if someone was still sleeping in the bedroom, other than that great. Would defnitely stay again and recommend. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff!!”
Reviews.Author: THMm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two weeks from late May to early June. My son had his 6th birthday when we were on vacation and the staff put together a gift bag full of small toys and decorated with balloons for him, a card signed by everyone on site that day and 6 cupcakes for us to enjoy! I cannot tell you how touched and appreciative we were. The rooms were alway spotless with our children's toys placed in cute areas of the room (like in the window overlooking the pool) when the rooms were cleaned. Great pool area with very friendly bartenders at the poolside bar. The breakfast buffet was the best of any Residence Inn we had ever stayed at previously. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: djsmomDallas_GA
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Residence Inn from June 6th thru June 10th. The hotel is very nice. As we drove into the hotel parking lot, it was very welcoming. The landscape with the Palm Trees almost made you feel as if you were going to the beach. We arrived at 1:30 pm. I informed my husband to see if we could check in early. We did!!!. We stayed on the 5th floor in a family fun suite, overlooking the pool. The room was very clean, and my kids, ages 5 and 8, loved their sleeping area. The room included 3 televisions. One in the kids sleeping area, living room area, and the bedroom area. I described the room space as areas, because there are no doors that separate the rooms. I do believe you can get a Family Fun Suite with separate rooms with doors, but I don't believe you will have a view of the pool. The breakfast was great; again my kids loved the Mickey Mouse Waffles. Every morning there is a variety of different things on the breakfast bar. The staff also greeted you every morning at the dining area door. We were supposed to go to two theme parks at Disney during our stay, but changed our minds. Our kids loved the swimming pool so much; that they didn't even noticed that we didn't make it to the second theme park. Because of this we decided to stay at the hotel an extra day. This saved us a lot! Also try to call the hotel directly to book a room. We were able to use the government rate and saved almost $100.00. We will definitely be staying at the Marriott Residence Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: rteezgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite (room 337). The room was a corner room with 2 windows. It was spacious and spotless. It overlooked the pool so it was nice and quiet. The masterbed was to die for. So soft and comfy. The kitchen was nicely equipped with everything you need to cook a meal for your family. The couch was comfortable too. The kids room had 2 twin beds and a really nice desk space. My son spent time putting together his lego set he bought at Downtown Disney at the desk. The pool is heated to 82 degrees and is clean!!! This hotel is located close to Disney and Seaworld. We had a rental car and it was really easy to get around. It is located on a side street that is not busy at all. But drive a mile and your surrounded my shopping and restaurant choices. The cleaning people took the time to make our stay extra special. My Son's stuffed monkey took on some dramatic poses through out the week. We even got some nice towel arrangements too. The room and the hotel was really clean and smelled fresh. The breakfast area was a true bargin. Lots of great food and the staff kept everything fresh. The complimentary concierge was a huge help. She milled about during breakfast handing out stickers to the kids. There was also a timeshare agent who gave us her business card and asked us to stop by her desk when we got a chance. We stayed a whole week at this hotel and that is the only time she had approached us. They are very hands off which is nice. We never did stop by either. Maybe we should have! I needed directions to the superwalmart. I asked at the front desk and was promptly handed a type page with great directions. I suggest checking in, getting directions to the superwalmart and getting your groceries there. They also have a TON of Disney merchandise at this walmart at great prices. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone!!! We had a fantastic experience and I doubt we will stay anywhere else now. It really was that good.

Reviews.Title: “Well above average experience”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending a week-end at this Residence Inn. We had a one bedroom unit. The unit was spacious and reflected lovely furnishings. The curved sofa was a clever utilization of space, but became quite inconvenient when attempting to make-up the sofa bed. (I just do not understand why I always have to make this bed. Why doesn't housekeeping make the sofa bed just like they make other beds? The rooms were immaculate. The king sized bed was total heavan. No one wanted to get up in the morning because the bed, coupled with luxurious linen was exceptionally comfortable. It was somewhat strange to find a property with such an emphasis on luxury offer strange branded amenities, but since I always carry my own, it was not a problem or me. Check-in was quick and professional. The lights and the TV had been turned on when we arrived at our room. That was a gracious touch we have not experienced before. As other reviewers have noted the elevators are really slow. It is hard to understand as they seem well maintained and there was not much traffic on them, but it took forever for them to move from one floor to the next. If the hotel were full this problem could quickly become truly obnoxious. Breakfast was pretty standard. We enjoyed the do-it-yourself waffles. The eggs were not bad. Orange juice did not seem too sweet to me, and the coffee was not horrid either. Food prepared is mass quantities and kept warm in chafing dishes is never as good as cooked-to-order meals, but this breakfast had several choices, was well-supplied, attractively presented and a big time saver for people who do not want to waste an hour or more at IHOP. We booked this hotel at a special eMarriott rate we received over the internet. At $111/night it was a great value. If I had to pay the rack rate of $189 I might look at something else. Overall our stay at this property was pleasant and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel a couple of months ago with my wife and two kids. The hotel is conveniently located off to the highway, a few minutes away from restaurants and theme parks. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. I didn't have a chance to use the pool facilities since we spent most of the time at the parks but found the breakfast area to be very complete. A hearty breakfast saved us a lot of money once we got to the parks. The staff at this hotel was very friendly and accomodating. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: fromindiananewalbany
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this Residence Inn. It is a VERY close drive to Downtown Disney and even the Disney parks. The hotel was very clean...our room was very spacious and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable with Marriott's new, improved bedding and sheets. The complimentary breakfast buffet was adequate; lots of food, average quality, crowded, but free and it was great to have breakfast available at the hotel! The pool was very nice, with waterfalls and palm trees surrounding. The price was great...we will definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Mariott standard”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. This standard issue Residence Inn is fairly new and in good condition. Located next to I-4, rooms facing the interstate may be noisy. Finding the correct road to the hotel is a bit of a challenge. Our suite faced the interior and was very quiet. Check in was quick and pleasant. Room was in good order and bedding comfortable. Bathrooms not well illuminated but in good working order. Excellent breakfast buffet. Note: Hotel is located a bit remotely on an otherwise heavy tourist route, thus you cannot walk to anything from here. Overall an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: milkyway4679
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed here, and we really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were clean, and well kept. The staff was always polite, and very helpful. The morning breakfast buffet was great, especially because of the long hours, and the tasty food. (The buffet is included in the price of the rooms.) The mickey mouse waffle makers were great for the kids. The pool was beautiful, with the large area surrounding it being well-kept and clean also. There was a small bar off to the side, which was nice. I only really had two small complaints, and that was the elevators...they were very very very slow. And also, our room happened to be on the thruway side. The room overlooked a parking lot and green space, but the thruway was next to the hotel, so it could be a little noisy at times. Not really big issues though, as you are located so close to Disney, that you are unlikely to be spending much time at the hotel anyways, and the rooms that the other group members were in were fine. Did not use the shuttle system, so I cannot comment on it. Overall though, this was a wonderful hotel, and I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to people!

Reviews.Title: “Picky Traveler Really likes this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryncee
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews from many- We stayed oe night March 11 and had a suite for two couples and a child. The hotel appears new, and was spottless and well maintained throughout. The check in staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The suite was spotlessly clean, and very well kept. Bedrooms of good size, as were bathrooms, with vanity seperate from the tubs. Very basic- nice tolietries. The beds were comfortable, and we slept well. There was more than enough room for all of our family. The pool area was very nice- pool large and clean. They have a small outdoor bar which was nice as well. Plenty of tables and chairs throughout the pool area. I was impressed with how well kept and clean it was. Breakfast was good- coffee pretty bad... They offered a lot, and it was hot and of good quality. There is plenty of seating available there as well. The hotel is very close to the outlet malls, and has several restaurants in the area. Getting to Universal as very easy, and you do not have to get back on I-4. The only compliant I would have, and it's minimal, is the parking. There is no charge for it, and no valet, but not as many spaces as is likely needed. We returned to the hotel at about 11:30 pm from dinner and there was no place to park, we had to park along the sidewalk where other cars were parked as well. I will return to this hotel again. It was of good value. Mostly, it was clean, neat and well-kept- three things which are very important to me.

Reviews.Title: “they didn't have our room we reserved”
Reviews.Author: chubbycheckers06264
Reviews.Content: We made reservations more than a week in advance for a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite. Told them we would not be arriving until 11:30 p.m. We arrived eariler and they said there was a problem with the maintenance of the room and would send us to a different hotel (they would pick up the tab) . Well that was fine, but the hotel they sent us to wasn't fine. We were really disappointed and wondered why they couldn't just give us 2 regular rooms and let us stay at the residence inn, it would have been cheaper for them as they still would have charged us the same price as the suite, but they didn't charge us at all and had to pick up the tab for the crappy Palomino Suites they sent us to. When we got there the desk clerk who had an "ATTITUDE" said they only had 2 bedroom suites with 1 bath and sent us to room #249 when we opened the door, there were people in there sleeping on the sofa bed. We all ( the 6 of us) rolled all our luggage back down to the lobby and the desk clerk's response was "I gave you a key for 249 that must be a computer glitch. Well he wrote #249 on our key card, he then was even more rude . When I told him that the Residence inn said we would get the same type of room that we booked with them, he again insisted threy didn't have any 2 bedroom, 2 baths suites in the hotel. But when I asked to call the residence inn, he suddenly found us room 450 that had 2 bedroom, 2 baths. The room was only fair, the beds were like sleeping on the floor, the sheets seemed like they were worn and needed to be replaced. The sofa bed and recliner looked old. The breakfast was only ok, bagels, toast, muffins, cereal and fresh fruit no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: TCMexico
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights 1/11 - 1/15 and it was perfect for us. I checked in early (noon) since I was at a convention nearby. After reading past reviews, I asked about the I4 noice so they let me look at the room (3rd floor facing i4). Noise was high so they gave me a 5th floor facing the pool. Perfect choice. Never heard anything outside and no kids running the hallways above us. It was a 2 bedroom with 2 queens/1 king/2 bath. The front desk even called later to make sure everything was OK. They also quickly brought up a crib and extra towels when asked. Food was as expected but always hot and fresh. It probably helped that I was down there eating at 6:30 when they opened. Like most here, I recommend a car. Nothing to walk to but plenty of dinning a couple of miles away. Downtown Disney is also a quick drive. Rooms were clean every day and housekeeping even ran our dishwasher for us and left a nice note. Ask for dish soap packets for this and they will hand out extra. There is a Win Dixie just down the road so do your shopping there. The little market close by is way over priced and limited. We made sandwiches for the parks so thanks to the posts about bringing plastic bags. We also froze water bottles so you don't have to pay the high prices in the parks. While there were many business folks staying there, it really is a family place so be forewarned. Either way, at this price, you can't beat it with 4 adults, 1 child and 1 infant.

Reviews.Title: “Service not the best”
Reviews.Author: 57Lulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days in December while there on business as other hotels were full. This is a family destination. Loud noise from the pool area and jacuzzi from children and families. Breakfast doesn't start until 6:30 so if you have an early meeting, you're not accomodated. Not really located near any restaurants although they offer a "takeout taxi" service from some of the local restaurants. Left my shoes there by mistake and the customer service to return them was poor. After multiple phone calls and a message to the manager - it still wasn't resolved 2 weeks later. Not up to Marriott standards even for a budget hotel. Stayed at other locations and didn't have this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: debmar
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitors(pleasure&business) to the Orlando area, we have stayed in a variety of accommodations. Recently stayed here for 9 nights (11/03/06 to 11/12/06). Had a very enjoyable stay. Nice, CLEAN, comfortable suites. Pool area was very enjoyable, heated pool could have been a little warmer considering air temperatures were a little below normal for early Nov. but very clean and well kept. Poolside bar opened at 4p.m. on most days. Staff was very pleasant and friendly from housekeeping to front desk and seemed genuinely eager to make sure your stay was enjoyable. Complimentary breakfast was GREAT! My niece and nephew were with us for part of the stay and enjoyed making Mickey waffles. Good variety of breakfast choices and was setup until 10:45a.m. Great for the days you want to sleep-in. Overall, while not a Ritz-Carlton, this was a nice hotel in a convenient area, would definitely stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: gpdrn
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here on a recent trip to Disney. I always stay at Marriott properties when in Orlando and this was the first time at this one. Our room was not ready on time and front desk was less than helpful. The room was OK - it appeared clean but had a strange odor. The light for the toilet/shower room was as weak as a candle - it is the darkest shower I have ever been in. I hope that not all the rooms are like this. Also, the noise from I-4 is very loud at night and early morning. Breakfast was good with a wide selection to choose from and the hours are great from 6:30 to 10:45. Apart from the wait at check in, I-4 noise, and the shower light the overall stay was nice, it is close to everything including parks, restaurants, and supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: 80sgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to Disney and wanting a suite-type hotel, opted for the Marriott Residence Inn in Lake Buena Vista. The hotel came recommended as it's close to the parks, has a great pool area, and breakfast buffet included. Breakfast was wonderful, lots to choose from. Our family loved the make your own waffles! As I've read in other reviews, it's true - the coffee was lousy, but a minor glitch in all that they had to offer. The room was nice; however, the vanity/sink area was separate from the bathroom/shower area and right next to the beds; not very conducive if you're one to sleep in and someone's at the sink or using the hair dryer. Other than that, the accomodations were clean, staff courteous and location fine. If you're headed to the Disney parks, you'll need a car. The hotel's shuttle times were very limited and didn't run very often.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, breakfast nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: J-Adum
Reviews.Content: I stayed from Jun.23 – 29 at this Hotel. I am Ecuadorian and chose it because I had a great experience at the Miami Airport Residence Inn and also because there were excellent reviews about it, actually rated # 5 in Orlando Area by Trip Advisor (by the time I reserved). I can’t complain about the room, it was spacious, clean, non-smoking and upper floor, just like I requested. But the breakfast…it was a real nightmare. Too many people and just a few employees trying (not so hard) to keep things in order, so everything was dirty and disgusting. I never had eggs or sausages or French toasts, or anything hot because they were gone immediately after someone placed them in the buffet. Beverages were all bad, juices, coffee, yogurt. After 2 days, my wife and I gave up and decided to have breakfast in our room with our own ingredients. If you are going to stay at this hotel, include breakfast in your budget and have a car, because nothing around is at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly- stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Dogma
Reviews.Content: We did not experience any of the problems that other reviewers commmented about. The hotel is a jewel and we're so happy to have found it for the 5 nights we stayed. This hotel is extremely dog-friendly. They provide a magnetic sticker for your door to warn housekeeping not to enter. Housekeeping was always quick and courteous about coming in and cleaning when we told them we'd have the dog out of the room for a walk. Desk staff was always helpful and friendly. Room was huge and comfortable with great pillows. However, bathtub was extremely slippery and needs skid strips or something. I almost fell several times. Breakfast was good and plentiful (even at 9:30AM on those sleep-in days). Do-it-yourself waffle stations were fun and very good. The only drawbacks- coffee was really really bad (as other have mentioned) and OJ was too sweet. It was great of the hotel to provide a computer with high speed access in a little nook. I had no problems with waits for the computer but the toner on the printer was low and one day the computer was down. I do have to say this place has the slowest elevator on earth! As for location, Wow! Take a left out of the driveway for the 10min drive to Disney and a right out of the driveway for the 7 min. drive to Univ. Studios. This is the back way into Univ. Studios and we NEVER had traffic since the road is largely undeveloped (for now!)

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ellen1959
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for over 4 years. It was a beautiful place in previous times. The changes this trip were very disappointing. The hotel seemed in disrepair, the rooms were dirty, no towels at pool, messes everywhere in the kitchen area. TERRIBLE COFFEE, and a state of not caring by the walking around staff. The front desk tried to be helpful, but seemed overwhelmed by demands for towels, cleaning, etc.., and just not enough staff. Seems housekeeping never was around. Plates and dirty dishes were stacked everywhere.. Gates didnt lock, security doors werent locked, and an elevator was out. We were told there was no maintenance manager to complain to. So who fixes stuff? No one I guess.The rooms were musty and dirty, and the most annoying was no towels. Its florida. No towels by the pool, no towels in the rooms, no towels to be found. And the dirty kitchen area and smelly halls and rooms were hard to be around. It;s too bad to see such a pretty place go under. I am not a Marriott rewards member but thought twice now about joining. I probably will not return to this once very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line, GREAT breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Postmasterrings
Reviews.Content: Split up our stay at 3 different places on our 10 day trip and this was by far the favorite of us all. Stayed 7 nights at a our exchange resort, Parkway International, and stayed 2 nights at the Savona Suiets a couple miles away. The beds here are heavenly as opposed to the rock hard Parkway International and the sloped and wore out mattress at Sanona. The free breakfast is really above and beyond and will not go into all they had. I should have went with my instincts and cancelled the Savona the last two nights we stayed and went back to the Residence, but I always think I may find something better. I got it at the government rate of $98 a night as I am an employee, but they never checked my ID there or at the Savona,(hint hint)! We were a party of 4 and had one room with a king and another room with two queens, with two bathrooms. What a deal and less then five minutes from Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the great reviews posted by Trip Advisor Members, but was truly disappointed by the entire experience. I was disappointed in the front desk staff, the maintenance of the hotel and pool, and the "free" breakfast. I requested an early check-in when I made my reservation back in March and confirmed it with the reservation specialists at Marriott several times. Of course they were not able to accomodate my request for early check-in. What a surprise! We went to lunch and then waited in the lobby for two hours before our room was ready. My parents checked into their room to find that the clearly marked "non-smoking" room smelled like a chimney! Marriott took 3 hours to have someone come to remove the odor and then commented to my parents that they were disappointed by the call they received from Marriott Customer Care officials regarding my parents complaint about the smoke. Well, if they had to wait 3 hours to be attended to they would complain as well. On day 5 of our stay we ventured out to the pool only to find that it was full of dead insects and other debris. Disgusting! According to their website they serve a hot breakfast from 6:30am - 10:45am. That is not exactly true. There were several days when they ran out of hot food by 9:00am and we were left with the cereal and bagels. Not exactly my idea of a hot breakfast. The housekeeping staff did an okay job, but soon took on the role of super housekeepers once I started leaving a tip and written requests for general cleaning chores. I enjoyed Orlando and all of the great activities we have come to love, but the Residence Inn in Lake Buena Vista will never see my smiling face or my dollars again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sethandliz
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am rating this as 5 stars based on accomodations for a family traveling to Disney. It is in no way a " 5 Star Hotel" in the traditional sense. We ended up at this hotel by chance. It is a long, irrlevelant story but we traveled to Orlando on a whim and did minimal hotel research. We quickly looked online at hotels(--) for the best rates and then based the decision mostly on tripadvisor reviews. This hotel is located about 2 miles from the Disney gates. If you have never been to Disney, it's important to know that the property "inside the park" is just huge. Miles and miles. So even if a hotel advertises that they are inside Disney, you can't walk to the parks and still need to take a shuttle or drive. So being 2 miles from Disney is really no big deal. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to the parks which we did not use. Within the 2 miles between the hotel and the parks, there are tons of well-known restaurants (Olive Garden, Joe's Crab Shack, Chili's, Bertucci's, Macaroni Grill, Buffalo Wild Wings, Chevy's, Denny's, Shoney's and much much more) so you are not forced to eat inside Disney if you don't want to. (As an aside, the restaurants inside Disney or okay but they usually have very long waits). We preferred eating outside the park so the waits weren't as long and our toddler wouldn't get cranky. The rooms at the Resdence Inn are perfect for famiies. We got upgraded from a standard suite to a family suite and our rate was only $90/night in June. The family suite had a bedroom area with a very comfortable queen bed. It also had a kids bedroom area with two twin beds and a living room are with a pullout couch. Each of the three areas had its own TV (but sometimes when you aimed the remote at one set, it turned on multiple sets, hahah). There is a also a small, full kitchen complete with a microwave, stove, range, dishwasher, plates/silverware and fridge. This is a huge savings for a family. The Winn Dixie is just a mile away so you can stock up on drinks and snacks and you can even cook your own meals if you choose. Another reviewer said they froze bottles of water and brought them to the parks. That was a great tip! I did this and the water stayed cold and lasted most of the day (water at the park is $2/bottle). I also bought those little Crystal Light mixes that go directly into bottled water and froze lemonade and iced tea for the parks too. Our room was a handicapped accessible room so the shower did not have a tub. That made it a little tough to bathe our toddler. So if you have small children you may want to turn down a handicapped accessible room unless they don't mind hopping in a shower. The pool was very nice. It was clean and well maintained. There is a small kiddie pool as well as a jacuzzi. Our room was on the first floor facing the pool so we could hear the kids simming and screaming in the evening which was a little annoying - but, hey, it's orlando and you can't escape the kids. I never saw the pool bar open while I was there which means nothing to me but other reviewers were bothered by that. On to the free breakfast. The quality was decent and there was a very wide assortment. This is a huge cost savings for a family! It's not the typical "continental breakfast" that hotels provide. There were eggs, sausage, tortillas, biscuits, bagels, yogurts, muffins, cereals, a mickey mouse waffle maker and much more! You can eat up and then just eat a light lunch at the parks. I also took some snacks for the road like fruit and I filled styrofoam coffee cups with cheerios and fruit loops for my daughter to snack on at the park. I know I probaby wasn't supposed to take food out with me, but oh well.... Other stuff to note: There is one computer in the lobby with free internet access. Free USA Today every day. A concierge that helps with Disney stuff and has lots of info. A game room with some videogames and air hockey for the kids. A machine to rent movies to watch in the room for $5 (the selection was a little weak, but lots of family-friendly stuff). Every evening from 5-6 there were free snacks by the pool. Thursday evening is a free poolside BBQ with burgers, dog, chips, beer, wine etc. but we didn't never made it. Overall, we had a great time and would stay there again. It was a great bang for the buck and very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Babs_ohio
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 10:30 am and expected to be ask to return at 3-4 pm, however that was not the case. We were warmly greeted and checked into a a larger room than we had requested. Our reservation was for 5 nights in a room with a king bed and full kitchen. We received for $109 + tax per night from June 4-9, 2006 a room with a king bed room with bath, a living room with full kitchen and an bedroom with 2 queen beds and a bath all in excellent condition and very clean. The full kitchen included everything we needed except. I would bring the following, a small bottle of dish soap, sandwich baggies, if your packing sandwiches to take to the theme parks, extra napkins, and a couple extra small garbage bags. We want to Sam's Club and purchased food that worked out great. Very nice laundry facility on each floor. $1.50 per wash (30 min) and $1.50 per dry (45 min) work wonderful. Breakfast and hospitality A++. Thursday night cookout was very good with burgers, hot dogs, chips and complimentary beer and wine. Location was convenient to I-4. Turning right to Florida Central Park Way to I-4 was smooth flow. Going left out of hotel takes you through a nice, but congested restaurant row. Highly recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMC1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in April and were very satisfied with the hotel. The location is a bit off the beaten path, but still close enough that a short cab ride could get you where you wanted to go. The Disney shuttle didn't show up one morning, but the hotel was quick to rectify the problem (at their cost). All the staff were friendly (got a smile and a hello from all of them as you passed them on the property), helpful, and always looked like they were enjoying themselves. The breakfast was a great timesaver and the selection was great. There were always healthy choices to start your day and they never seemed to run out of anything. The Thursday evening barbecue was a nice touch after a long day at the parks, and again all the staff working at it were enjoying interacting with the guests. The Manager was on property and visible talking to guests many times over the 6 days. The rooms were clean and spacious, the beds were very comfortable. Having a 1-bedroom suite was great for a family and cost about the same as a matchbox room elsewhere would have cost. I would definitely stay here again when I return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent Easter week here with our two teenage boys. Had a 2-bedroom suite which was ideal for a family, especially one with older kids. The beds and pillows were exceptionally comfortable. After spending 12+ hours at theme parks, it was delightful to come back to where we could all have our own space. The hot breakfast was impressive, kept well-stocked and with enough variety that you didn't feel that you had to eat the same thing every day. We found the location ideal with easy access to I-4 and no traffic between us and Disney as well as a large selection of restaurants within a 1/2 mile drive. You definitely do need a car here though as the shuttle service to Disney is fairly limited and there are no eateries within easy walking distance. We would return here with no hesitation. I will add that we did spend one night at a Universal property where we spent twice as much money for one small room but gained access to the Express Pass system which we found invaluable when in their two theme parks. Although we were glad we had done this (the Express Pass you get when you stay at a Universal resort virtually eliminates lines), we were very happy to return to the expansive space of the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great for bigger families”
Reviews.Author: orlaaoife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 6 to 14th, We had a great time. We have four children and the ability to have tow separate rooms, two bathrooms, and free breakfast…wow that was great!. It was 10 minutes to every park. no hassles. Food was good, staff was friendly, pool was just right. Plenty of towels and extras. Even a paper everyday. On top of all of this price was perfect. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 12-15, 2006. This is a very nice hotel. It is fairly new, very clean, and in a good location. It is close to downtown disney lake buena vista. It is just of Palm Way, a road that runs parallel to I-4, which is convenient for getting to SeaWorld, Universal, and Wet N Wild among other places. The breakfast included in the rate was very good (lots of choice) and it is available until 10:45am (if you wish to sleep in). The pool area was very nice (lagoon shape) open till 10pm. We paid $125 per night for a one bedroom suite (separate bedroom and full kitchen with a couch area. 2 TVs, free newspaper) This was perfect for two people. It is nice to have more space when staying at hotel for several nights in a row. The bed is very soft, but you can ask for a bed board to place under the matress if you prefer a more firm matress. It was very quiet after 10pm when the pool closed. Our room faced the pool area. The rooms facing I-4 would likely be more noisy since that portion of the hotel is right against the highway. The air conditioning unit is somewhat loud but we got used to it by the second night. Just a short drive to plenty of restaurants. There is a grocery store in a shopping plaza at the corner of SR 535 and Hotel Plaza Blvd (minutes from the hotel). I recommend a car rental as shuttles are limited and there are no stores or restaurants within walking distance. They allowed us to check in 2 hours early (check in is at 4pm and check out is at noon). Front desk staff is very pleasant. We would definitely stay here again. We plan to return to this hotel next year with the kids and will likely go for the two bedroom suite.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: ldcjr
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from our vacation at Disney. We have three children and stayed in a family suite. The room was very spacious and fully equipped. The breakfast each morning was amazing! Everything you could ask for, and plenty of it! My children loved making their own Mickey shaped waffles. We had our own car, so I cannot comment on the shuttle services. My husband and I both said that we couldn't think of a reason to stay anywhere else the next time we visited Disney! What a value! We paid $114/night for an amazing room, great pool, super location, wonderful breakfast....we couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “A Interesting Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrlasvegasio
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days at the Residence Inn at Lake Buena Vista. We ran into some problems regarding our room, but after the Management made some adjustments to our room rate, the problem was resolved. The hotel is isolated in a swamp or old orange orchard area next to Interstate 4. You'll need a car because you be walking through some brush and swamp to reach anyplace. The hotel is located 5 minutes from Seaworld, 5 minutes to Disney World, and 10 minutes to Universal using the road in front of the hotel. The room was ok. Housekeeping was very good. Staff was very friendly. Marc and Mimi of the front desk were excellent. My only concern was security. The outside exterior doors were propped open even at night. No key needed. You could also shake the door if it was closed to open it. No security person walking around. People from the outside were putting flyers under the room doors for different food places in the area. The breakfast buffet was good but got old after 7 days. Overall the hotel was nice but not perfect. We may stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot/Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OntarioBarrie
Reviews.Content: My Son and I just got back from 9 days at the Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista Orlando. I was so impressed with this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. One day we missed the shuttle to Disney so they called me a cab and the hotel picked up the tab. The breakfast was great all you could eat and more. The beds were the most comfortable I think I have ever slept in. The rooms were kept spotless. The pool area was terrific. They supplied towels everywhere so you didn't have to take towels from your room to use. I will come back to this hotel, hopefully next year 2007. I could not find one bad thing to write about..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very clean, stafff was excellent; especially housekeeping, we stayed in a 2-bedroom unit was very happy, had a problem in our room the first night, was please with how they took care of us, family enjoyed breakfast and the "home" feel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hoffee
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults and 3 children) stayed here from Jan. 7 through Jan. 14 and it was wonderful. We had a two bedroom suite and liked having the living room in the middle with the kitchen. The two bathrooms too were great. The hot breakfast saved us money and time and it was great with everything you would want. Our suite was quiet and clean and of course the beds were great. The beds were what you expect from Marriot and they were wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel and their friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Make sure you are staying at the right "Residence" as we thought we had booked at the Marriott Residence at Seaworld and it turned out we were at the Marriott Residence Buena Vista on Marabella Palms Court. Our travel agent got them mixed up. Since the Marriott Seaworld was fully booked, they sent us to the Residence Buena Vista and to compensate for the mixup, they upgraded us from a one bedroom to a two bedroom suite. With our two teenagers, this was great. We overlooked the pool on the 5th floor and it was very quiet. We stayed from Dec 26 to Jan 2 and found the staff (Rebecca in particular) very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a great way to start the day. We didn't find it crowded or noisy at all and it was the busiest time of the year! (We usually ate before 8 am) The road close by (Turkey Lane Road) is a fantastic route to Universal Studios - much less used than the highways and gets you to Universal very quickly. It's also conveniently located to Disneyworld, Outlet Malls, Restaurants, etc. It is great value especially with the breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Practical”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 night stay in this hotel (December). I must say I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful with everything. They often provided printed out driving directions to many places; just ask at the front desk. Location wise, the hotel is very practical – minutes from all of the Disney attractions, and literally 5 minutes from Sea World. We rented a car and I would highly recommend renting a car if you stay in this hotel. There are lots of restaurants within close driving distance. There are not restaurants on the property. They provide a complimentary breakfast buffet, which is great and an easy way to start the day. Disney is very easy to get to from this hotel – maybe a fifteen minute drive. We stayed in the two bedroom suite with 5 people. I would say we had plenty of room. Having two bathrooms to get ready in the morning is very convenient. There is a small kitchen, although we only used the microwave and refrigerator. The last thing you want to do is cook after spending the whole day out. The hotel provides this great delivery service from many restaurants in the local area. We utilized this service twice – very convenient. Overall the rooms are clean and comfortable. Beds were actually soft. Plenty of towels available. The hotel is by no means a resort hotel, but it is affordable, practical, and comfortable. I am the type of person that likes to stay and 4 and 5 star hotels when I go to Hawaii or the Caribbean, but I also spend a few days at the hotel. If you plan on doing Disney or Universal every day, I would highly recommend this hotel. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to a friend. One last tip – If you don’t want to drive, meaning taking shuttles to the disney area, and want to pay a lot of money for a room that you are never in, then stay in the Disney resort area. I personally don’t think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tessar
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner have just returned from Florida after marrying in Key West. We spent the last 3 days of our Holiday at the Residence Inn. The staff were absolutely fabulous. Marc and Rebecca on reception very kindly presented us with a wedding cake upon hearing we had just married. Our two bedroom apartment was very spacious and comfortable. The outdoor hot tub was perfect after a day's activity. The breakfast (included in the price) was very enjoyable with lots of choice. This is one of the better hotels we have stayed in, and a fantastic location. Thank you to the staff for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Hollymum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite with a three year old and 8 month old and it was great. The rooms were very clean and the kitchens well provided with crockery etc. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel had a relaxed feel to it. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice and a large dining room overlooking the very nice pool. Request a room overlooking the pool rather than the road as these can be noisy. Would stay again and not hesitate in recommending it. Close to Seaworld and not far from Disney. Plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The cleanliness was very good and you could tell this hotel made cleanliness and great service a priority. For being in such a high traffice location they really do a great job of talking to you like you are an important guest and we really appreciated that very much. We come to Orlando every year and we liked how this hotel was "off the beatan path" and less of a cookie cutter property but still minutes from everything. You can't walk from the property to anything because there is no sidewalk by then entrance but for us that didn't matter we didn't want to walk to anything anyway we drove to our destinations. Our stay was great and this willbe our new Orlando hotel from now on. I travel on business all yeay and this hotel has got it down pat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with two thirteen-year olds in a two bedroom suite, which also had a living room with pull-out sofa and a large kitchen. The place was comfortable, clean, and conveniently located between Disney World and SeaWorld. Great hot and cold breakfasts with a lot of choice. Friendly staff. All this for not much more than the price of a regular room elsewhere. This was my second stay, and will continue to be my preferred location in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay...Again this year!! Maybe best ever.”
Reviews.Author: akbunti
Reviews.Content: Well, for the second year in a row we have had a lovely stay at the Residence Inn Orlando Lake Buena Vista. I was afraid after reading some of the reviews, that things had changed. However the hotel was still wonderful, maybe even better. And the terrific price made it even sweeter. We found the same front desk staff we had last year, and they remembered us, and were very helpful and friendly. We were allowed to check in early without the blink of an eye. Our two, 2 bedroom suites were spotless and well stocked. I mentioned I was a big coffee drinker, and from then on there were three packets of coffee for our pot in our room each day instead of just one. One of the reasons we choose this hotel is that with nine of us traveling together, the breakfast buffet is a real bonus, as well as a time and moneysaver. If you factor that in, our room was even a better deal. The breakfast buffet had 3 kinds of Juice, coffee, tea, milk, herb teas. It had 3 cold cereals and 2 hot...plus granola. There were muffins, danish and breakfast breads, yogurts and fresh fruit...both whole and cut for having with the yogurt. There was a toast station with light and dark bread for toasting, raisen bread, bagels, english muffins and butter, margarine, honey, jams, p-nut butter, etc. They had sausage and bacon everyday, plus scrambled eggs and either hotcakes, french toast or biscuits and gravy. They also had tortillas, cheeses, salsa and croissants. There were 3 Mickey Mouse waffle irons with the batter ready to go, and various syrups and toppings for them. After most of us ate, we would fill a plate to take back to the room for the sleepyheads. One day one of the staff followed me to the elevator to help carry the stuff. There was more than enough choices to keep all 9 of us happy for the 4 days we were there...very good buffet. I often wonder what folks are used to who find this type of spread inadequate. Everything in the room worked, (all 3 TVS, vcr, kitchen appliances, etc) and access to high speed internet was a plus. The beds were oh so comfortable, and we heard no noise from the corridors. We were on the third floor. We enjoyed the pool, with its plentiful fluffy towels and tropical lancscaping, the pool bar and the hotels proximity to Disney. The Jaccuzzi was just the right temp to soothe aching "Disney feet", and relax for sleep. The suites had one bedroom with a king, one with 2 queens, and a large living room/ kitchen with a sleeper sofa, which was better then the average one. There were 2 bathrooms in each suite, which were spotless with high end shampoos and conditioners. We had a rental car so didn't use the shuttle to the parks, but the folks in the room next to us said it worked well for them. Each morning our USA today was there to enjoy withour coffee. All in all another great stay. As good as a much higher priced property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dboy36
Reviews.Content: Usually, I write my reviews right after staying at a hotel. I'm planning next years vacation and I wanted to check reviews on this hotel since we had stayed here before and I noticed I did not write one for our first stay. So, I thought I would make up for that now. My wife and I and our 5 children stayed here for spring break. The kids range in age from 4-15. We booked our trip through All Guest Services. (I would post their web address but I want this review posted to help others thinking about staying here.) They had an area right in the lobby of the hotel. They took care of everything for us from our hotel reservation to our Disney tickets which were waiting for us at check in. For 5 nights and four days and Four day Disney Park Hopper tickets for seven of us, they saved us almost $1000 versus booking through a travel agent or on our own. We had a two bedroom suite. Our two daughters (15 and 11) took one bedroom. Our son (13) slept on the sleeper sofa and the twins (4) slept in the king size bed with my wife and I. At home they usually sneek into bed with us (queen size) and they take up all the room. In this bed we didn't even know they were near us that's how big the bed was. We had two bathrooms and a full service kitchen. This came in handy as the grocery store was nearby and we could pick up items for dinner or to snack on and not spend all of our money eating out or on vending machines for snacks. The breakfast selection was very good in the morning. A lot of varity. Fruit, cereal, biscuts and gravey, yougurt, danish's, eggs, sausage, pancakes and waffles. The pool area was nice and clean. All of the staff we ran into was excellent. Our housekeeper was the same for the week we were there and she took great care of us. The nicest thing about this hotel was it's location. We were far enough away from the other hotels (at the time, this was the only hotel in this area). But we were close enough to the Disney properties, stores, restaurants and anything else we could need. All of our kids loved the pool. The oldest kids had fun in the game room. My wife and I enjoyed relaxing by the pool with a couple of drinks at the poolside bar while the kids swam after a day running around the Disney parks. All in all, we had a great time and it was an excellent family vacation and the Residence Inn was a big part of that. After looking at the reviews posted since we stayed, I don't have any problems with staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be good”
Reviews.Author: nhfiremanpaul
Reviews.Content: When this location first opened up they had a great staff of people. Unfortunately things have changed since a new management company took over. I found the front desk staff to be a bit snobby. Not the friendly "Welcome Home" attitude that Residence Inn in general is know for. We used to stay at this hotel ever year for a week. We would take two to three rooms and make it a family vacation. Unfortunately this last time we went was not at all what we were used too. When we first came in we were immediately told "CHECK IN IS AFTER 3PM". It was 2:45. When we got in our rooms we found out they were not what we had asked for. We need two, two bedroom suites. We got two family suites, (A one bedroom with a bump out with two small beds) and were still being charged for a two bedroom. We called down and they said we were upgraded to this room... this was no upgrade for a two bedroom, it was an upgrade for a one bedroom. Finally we were told we could have the two bedrooms we had reservation for but they said they would not come get out luggage and move us, we would have to come down and get the keys. After than the vacation went down hill regarding this hotel. The breakfast was limited. They would only put out a little bit at a time. The breakfast host yelled at my son when he went up and got seconds on pan cakes. I finally had to go up and get my son's food and she gave me a dirty look. The Front Office manager Orlando (Yes, his name is Orlando) had no response about my complaints. He made excuses about being busy and we should understand because we are a regular. Well we are not regulars anymore. For the Price we paid we could easily stay on Disney rather be treated like dirt. Usually companies treat repeat clients like gold. We were treated like we were bothering them. We will never stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Try and get a quiet room and go to breakfast early!!”
Reviews.Author: Leamsi
Reviews.Content: We just returned (my mother, son, and I) from a ten day or so trip to Orlando to go to Disney World. We stayed at the Residence Inn, Lake Buena Vista near the entrance to Disney World. I recommend it for groups for the cost and convenience, but if you are a party of three or less you can be overwhelmed by the groups (large ones) at breakfast, in the pool and the lobby. I would prefer a hotel with a mixture of suites and rooms the next time to avoid the crowds. Breakfast was a noisy, messy affair in spite of the hotel staff's best efforts. We ran into too many kids unattended, running around, serving themselves, and basically making a big mess. There is a nice pool which younger kids would like. The staff was VERY nice and helpful. Our room was in a great location (on the street side of the hotel), near the parking lot, and we avoided noise from the pool and from I-4. Try and ask for a quiet room. It was a one bedroom suite with two queen beds and a pull out. Quiet and clean. Some downsides were: the internet didn't work for most of the time we were there, the toaster didn't work, the sheets were not fitted and should be renewed, and the beds were far too soft. We enjoyed the hotel's location, at the end of a strip of hotels, which might seem far for some, but it was quiet. I would recommend a car as I understand that the shuttle only goes to Epcot and then you take the internal Disney transportation. Disney world was super crowded so getting in your quiet car and going to your quiet location at the end of the day is a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Crow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn while in between a business trip and family vacation the end of May and June. Overall my impression is very positive. The hotel location is very good and central to a lot of amenities. Service was outstanding with staff providing prompt service and answering all my questions about the area. Rooms are well appointed and the added mini-kitchen provides an added benefit as does the complimentary hot breakfast. I would definitely recommend this to others travelling in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Carameltwist
Reviews.Content: Great service, We checked in July 9, 2005 for 2 days for a family of 4. Fast check in room given was for the handicap with a shower only, called the front desk and right away was changed into a room with a tub and shower.Bedroom had 2 double beds and a living area with a sectional sofa. Adequate enough room for all of us. Baskeball and tennis offered with equipment at the front desk for free of charge. The only thing I did not like was the ability of the guest to bring their animals in at liberty to stay in the rooms. Don't get me wrong I have a pet(dog) but everyone is not clean and fleas could be a part of some owners lives. Other than that great stay good hot breakfast but will not stay again due to pets are allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family of 5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were impressed. The first 6 nights of our trip we stayed at Disneys Port Orleans and were not impressed. The Residence Inn was a welcome sight starting with the ability to check in 3 hours in advance to the almost nightly light dinners/snacks to the wonderful free breakfast buffet. Our room was spotless upon returning at the end of the day- they even washed the dishes! Management was very friendly and the kids wondered why we didn't stay their our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and wished we could have stayed longer. Everything was very clean (which is my most important factor) and the staff was always very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great every morning! It was so nice to have a hot buffet breakfast with variety instead of the same old continental breakfasts. The pool was nice, too. The wireless internet is only said to work in the lobby and pool area, but we had a room on the 3rd floor with a window that faced the pool and the wireless internet worked there, too. We would stay here again with no hesitation as long as the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scorpgurl
Reviews.Content: My Family just returned from a 7 day stay. We were in Orlando for an AAU Girls Basketball tournament. This hotel was very clean, spacious and well run. It makes being away from home very comfortable and convenient. Full breakfast each day and snacks in the afternoon. It's location is very central to all of the various Orlando attractions as well as the AAU basketball playing locations. The pool is not overly large (no slides or diving boards), so it doesn't or shouldn't be a distraction to the athletes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: flysan
Reviews.Content: We are frequent Orlando visitors. First time staying here, have tried many other hotels. This one is great! It's actually sits somewhat by itself at the end of a street full of hotels (nice ones) but right near the highway. As other reviewers noted, ask for an inside room, I'm sure an outside room is going to have traffic/highway noise. We stayed for 8 nights in June 2005 and it felt like home. Very nice staff. Good breakfast. Nice pool. If you want some peace and quiet after a day at the parks, this is the place. We all slept great. I know the place was full but I never heard anyone. And at various breakfast times we always found a table to sit and there was always plenty of food. The staff here seems to be mostly European with stupendous service and wonderful attitudes. The beds are incredibly comfortable. We had the 2bed/2bath which had plenty of room, a nice big kitchen, and 3 TV's! If I had to give 1/2 point off of a perfect 10 it would be that there are no balconies, just a personal preference of mine. Feel free to book this hotel with no fear, you will not be sorry! You will not be pestered at all by the timeshare people either. In fact, we had one message on our phone inviting us to a presentation, and we mentioned it to the manager, and he was really peeved about it and said he would take care of it, and it is NOT supposed to happen. He was mad that they had "hacked" his phone system to leave the message.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got back from my stay at the Residence Inn a few weeks ago and I had a blast. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was bigger and better then I had imagined. They even had a Mickey Mouse waffle maker where you can make your own waffles. My boyfriend and I arrived very early (3 hours before check-in) and the people at the front desk upgraded us to a bigger suite. The rooms were very clean and they even provided us with popcorn and coffee in the room. Most of the nights we were there they also offered a snack/ light meal at around 5 for free as well. One night was hot dogs and meatballs, another was cookies... The shuttle had 3 pick-up times in the morning for Disney and 3 drop-off times at night. I would recommed renting a car while you're there if possible though because it costs quite a bit of money to take a taxi anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “We made a good choice staying here”
Reviews.Author: RNandfamily
Reviews.Content: I did not choose the "excellent" because everything would have to be absolutely perfect if I rated a hotel excellent. The only reason I did not rate this hotel excellent was that the sheets on the bed were not fitted and no matter the size of the person sleeping in them, they always bunched up and you woke up with the botton sheet basically off the bed. Other than that, we could not have asked for a better stay. The beds are very comfortable (and I am picky) and the staff were very friendly and wanted to help. Don't bother bringing food with you because of what you hear about the increased cost of food, we just didn't find large prices. A few things were higher than what we normallly pay, but not by much. There is a Winn Dixie about 4-5 minutes away. Go ahead and get their customer card and save even more money. Be sure to buy dish soap unless you want to run the dishwasher every day for just a few dishes. Our room overlooked IH-4 and I was afraid that the highway noise would keep me (the sleeper that can hear a cat walk on carpet) up, but the noise actually acted like "white noise" and that coupled with our full days resulted in me having the best night sleep. The kids loved the pool and we loved the breakfast buffet. The food was tasty, hot and in generous portions. We were even allowed to bring cereal and donuts back to the room for our kids that were sleeping in. The hotel was very close to Disney and Sea World and after driving in the bumper to bumper constant traffic on International Boulevard, I am SOOOOO glad we did not stay off in a hotel located on that road. We even took advantage of the free shuttle to Disney and found it very helpful. We would return here again and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer...even better the 2nd time around!”
Reviews.Author: sayhi2tinee
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4-night stay here and it was even better than the great time we had when we first stayed here in August 2004. I was able to get a room over Memorial Day weekend at the last minute and at the price I wanted. I came in early around 9:30am to check in (because I had to check out of another hotel) and my room wasn't ready but they took down my cell phone number and called me around noon to let me know that my room was ready! The free buffet breakfast has a lot to offer, even right up to the end. We got breakfast around 9:30-9:45am each morning, and they were still bringing out hot food. I was worried that we'd get cold leftovers at that time but that wasn't the case. The room was spacious and the king bed we had was very soft. There were lots of channels to watch on the TV, even HBO. The TVs also had VCR players and you could borrow fairly recent movies from the "vending" machines by each of the elevators. The movies cost $5.95 (I don't know how long you can keep them out but it seemed like a good price). The only problem we had was finding a parking space late Saturday night during Memorial Day weekend. Every single space was taken and we had to park on the street in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A place you can bring your family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night which is our limit with a new hotel in Orlando becuse we've been disapointed so many times but this was lovely. We stayed a Thursday night. We requested an early check in so our children could take a nap and they accomodated us. On Thursday nights they have a barbeque with free hamburgers and hotdogs by the pool. Most weekdays they seem to do something, free snacks or dessert. The hotel breakfast buffet the next morning, which they even included with the AAA rate which not all Marriots will do, was also excellent with a nice selection. The room, we had the family suite, was nice. My only complaint was the only access to the bathroom was through the master bedroom. We would probable get a two bedroom next time but the rooms were large with a nice kitchen and living room. Don't plan on relying on there snack shop for your food, not a large selection, but they did have swimmies for three dollars and that was worth every penny for not having to get back in the car so our three year old could swim. I will definately return with my family again.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Lake Buena Vista
HotelInfo.Address: 11450 Marbella Palm Court, Orlando, FL 32836
